#期货交易管理暂行条例##第一章　总则**第一条**　为了规范期货交易行为，加强对期货交易的监督管理，维护期货市场秩序，防范风险，保护期货交易各方的合法权益和社会公共利益，制定本条例。**第二条**　从事期货交易及其相关活动的，必须遵守本条例。**第三条**　从事期货交易活动，应当遵循公开、公平、公正和诚实信用的原则。禁止欺诈、内幕交易和操纵期货交易价格等违法行为。**第四条**　期货交易必须在期货交易所内进行。禁止不通过期货交易所的场外期货交易。**第五条**　中国证券监督管理委员会（以下简称中国证监会）对期货市场实行集中统一的监督管理。##第二章　期货交易所**第六条**　设立期货交易所，由中国证监会审批。未经中国证监会批准，任何单位或者个人不得设立或者变相设立期货交易所。**第七条**　期货交易所不以营利为目的，按照其章程的规定实行自律管理。期货交易所以其全部财产承担民事责任。**第八条**　期货交易所会员应当是在中华人民共和国境内登记注册的企业法人。取得期货交易所会员资格，应当经期货交易所批准，并交纳会员资格费。期货交易所会员由期货经纪公司会员和非期货经纪公司会员组成。**第九条**　期货交易所设理事会。理事长、副理事长由中国证监会提名，理事会选举产生。期货交易所设总经理、副总经理，由中国证监会任免。总经理为期货交易所的法定代表人。**第十条**　有证券法第一百零一条规定的情形或者中国证监会规定的其他情形的，不得担任期货交易所的高级管理人员、财务会计人员。**第十一条**　期货交易所的工作人员应当忠实履行职务，不得以任何方式为自己从事期货交易，不得泄露内幕信息或者利用内幕信息获得非法利益。**第十二条**　期货交易所的工作人员履行职务，遇有与本人或者其亲属有利害关系的情形时，应当回避。**第十三条**　期货交易所的工作人员在任职期间或者离开期货交易所未满一年的，不得在该期货交易所的会员单位任职。国家公务员不得在期货交易所任职。**第十四条**　期货交易所履行下列职能：（一）提供期货交易的场所、设施和服务；（二）设计期货合约、安排期货合约上市；（三）组织、监督期货交易、结算和交割；（四）保证期货合约的履行；（五）制定和执行本条例第三十五条规定的风险管理制度；（六）中国证监会规定的其他职能。**第十五条**　期货交易所不得从事信托投资、股票交易、非自用不动产投资等与其职能无关的业务。禁止期货交易所直接或者间接参与期货交易。**第十六条**　当期货市场出现异常情况时，期货交易所可以按照其章程规定的权限和程序，决定采取下列紧急措施，并应当立即报告中国证监会：（一）提高保证金；（二）调整涨跌停板幅度；（三）限制会员或者客户的最大持仓量；（四）暂时停止交易；（五）采取其他紧急措施。前款所称异常情况，是指在交易中发生操纵市场并严重扭曲价格形成的行为或者不可抗力的突发事件以及中国证监会规定的其他情形。异常情况消失后，期货交易所应当及时取消紧急措施。**第十七条**　期货交易所有下列情形之一的，应当经中国证监会批准：（一）制定或者修改章程、业务规则；（二）上市、中止、取消或者恢复期货交易品种；（三）上市、修改或者终止期货合约；（四）中国证监会规定的其他情形。**第十八条**　期货交易所的所得收益应当按照国家有关规定管理和使用，不得分配给会员，不得挪作他用。期货交易所的税后所得按照国家有关规定提取公益金后，应当全部转作公积金，用于弥补以后年度发生的亏损。**第十九条**　期货交易所的合并、分立，由中国证监会审批。**第二十条**　期货交易所因下列情形之一解散：（一）章程规定的营业期限届满，会员大会决定不再延续；（二）会员大会决定解散；（三）中国证监会决定关闭。期货交易所因前款第（一）项、第（二）项情形解散的，由中国证监会审批。##第三章　期货经纪公司**第二十一条**　设立期货经纪公司，应当符合公司法的规定，并应当具备下列条件：（一）注册资本最低限额为人民币3000万元；（二）主要管理人员和业务人员必须具有期货从业资格；（三）有固定的经营场所和合格的交易设施；（四）有健全的管理制度；（五）中国证监会规定的其他条件。**第二十二条**　设立期货经纪公司，必须经中国证监会批准，取得中国证监会颁发的期货经纪业务许可证，并在国家工商行政管理局登记注册。未经中国证监会批准，任何单位或者个人不得从事期货经纪业务，不得在其名称中使用“期货经纪”、“期货代理”或者其他类似字样。**第二十三条**　期货经纪公司根据业务需要可以设立营业部，作为分支机构。设立营业部应当符合中国证监会规定的条件，经中国证监会批准，取得中国证监会颁发的经营许可证，并在国家工商行政管理局登记注册。营业部在期货经纪公司授权范围内依法开展业务，其民事责任由期货经纪公司承担。**第二十四条**　期货经纪公司接受客户委托，以自己的名义为客户进行期货交易，交易结果由客户承担。**第二十五条**　期货经纪公司除接受客户委托，从事期货交易所上市期货合约的买卖、结算、交割及相关服务业务外，不得从事其他业务。期货经纪公司不得从事或者变相从事期货自营业务。**第二十六条**　期货经纪公司有下列情形之一的，应当经中国证监会批准，并在国家工商行政管理局办理变更登记：（一）变更法定代表人；（二）变更注册资本；（三）变更股东或者股权结构；（四）变更住所或者营业场所；（五）变更或者终止营业部；（六）中国证监会规定的其他情形。**第二十七条**　期货经纪公司因下列情形之一解散的，应当结清受委托的业务，并依法返还客户的保证金：（一）营业期限届满，股东会决定不再延续；（二）股东会决定解散；（三）因合并或者分立需要解散；（四）破产；（五）中国证监会决定关闭。期货经纪公司因前款第（一）项、第（二）项、第（三）项情形解散的，由中国证监会审批。期货经纪公司解散，应当在国家工商行政管理局办理注销登记。##第四章　期货交易基本规则**第二十八条**　在期货交易所内进行期货交易的，必须是期货交易所会员。期货经纪公司会员只能接受客户委托从事期货经纪业务，非期货经纪公司会员只能从事期货自营业务。期货交易所会员应当委派出市代表进入交易场所内进行期货交易。出市代表只能接受本会员单位的交易指令，不得接受其他单位、个人的交易指令或者为其提供咨询意见，不得为自己进行期货交易。**第二十九条**　期货经纪公司接受客户委托为其进行期货交易，应当事先向客户出示风险说明书，经客户签字确认后，与客户签订书面合同。期货经纪公司不得向客户作获利保证或者与客户约定分享利益或者共担风险，不得接受公司、企业或者其他经济组织以个人的名义委托进行期货交易，不得将受托业务进行转委托或者接受转委托业务。**第三十条**　下列单位和个人不得从事期货交易，期货经纪公司不得接受其委托为其进行期货交易：（一）金融机构、事业单位和国家机关；（二）中国证监会的工作人员；（三）期货市场禁止进入者；（四）未能提供开户证明文件的单位；（五）中国证监会规定不得从事期货交易的其他单位和个人。**第三十一条**　客户可以通过书面、电话或者中国证监会规定的其他方式，向期货经纪公司下达交易指令。客户的交易指令应当明确、全面。**第三十二条**　期货经纪公司根据客户的交易指令，为其进行期货交易。期货经纪公司不得未经客户委托或者不按照客户委托范围，擅自进行期货交易。**第三十三条**　期货经纪公司向客户提供的期货市场行情应当真实、准确，不得隐瞒重要事项或者使用其他不正当手段诱骗客户发出交易指令。**第三十四条**　期货交易所应当及时公布上市品种期货合约的成交量、成交价、持仓量、最高价与最低价、开盘价与收盘价和其他应当公布的信息，并保证信息的真实、准确。期货交易所不得公布价格预测信息。**第三十五条**　期货交易所应当按照国家有关规定建立、健全下列风险管理制度：（一）保证金制度；（二）每日结算制度；（三）涨跌停板制度；（四）持仓限额和大户持仓报告制度；（五）风险准备金制度；（六）中国证监会规定的其他风险管理制度。**第三十六条**　期货交易应当严格执行保证金制度。期货交易所向会员、期货经纪公司向客户收取的保证金，不得低于中国证监会规定的标准，并应当与自有资金分开，专户存放。期货交易所向会员收取的保证金，属于会员所有；期货交易所除用于会员的交易结算外，严禁挪作他用。期货经纪公司向客户收取的保证金，属于客户所有；期货经纪公司除按照中国证监会的规定为客户向期货交易所交存保证金、进行交易结算外，严禁挪作他用。期货经纪公司应当为每一个客户单独开立专门帐户、设置交易编码，不得混码交易。**第三十七条**　期货交易所、期货经纪公司应当按照中国证监会、财政部的规定提取、管理和使用风险准备金，不得挪用。**第三十八条**　期货交易所向会员、期货经纪公司向客户收取交易手续费，应当按照国务院有关部门的统一规定执行。**第三十九条**　期货交易实行集中竞价，按照价格优先、时间优先的撮合成交原则进行。**第四十条**　期货交易的结算，由期货交易所统一组织进行。期货交易所实行每日结算制度。期货交易所应当在当日收市后及时将结算结果通知会员。期货经纪公司根据期货交易所的结算结果对客户进行结算，并应当将结算结果及时通知客户。**第四十一条**　期货交易所会员的保证金不足时，该会员必须追加保证金。会员未在期货交易所统一规定的时间内追加保证金的，期货交易所应当将该会员的期货合约强行平仓，强行平仓的有关费用和发生的损失由该会员承担。期货经纪公司在客户保证金不足而客户又未能在期货经纪公司统一规定的时间内及时追加时，应当将该客户的期货合约强行平仓，强行平仓的有关费用和发生的损失由该客户承担。**第四十二条**　期货交易的交割，由期货交易所统一组织进行。期货交易所不得限制实物交割总量。交割仓库由期货交易所指定。期货交易所应当与交割仓库签订协议，明确双方的权利和义务。**第四十三条**　交割仓库不得有下列行为：（一）出具虚假仓单；（二）违反期货交易所业务规则，限制交割商品的入库、出库；（三）泄露与期货交易有关的商业秘密；（四）参与期货交易；（五）中国证监会规定的其他行为。**第四十四条**　会员在期货交易中违约的，先以该会员的保证金承担违约责任；保证金不足的，期货交易所应当以风险准备金和自有资金代为承担违约责任，并由此取得对该会员的相应追偿权。客户在期货交易中违约的，期货经纪公司比照前款规定执行。**第四十五条**　期货交易所、期货经纪公司应当保证期货交易、结算、交割资料的完整和安全。**第四十六条**　任何单位或者个人不得编造、传播有关期货交易的谣言，不得恶意串通、联手买卖或者以其他方式操纵期货交易价格。**第四十七条**　任何单位或者个人不得使用信贷资金、财政资金进行期货交易。金融机构不得为期货交易融资或者提供担保。**第四十八条**　国有企业、国有资产占控股地位或者主导地位的企业进行期货交易，限于从事套期保值业务，并应当遵守下列规定：（一）进行期货交易的品种限于其生产经营的产品或者生产所需的原材料；（二）期货交易总量应当与其同期现货交易总量相适应；（三）中国证监会的其他规定。前款企业从事套期保值业务的，应当向期货交易所或者期货经纪公司出具其法定代表人签署的文件，并经期货交易所或者期货经纪公司依照前款规定审核同意。**第四十九条**　未经批准，任何单位或者个人不得直接或者间接从事境外期货交易。确需利用境外期货市场进行套期保值的，由中国证监会会同国务院有关部门审核，报国务院批准后，颁发境外期货业务许可证。禁止期货经纪公司从事境外期货交易。##第五章　监督管理**第五十条**　期货交易所和期货经纪公司应当定期向中国证监会报送财务会计报表、有关资料和审计报告。**第五十一条**　中国证监会可以随时检查期货交易所、期货经纪公司的业务、财务状况，有权要求期货交易所、期货经纪公司提供有关资料，有权要求期货交易所提供会员、期货经纪公司提供客户的有关情况和资料；必要时，可以检查会员和客户与期货交易有关的业务、财务状况。中国证监会在检查中，发现有违法嫌疑的，可以调取、封存有关文件、资料，并应当在规定的期限内及时作出处理决定。中国证监会的工作人员在检查时，应当出示合法证件。**第五十二条**　中国证监会对有期货违法嫌疑的单位和个人有权进行询问、调查；对期货交易所、期货经纪公司、会员和客户在商业银行或者其他金融机构开立的单位存款帐户可以进行查询；对有证据证明有转移或者隐匿违法资金迹象的，可以申请司法机关予以冻结。有关单位和个人应当给予支持、配合。**第五十三条**　当期货市场出现异常情况时，中国证监会可以采取必要的风险处置措施。**第五十四条**　中国证监会对期货交易所和期货经纪公司的高级管理人员和其他期货从业人员实行资格认定制度。**第五十五条**　期货交易所应当依照本条例和中国证监会的规定，建立、健全各项规章制度，加强对期货交易所交易活动的风险控制和对会员以及期货交易所工作人员的监督管理。期货经纪公司应当建立、健全内部业务管理规则，加强对客户资信情况的审查，并应当按照期货交易所的规定，向期货交易所报告大户名单、交易情况。**第五十六条**　期货交易所总经理离任时，期货交易所应当聘请具有从事相关业务审计资格的中介机构对其进行离任审计。中国证监会认为必要时，可以指定中介机构进行离任审计。##第六章　罚则**第五十七条**　期货交易所有下列行为之一的，责令改正，给予警告，没收违法所得：（一）违反规定接纳会员的；（二）违反规定收取交易手续费的；（三）违反规定使用、分配收益的；（四）不按照规定公布信息的；（五）不按照规定向中国证监会履行报告义务的；（六）不按照规定向中国证监会报送有关文件、资料的；（七）不按照规定提取、管理和使用风险准备金的；（八）限制会员实物交割总量的；（九）任用不具备资格的期货从业人员的；（十）有违反中国证监会规定的其他行为的。期货交易所有前款所列行为之一的，对直接负责的主管人员和其他直接责任人员给予纪律处分，可以并处1万元以上10万元以下的罚款。期货交易所有本条第一款第（二）项所列行为的，应当责令退还多收取的交易手续费。**第五十八条**　期货交易所有下列行为之一的，责令改正，给予警告，没收违法所得，并处违法所得1倍以上5倍以下的罚款；没有违法所得或者违法所得不满10万元的，处10万元以上50万元以下的罚款；情节严重的，责令停业整顿：（一）未经批准，擅自制定或者修改章程、业务规则的；（二）未经批准，擅自上市、中止、取消或者恢复期货交易品种的；（三）未经批准，擅自上市、修改或者终止期货合约的；（四）允许会员在保证金不足的情况下进行期货交易的；（五）直接或者间接参与期货交易，或者从事与其职能无关的业务的；（六）违反规定收取保证金，或者挪用保证金的；（七）伪造、涂改或者不按照规定保存期货交易、结算、交割资料的；（八）未建立或者未执行涨跌停板、持仓限额和大户持仓报告制度的；（九）拒绝或者妨碍中国证监会监督检查的；（十）有违反中国证监会规定的其他行为的。期货交易所有前款所列行为之一的，对直接负责的主管人员和其他直接责任人员给予纪律处分，并处1万元以上10万元以下的罚款。**第五十九条**　期货经纪公司有下列行为之一的，责令改正，给予警告，没收违法所得，并处违法所得1倍以上3倍以下的罚款；没有违法所得或者违法所得不满10万元的，处10万元以上30万元以下的罚款；情节严重的，责令停业整顿或者吊销期货经纪业务许可证：（一）接受不符合规定条件的单位或者个人委托的；（二）接受公司、企业或者其他经济组织以个人名义委托进行期货交易的；（三）将受托业务进行转委托，或者接受转委托业务的；（四）允许客户在保证金不足的情况下进行期货交易的；（五）从事期货自营业务或者违反本条例规定的其他业务的；（六）不按照规定向中国证监会报送有关文件、资料的；（七）不按照规定提取、管理和使用风险准备金的；（八）伪造、涂改或者不按照规定保存期货交易、结算、交割资料的；（九）任用不具备资格的期货从业人员的；（十）未经批准设立营业部的；（十一）未经批准办理变更事项的；（十二）伪造、变造、出租、出借、买卖期货经纪业务许可证和经营许可证的；（十三）违反规定进行混码交易的；（十四）拒绝或者妨碍中国证监会监督检查的；（十五）有违反中国证监会规定的其他行为的。期货经纪公司有前款所列行为之一的，对直接负责的主管人员和其他直接责任人员给予纪律处分，并处1万元以上5万元以下的罚款。**第六十条**　期货经纪公司有下列欺诈客户行为之一的，责令改正，给予警告，没收违法所得，并处违法所得1倍以上5倍以下的罚款；没有违法所得或者违法所得不满10万元的，处10万元以上50万元以下的罚款；情节严重的，责令停业整顿或者吊销期货经纪业务许可证：（一）不按照规定向客户出示风险说明书，向客户作获利保证或者与客户约定分享利益、共担风险的；（二）未经客户委托或者不按照客户委托范围擅自进行期货交易的；（三）提供虚假的期货市场行情、信息，或者使用其他不正当手段，诱骗客户发出交易指令的；（四）向客户提供虚假成交回报的；（五）未将客户交易指令下达到期货交易所内的；（六）挪用客户保证金的；（七）有中国证监会规定的其他欺诈客户的行为的。期货经纪公司有前款所列行为之一的，对直接负责的主管人员和其他直接责任人员给予纪律处分，并处1万元以上10万元以下的罚款；构成犯罪的，依法追究刑事责任。任何单位或者个人编造并且传播影响期货交易的虚假信息，扰乱期货交易市场的，比照本条第一款、第二款的规定处罚；构成犯罪的，依法追究刑事责任。**第六十一条**　期货交易内幕信息的知情人员或者非法获取期货交易内幕信息的人员，在对期货交易价格有重大影响的信息尚未公开前，利用内幕信息从事期货交易，或者向他人泄露内幕信息，使他人利用内幕信息进行期货交易的，没收违法所得，并处违法所得1倍以上5倍以下的罚款；没有违法所得或者违法所得不满10万元的，处10万元以上50万元以下的罚款；构成犯罪的，依法追究刑事责任。**第六十二条**　任何单位或者个人有下列行为之一，操纵期货交易价格的，责令改正，没收违法所得，并处违法所得1倍以上5倍以下的罚款；没有违法所得或者违法所得不满20万元的，处20万元以上100万元以下的罚款；构成犯罪的，依法追究刑事责任：（一）单独或者合谋，集中资金优势、持仓优势或者利用信息优势联合或者连续买卖期货合约，操纵期货交易价格的；（二）蓄意串通，按事先约定的时间、价格和方式相互进行期货交易，影响期货交易价格或者期货交易量的；（三）以自己为交易对象，自买自卖，影响期货交易价格或者期货交易量的；（四）为影响期货市场行情囤积实物的；（五）有中国证监会规定的其他操纵期货交易价格的行为的。单位有前款所列行为之一的，对直接负责的主管人员和其他直接责任人员给予纪律处分，并处1万元以上10万元以下的罚款。**第六十三条**　交割仓库有本条例第四十三条所列行为之一的，责令改正，给予警告，没收违法所得，并处违法所得1倍以上5倍以下的罚款；没有违法所得或者违法所得不满10万元的，处10万元以上50万元以下的罚款；情节严重的，责令期货交易所暂停或者取消其交割仓库资格；对直接负责的主管人员和其他直接责任人员给予纪律处分。**第六十四条**　国有企业、国有资产占控股地位或者主导地位的企业违反本条例规定进行期货交易的，任何单位或者个人使用信贷资金、财政资金进行期货交易的，给予警告，没收违法所得，并处违法所得1倍以上5倍以下的罚款；没有违法所得或者违法所得不满10万元的，处10万元以上50万元以下的罚款；对直接负责的主管人员和其他直接责任人员给予降级直至开除的纪律处分；构成犯罪的，依法追究刑事责任。**第六十五条**　任何单位或者个人违反本条例规定，擅自从事境外期货交易的，予以取缔，没收违法所得，并处违法所得1倍以上5倍以下的罚款；没有违法所得或者违法所得不满20万元的，处20万元以上100万元以下的罚款；对直接负责的主管人员和其他直接责任人员处1万元以上10万元以下的罚款，并给予降级直至开除的纪律处分；构成犯罪的，依法追究刑事责任。任何单位或者个人非法设立或者变相设立期货交易所、期货经纪公司，或者擅自从事期货经纪业务的，予以取缔，并依照前款的规定处罚；构成犯罪的，依法追究刑事责任。**第六十六条**　期货交易所的工作人员在任职期间或者离开期货交易所未满一年，在该期货交易所的会员单位任职的，或者泄露知悉的国家秘密和会员、客户商业秘密的，给予纪律处分；构成犯罪的，依法追究刑事责任。**第六十七条**　任何单位或者个人违反本条例规定，情节严重的，由中国证监会宣布该个人、该单位或者该单位的直接责任人员为期货市场禁止进入者。**第六十八条**　中国证监会的工作人员泄露知悉的国家秘密以及会员、客户商业秘密，或者徇私舞弊、玩忽职守、滥用职权、收受贿赂，构成犯罪的，依法追究刑事责任；尚不构成犯罪的，依法给予行政处分。**第六十九条**　对期货交易所及其会员、期货经纪公司及其客户、期货从业人员、交割仓库的行政处罚，由中国证监会决定；对其他单位或者个人的行政处罚，由有关部门依照法定职权决定。##第七章　附则**第七十条**　本条例下列用语的含义：（一）“期货交易”，是指在期货交易所内集中买卖某种期货合约的交易活动。（二）“期货合约”，是指由期货交易所统一制定的、规定在将来某一特定的时间和地点交割一定数量和质量商品的标准化合约。（三）“保证金”，是指期货交易者按照规定标准交纳的资金，用于结算和保证履约。（四）“结算”，是指根据期货交易所公布的结算价格对交易双方的交易盈亏状况进行的资金清算。（五）“交割”，是指期货合约到期时，根据期货交易所的规则和程序，交易双方通过该期货合约所载商品所有权的转移，了结到期未平仓合约的过程。（六）“平仓”，是指期货交易者买入或者卖出与其所持期货合约的品种、数量及交割月份相同但交易方向相反的期货合约，了结期货交易的行为。（七）“持仓量”，是指期货交易者所持有的未平仓合约的数量。（八）“持仓限额”，是指期货交易所对期货交易者的持仓量规定的最高数额。（九）“仓单”，是指交割仓库开出并经期货交易所认定的标准化提货凭证。（十）“撮合成交”，是指期货交易所的计算机交易系统对交易双方的交易指令进行配对的过程。（十一）“涨跌停板”，是指期货合约在一个交易日中的交易价格不得高于或者低于规定的涨跌幅度，超出该涨跌幅度的报价将被视为无效，不能成交。（十二）“内幕信息”，是指可能对期货市场价格产生重大影响的尚未公开的信息，包括：中国证监会及其他相关部门制定的对期货交易价格可能发生重大影响的政策，期货交易所作出的可能对期货交易价格发生重大影响的决定，期货交易所会员、客户的资金和交易动向以及中国证监会认定的对期货交易价格有显著影响的其他重要信息。（十三）“内幕信息的知情人员”，是指由于其管理地位、监督地位或者职业地位，或者作为雇员、专业顾问履行职务，能够接触或者获得内幕信息的人员，包括：期货交易所的理事长、副理事长、总经理、副总经理等高级管理人员以及其他由于任职可获取内幕信息的从业人员，中国证监会的工作人员和其他有关部门的工作人员以及中国证监会规定的其他人员。**第七十一条**　本条例自1999年9月1日起施行。

name_chn: 中共中央　国务院关于促进农民增加收入若干政策的意见
text: **CPC Central Committee and State Council**  **Opinions on Several Policies to Promote Increases in Farmers’ Incomes**  (December 31, 2003)  Zhong Fa [2004] No. 1Guided by the spirit of the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, in 2003 all regions and departments, in accordance with the requirements of the Party Central Committee, intensified efforts to address agriculture, rural areas, and farmers (“the three rural issues”). They withstood the severe shock of the sudden SARS outbreak, overcame the serious impact of frequent natural disasters, and achieved steady adjustment of the agricultural structure, steady development of the rural economy, steady advancement of rural reform, steady increases in farmers’ incomes, and continued stability in rural society.At the same time, we must soberly recognize that many contradictions and problems remain in current agricultural and rural development, the most prominent being difficulties in increasing farmers’ incomes. For many consecutive years, per capita net income of farmers nationwide has grown slowly; in major grain-producing areas, farmers’ income growth has been below the national average; for many pure-farming households, income has stagnated or even declined; and the urban–rural income gap continues to widen. Persistently low farmer incomes not only affect improvements in farmers’ living standards, but also affect grain production and the supply of agricultural products; they not only constrain rural economic development, but also constrain growth of the entire national economy; they not only concern progress in rural society, but also the realization of the goal of building a moderately prosperous society in all respects; they are not only a major economic issue, but also a major political issue. The whole Party must, from the height of implementing the important thought of the “Three Represents” and realizing, safeguarding, and developing the fundamental interests of the overwhelming majority of the peasantry, further enhance the sense of urgency and initiative in doing a good job of increasing farmers’ incomes.The current difficulty in increasing farmers’ incomes is a realistic reflection of profound changes in the internal and external environment of agriculture and the countryside, and a concentrated reflection of deep-seated contradictions accumulated over a long time by the dual urban–rural structure. Under the circumstances of tightening constraints in agricultural product markets and increasingly diversified sources of farmers’ income, promoting increases in farmers’ incomes must involve new thinking and comprehensive measures, with major shifts in development strategy, economic systems, policy measures, and working mechanisms.The overall requirement for doing a good job in increasing farmers’ incomes now and in the coming period is: all levels of Party committees and governments must conscientiously implement the spirit of the 16th Party Congress and the Third Plenary Session of the 16th CPC Central Committee, firmly establish a scientific outlook on development, and—according to the requirements of coordinating urban and rural economic and social development—adhere to the policy of “giving more, taking less, and loosening control.” They must adjust the agricultural structure, expand farmers’ employment, accelerate scientific and technological progress, deepen rural reform, increase investment in agriculture, strengthen support and protection for agriculture, strive to achieve faster growth in farmers’ incomes, and reverse as soon as possible the trend of the widening income gap between urban and rural residents.## I. Concentrate efforts to support grain industry development in major grain-producing areas and promote income growth for grain-farming households1) **Strengthen grain production capacity in producing areas.** The current problems of low profitability in grain cultivation and difficulties in increasing farmers’ incomes in major grain-producing areas are particularly acute and must be addressed with effective measures as soon as possible. Grasping the income issue of grain farmers is to grasp the focus of raising farmers’ incomes; mobilizing farmers’ enthusiasm for grain cultivation is to grasp the root of grain production; protecting and enhancing grain production capacity in producing areas is to stabilize the national grain situation. Starting in 2004, the state will implement a high-quality grain industry program, selecting a number of counties with a strong foundation and potential and state farms to focus on building national high-quality specialty grain bases. Efforts shall focus on supporting the construction of drought–flood–resilient, stable, high-yield basic farmland in producing areas—especially in the central grain zone. Expand the “Fertile Soil Project,” continuously improving cultivated-land quality. Strengthen breeding of seeds for major grain crops and plant protection projects, enhance technology integration capacity, and give priority support to producing areas for the dissemination of impactful improved varieties and advanced applicable technologies. Centered on basic farmland construction, accelerate small and medium-sized water conservancy projects, expand effective irrigation area, and improve drainage and drought resistance. Raise levels of agricultural mechanization and provide certain subsidies for the purchase and renewal of large agricultural machinery by individual farmers, farm workers, farm machinery specialists, and machinery service organizations directly engaged in agricultural production.2) **Support grain processing and conversion in producing areas.** Producing areas shall leverage grain advantages to increase farmers’ incomes and develop regional economies, and—according to market demand—build a strong grain industry. Make full use of abundant feed resources to actively develop animal husbandry in farming regions. Through small loans, interest subsidies, and insurance services, support farmers and enterprises to purchase superior breeds and develop breeding, thereby raising grain value through the development of animal husbandry. In line with national industrial policy, guide rational layout of agricultural processing and support producing areas to develop agricultural processing industries that use grain as the main raw material, with emphasis on deep processing. Through interest subsidies for technological transformation loans, equity investment, and tax policies, the state will support producing areas to establish or upgrade a batch of large agricultural processing, seed marketing, and agri-tech enterprises.3) **Increase investment in major grain-producing areas.** Existing funds for agricultural fixed-asset investment, comprehensive agricultural development, and land reclamation shall be relatively concentrated and tilted toward producing areas. Continue to increase comprehensive agricultural development funds, with the increment mainly used for producing areas. To truly support revitalization of producing areas and promote farmers’ incomes, open new funding channels: starting in 2004, earmark a certain proportion of state-owned land transfer proceeds to support agricultural land development, build high-standard basic farmland, and raise comprehensive grain production capacity. Major sales areas and balanced regions shall also strengthen grain production capacity. Further strengthen ties between producing and consuming areas. Business entities in sales areas establishing production bases, storage, and processing in producing areas shall enjoy the relevant state support policies for producing areas; producers building storage and processing in sales regions to develop markets shall be supported by sales-area governments with necessary preferential policies.## II. Continue advancing agricultural structural adjustment and tap internal drivers of agricultural income growth4) **Comprehensively raise agricultural product quality and safety.** In recent years, structural adjustment has made great strides, with correct direction and evident results, and must continue unswervingly. On the premise of protecting and improving comprehensive grain capacity, follow the requirements of high yield, high quality, high efficiency, ecology, and safety; take the path of refinement, intensification, and industrialization; extend both breadth and depth of agricultural development; and continuously create space for higher efficiency and incomes. Accelerate implementation of advantageous agricultural product regional layouts, give full play to comparative advantages, and continue to adjust regional agricultural layout. Construction of markets and processing layouts, technology extension, and quality-safety testing service systems shall all be oriented to forming belts of advantageous industries. In 2004, increase funding and expand seed subsidies in advantageous grain areas such as for wheat and soybeans. Further strengthen agricultural standardization, and carry out demonstration-zone building. Improve inspection, monitoring, and certification systems for quality and safety, implement geographical indications, pilot compulsory certification for agricultural inputs, and expand supply of pollution-free, green, and organic products. Strengthen animal disease prevention systems, implement emergency prevention projects for key regions, encourage establishment of livestock and poultry farming clusters in villages and towns, and in 2004 launch pilot reforms of the veterinary administration. Accelerate separation of statutory inspection from commercial inspection; reduce items for statutory inspection with fiscal subsidies; and control fees and strengthen oversight for commercial inspection.5) **Accelerate development of agricultural industrialization.** All levels of finance shall set up special funds to support agricultural industrialization, substantially increasing investment in leading enterprises. For qualifying leading enterprises, provide interest subsidies for technology transformation loans. Provide fiscal support for leading enterprises’ farmer training, marketing services, R&D and introduction of new varieties/technologies, base development, and pollution control. Create conditions to improve VAT policies for agricultural processing. Strengthen entrepreneurial support for newly established small and medium agro-processing enterprises. Regardless of ownership form, any leading enterprise that can drive farmers, establish a reasonable benefit-sharing mechanism with them, and bring tangible benefits to farmers shall receive equal support in fiscal, tax, and financial policies.6) **Strengthen agricultural research and extension.** With a focus on enhancing innovation, reserve, and transformation capacities in agricultural science and technology, reform the agri-science system and substantially increase budgetary investment in agri-research. Continue funding the introduction of advanced foreign agricultural technologies and increase funds for commercialization of research results. Support pilot-scale and large-area demonstrations of existing results. Guide and promote enterprises to become the main body of agri-tech innovation, allowing various agricultural enterprises and private agri-tech organizations to apply for national funds for R&D, introduction, and promotion. Deepen reform of agri-tech extension systems; accelerate formation of an extension system where state agencies and other ownership-based organizations co-develop and complement each other. Give full play to demonstration farms, science parks, leading enterprises, and farmer cooperatives in promotion. Establish cross-regional, specialized new service organizations compatible with industrial belts. Support agricultural colleges and universities to participate in research and extension.## III. Develop rural secondary and tertiary industries to broaden income channels7) **Advance reform and adjustment of township and village enterprises (TVEs).** Developing TVEs is an important channel to utilize rural resources and factors, develop the rural economy in all respects, and expand internal rural employment. In line with market demand changes, industrial upgrading, and transformation of growth models, adjust TVE development strategies and modes, accelerate technological progress and institutional innovation, and focus on agro-processing, services, and labor-intensive enterprises. Increase support for technological upgrading of above-scale TVEs to promote product renewal and industrial upgrading. Guide rural collective enterprises to restructure into shareholding or shareholding cooperative enterprises and encourage capable TVEs to establish modern corporate systems. Rural SMEs significantly boost employment; as long as they meet safety and environmental standards and promote rational resource use, they should be allowed to exist and develop. Relevant departments should, based on new situations, promptly formulate guiding opinions to promote TVE reform and development.8) **Vigorously develop rural individually owned and private economies.** Rural self-employed and private enterprises may enter infrastructure, public utilities, and other sectors not prohibited by laws and regulations. Provide support in taxation, financing, resource use, and talent policies. For lawfully operating small mobile vendors, unless the state otherwise provides, exempt them from business registration and related taxes/fees.9) **Invigorate small-town economies.** Small-town construction should be combined with strengthening county economies, developing TVEs, advancing agricultural industrialization, and resettlement, guiding more farmers into small towns and gradually forming a virtuous circle of industrial development, population agglomeration, and market expansion to enhance small towns’ capacity to absorb rural population and drive rural development. State fixed-asset investment shall continue to support small-town construction, and financial institutions shall be guided to support their development according to market rules. Construction in key fishing ports, forest areas, and farm headquarters shall be combined with small-town development. Where conditions permit, accelerate village construction and environmental remediation.## IV. Improve the environment for farmers seeking urban employment and increase migrant-worker income10) **Safeguard the lawful rights and interests of farmers working in cities.** Further clean up and abolish discriminatory provisions and unreasonable charges against farmers seeking urban employment; simplify procedures for cross-regional employment; and prevent disguised fees on migrant workers and employers. Migrant workers have become an important part of the industrial workforce and create wealth and tax revenue for cities. Urban governments shall include vocational training, children’s education, labor security, and other services and management for migrant workers in normal fiscal budgets—improving existing policies and implementing those not yet in place. There are clear national policies on timely payment of wages, improving work conditions, and children’s schooling; regions and departments shall adopt stronger measures, designate lead agencies, define responsibilities, and strengthen supervision and inspection. Improve laws and regulations to protect migrants’ rights and interests according to law. Advance household registration reform in large and medium cities and relax conditions for farmers to work and settle in cities.11) **Strengthen vocational skills training for rural labor.** This is a fundamental task for improving farmers’ employability and the nation’s industrial competitiveness and must be earnestly grasped. Based on market and enterprise needs and basic skill requirements by industry/occupation, arrange training content and conduct targeted training. Mobilize all sectors to participate, and encourage training institutions and employers to carry out training. All levels of finance shall allocate dedicated funds for rural vocational training. To improve efficiency and effectiveness, farmers shall independently choose institutions, content, and timing, with the government providing appropriate subsidies. Prevent and correct compulsory paid training and qualification testing.## V. Give full play to market mechanisms and invigorate circulation of agricultural products12) **Cultivate marketing entities for agricultural products.** Encourage various farmer cooperatives, large buyers/sellers, and rural brokers. Accelerate legislation on farmer cooperatives. From 2004, central and local governments shall allocate special funds to support cooperatives’ services in information, technology, training, standards and certification, and marketing. Financial institutions shall support cooperatives in building standardized bases, storage, processing, and logistics equipment purchases; finance may provide interest subsidies. Deepen supply-and-marketing cooperative reform and leverage their role in helping farmers enter markets. Accelerate development of chain stores, supermarkets, and distribution for agricultural products; encourage conversion of urban farm markets into supermarkets where feasible; support leading enterprises to operate agri-supermarkets and extend networks into communities. Strengthen wholesale market construction in production and sales areas and create conditions to develop modern logistics. Strengthen the agricultural inputs market, ensure adequate supply and basically stable prices, and severely crack down on counterfeit/substandard inputs that harm farmers. Support circulation of fresh produce and build efficient nationwide “green channels”; improve local circulation environments based on local realities.13) **Expand exports of advantageous agricultural products.** Improve policies to promote exports. Tilt Foreign Trade Development Fund toward agricultural exports—mainly to support R&D of new products/technologies, market development, and international certification, and to support export bases. Encourage agro-export processors to enter export-processing zones. Launch pest-free area construction for horticultural products. Improve policy-based export credit insurance. Relevant departments shall closely monitor and promptly inform enterprises of domestic and foreign market supply–demand, policies and regulations, epidemics, and inspection/quarantine standards. Strengthen external negotiations and sign bilateral inspection/quarantine and preferential trade agreements with key markets to create a favorable environment. Adapt to new trends in agricultural trade and accelerate establishment of industry and commodity associations for key exported products such as poultry, vegetables, and fruit.## VI. Strengthen rural infrastructure to create conditions for income growth14) **Continue increasing fiscal input in agriculture and rural development.** To strengthen agricultural infrastructure and solve the “three rural issues,” further adjust national income distribution and fiscal expenditure structures. Governments at all levels shall, by law, arrange and implement budgetary expenditures on agriculture and rural areas, strictly execute budgets, and establish a stable growth mechanism for fiscal funds supporting agriculture. In line with unified planning, clear division of labor, and overall coordination, integrate existing agricultural investment, concentrate financial resources, highlight priorities, and improve efficiency. Actively use tax, interest subsidies, subsidies, and other economic instruments to encourage and guide social capital into agriculture and rural areas. Governments shall truly prioritize rural social undertakings and implement policies that channel increased education, health, and cultural funding primarily to rural areas, with annual special inspections to follow up.15) **Further strengthen agricultural and rural infrastructure.** The proportion of state fixed-asset investment for agriculture and rural areas shall be kept stable and gradually increased. Appropriately adjust the investment structure, increasing support for agricultural structural adjustment and small/medium rural infrastructure. The six small projects—water-saving irrigation, safe drinking water for people and livestock, rural roads, rural biogas, small hydropower, and pasture fencing—play positive roles in improving production/living conditions, boosting employment, and increasing income; investment scales shall be expanded, content enriched, and scope widened. Based on local conditions, carry out small facilities such as rainwater harvesting, river–canal rehabilitation, pastoral water conservancy, small watershed management, water/toilet improvements, and straw gasification. Innovate and improve management and operation mechanisms for rural infrastructure. Continue ecological construction; coordinate and localize protection of natural forests, returning farmland to forest/grassland, and wetland protection; consolidate results and emphasize practical effectiveness.## VII. Deepen rural reform to provide institutional guarantees for increasing incomes and reducing burdens16) **Accelerate reform of the land expropriation system.** Governments at all levels shall strictly implement the most stringent cultivated land protection system; strictly observe approval authority and procedures for non-agricultural land use; and strictly implement overall land-use plans, upholding principles of safeguarding farmers’ rights and controlling the scale of land acquisition. Strictly distinguish public-welfare land from business land, and clearly define the government’s power and scope of land expropriation. Improve procedures and compensation mechanisms, raise compensation standards, improve distribution methods, properly resettle land-losing farmers, and provide them social security. Actively explore channels for collective non-agricultural construction land to enter the market.17) **Deepen grain circulation system reform.** Starting in 2004, the state will fully liberalize grain purchase and sale markets and implement multi-channel operations. Relevant departments shall promptly clean up and revise policies and regulations unfavorable to free circulation of grain. Accelerate reform of state-owned grain purchase/sale enterprises, transform operating mechanisms, improve spot and futures grain markets, strictly prohibit regional blockades, strengthen cooperation between producing and consuming areas, optimize reserve layouts, and enhance market management and macro-control. At present, producing areas shall emphasize the main-channel role of state-owned and state-controlled grain purchase/sale enterprises. To protect grain farmers’ interests, establish a system of direct subsidies to farmers. In 2004, the state will allocate part of the grain risk fund to direct subsidies for grain farmers in producing areas. Other regions shall also implement direct subsidies for grain farmers in key producing counties/cities in their jurisdictions. Based on the principle of mobilizing grain cultivation, formulate practical, supervisable implementation methods to ensure that subsidies truly reach farmers.18) **Continue advancing rural tax–fee reform.** Consolidate and develop the results of tax–fee reform, further reduce farmers’ burdens, and create conditions for ultimately unifying the urban–rural tax system. Gradually reduce the agricultural tax rate; in 2004, reduce the overall agricultural tax rate by 1 percentage point and abolish the agricultural specialty tax (except on tobacco leaves). Revenue reductions after tax cuts shall, in principle, be absorbed by coastal developed regions themselves; for major producing areas and central/western regions, the central government will address this through transfer payments. Where conditions permit, further reduce or exempt agricultural taxes. All regions shall strictly adjust down to the household level according to the reduction ratio so that farmers genuinely benefit; ensure transfer payments are earmarked, timely, and in full. Reduce taxable acreage in line with the actual reduction of cultivated land due to lawful land acquisition. Accelerate supporting reforms, continue strengthening supervision of farmers’ burdens, and prevent rebound to consolidate reform results. Further streamline township institutions and payrolls, steadily adjust township administrative setups, and—where conditions permit—merge villages and encourage cadre cross-posting. Optimize rural school layouts and teacher staffing. Further clean up and standardize administrative fees related to agriculture. Consolidate outcomes in rectifying abuse of authority to publish/distribute periodicals. Explore effective ways to address village-level debts. Formulate collection and administration measures for the agricultural tax as soon as possible.19) **Reform and innovate the rural financial system.** Based on rural realities and farmers’ needs—and following the requirements of facilitating loans to households and enterprises and improving services—accelerate reform and innovation. Establish mechanisms for financial institutions to serve rural communities and clarify obligations to serve the “three rurals.” Expand interest-rate floating ranges on rural loans. Improve postal savings policies, intensify rural credit cooperative reform, and alleviate capital outflows. The Agricultural Bank and other commercial banks shall innovate products and service methods to broaden lending channels for agriculture. The Agricultural Development Bank and other policy banks shall adjust functions, divide responsibilities rationally, and expand services to agriculture and rural areas. Summarize rural credit cooperative reform pilots and create conditions for gradual nationwide rollout. Continue expanding farmer microcredit and mutual-guarantee loans. Encourage qualified areas—under strict supervision and effective risk control—to attract social and foreign capital to establish multi-ownership financial organizations directly serving the “three rurals.” Relevant departments shall, based on the realities of households and rural SMEs, propose various guarantee methods and explore pledges of movable property, warehouse receipts, and rights interests. Encourage government-funded credit guarantee institutions to expand guarantee business suited to rural characteristics; where conditions permit, establish agricultural guarantee institutions and encourage existing commercial guarantee institutions to carry out rural business. Accelerate the establishment of policy-based agricultural insurance, select products and regions for pilot first, and—where conditions permit—provide premium subsidies for farmers participating in crop and livestock insurance.## VIII. Continue poverty alleviation and address production/livelihood difficulties of the rural poor and disaster-affected20) **Improve the poverty-alleviation mechanism.** Party committees and governments at all levels shall intensify efforts, strengthen accountability, and raise effectiveness. In 2004, the state will continue to increase funding. Based on careful review and accurate baselines, adopt more targeted measures for those still lacking adequate food and clothing, ensuring assistance reaches villages and households. For the extremely poor who have lost working ability, implement social relief and appropriately raise standards. For poor people in areas lacking basic survival conditions, steadily carry out ecological migration and relocation-based poverty alleviation. For low-income poor, focus on improving production and living conditions, developing specialty industries, opening income channels, and reducing and preventing return to poverty. Improve input mechanisms, strengthen fund management, enhance efficiency, adopt disclosure and reporting systems for all poverty funds, tighten supervision and auditing, ensure timely and full disbursement, and truly benefit poor households.21) **Properly arrange production and livelihood in disaster areas and for difficult households.** In 2003, many places suffered severe natural disasters, and some farmers faced serious difficulties. Party committees and governments at all levels must assume responsibility, organize cadres to go deep into disaster and poor areas to verify situations, promptly distribute relief funds and materials to households, reduce or exempt relevant taxes/fees as prescribed, and organize/guide self-help in production. Where conditions permit, explore establishing a minimum living guarantee system for farmers. Implement policies enabling state farm enterprises to participate in the basic pension insurance for enterprise employees.## IX. Strengthen Party leadership over efforts to raise farmers’ incomes and ensure policy implementation22) **Make solving the “three rurals” the top priority of Party work.** All Party members—especially leading cadres at all levels—must always attach importance to the fundamental status of agriculture; always strictly protect cultivated land and protect/raise comprehensive grain capacity; always safeguard the interests of major grain-producing areas and grain farmers; and always emphasize raising farmers’ incomes, especially those of grain farmers. Responsibility must be taken not only by the leaders in charge, but also personally by top Party and government leaders; prefectural and county leaders must devote major effort to agriculture and rural work. Establish a scientific outlook on development and a correct view of political achievements; place increasing farmers’ incomes in a more prominent position as a matter bearing on the overall situation. Earnestly transform work style; go to the grassroots and among the masses; implement income-raising measures; and offer ideas, methods, and practical services for farmers’ incomes—avoiding boastfulness and formalism—and use increases in farmers’ incomes as an important criterion for evaluating work. Strengthen training for rural grassroots cadres to enhance their sense of purpose, awareness of law and policy, feelings for the masses, and capacity to lead farmers to prosperity. All sectors must embrace the overall perspective and contribute to farmers’ incomes, forming a favorable social atmosphere. Inspire farmers’ entrepreneurial spirit and perseverance to achieve prosperity through hard work. At the same time—and according to central deployments—strengthen rural grassroots organizations, spiritual civilization, and democracy and the rule of law; do other rural work well; and provide strong organizational guarantees, intellectual support, and a stable social environment for income growth.Doing a good job in the new stage of agricultural and rural work and striving to raise farmers’ incomes is profoundly significant and arduous. Let us unite more closely around the Party Central Committee with Comrade Hu Jintao as General Secretary, hold high the great banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory, earnestly practice the important thought of the “Three Represents,” strengthen confidence, forge ahead, and work solidly to make new contributions to the comprehensive building of a moderately prosperous society.

中共中央国务院关于促进农⺠增加收⼊若⼲政策的意⻅__2004年第9号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:37**中共中央国务院****关于促进农民增加收⼊若⼲政策的意见**(**2003**年**12**⽉**31**⽇)中发〔2004〕1号在党的⼗六⼤精神指引下，2003年各地区各部门按照中央的要求，加⼤了解决“三农”问题的⼒度，抵御住了突如其来⾮典疫情的严重冲击，克服了多种⾃然灾害频繁发⽣的严重影响，实现了农业结构稳步调整，农村经济稳步发展，农村改⾰稳步推进，农民收⼊稳步增加，农村社会继续保持稳定。同时，应当清醒地看到，当前农业和农村发展中还存在着许多⽭盾和问题，突出的是农民增收困难。全国农民⼈均纯收⼊连续多年增长缓慢，粮⾷主产区农民收⼊增长幅度低于全国平均⽔平，许多纯农户的收⼊持续徘徊甚⾄下降，城乡居民收⼊差距仍在不断扩⼤。农民收⼊长期上不去，不仅影响农民⽣活⽔平提⾼，⽽且影响粮⾷⽣产和农产品供给；不仅制约农村经济发展，⽽且制约整个国民经济增长；不仅关系农村社会进步，⽽且关系全⾯建设⼩康社会⽬标的实现；不仅是重⼤的经济问题，⽽且是重⼤的政治问题。全党必须从贯彻“三个代表”重要思想，实现好、维护好、发展好⼴⼤农民群众根本利益的⾼度，进⼀步增强做好农民增收⼯作的紧迫感和主动性。现阶段农民增收困难，是农业和农村内外部环境发⽣深刻变化的现实反映，也是城乡⼆元结构长期积累的各种深层次⽭盾的集中反映。在农产品市场约束⽇益增强、农民收⼊来源⽇趋多元化的背景下，促进农民增收必须有新思路，采取综合性措施，在发展战略、经济体制、政策措施和⼯作机制上有⼀个⼤的转变。当前和今后⼀个时期做好农民增收⼯作的总体要求是：各级党委和政府要认真贯彻⼗六⼤和⼗六届三中全会精神，牢固树⽴科学发展观，按照统筹城乡经济社会发展的要求，坚持“多予、少取、放活”的⽅针，调整农业结构，扩⼤农民就业，加快科技进步，深化农村改⾰，增加农业投⼊，强化对农业⽀持保护，⼒争实现农民收⼊较快增长，尽快扭转城乡居民收⼊差距不断扩⼤的趋势。**⼀、集中⼒量⽀持粮⾷主产区发展粮⾷产业，促进种粮农民增加收⼊**（⼀）加强主产区粮⾷⽣产能⼒建设。当前种粮效益低、主产区农民增收困难的问题尤为突出，必须采取切实有⼒的措施，尽快加以解决。抓住了种粮农民的增收问题，就抓住了农民增收的重点；调动了农民的种粮积极性，就抓住了粮⾷⽣产的根本；保护和提⾼了主产区的粮⾷⽣产能⼒，就稳住了全国粮⾷的⼤局。从2004年起，国家将实施优质粮⾷产业⼯程，选择⼀部分有基础、有潜⼒的粮⾷⼤县和国有农场，集中⼒量建设⼀批国家优质专⽤粮⾷基地。要着⼒⽀持主产区特别是中部粮⾷产区重点建设旱涝保收、稳产⾼产基本农⽥。扩⼤沃⼟⼯程实施规模，不断提⾼耕地质量。加强⼤宗粮⾷作物良种繁育、病⾍害防治⼯程建设，强化技术集成能⼒，优先⽀持主产区推⼴⼀批有重⼤影响的优良品种和先进适⽤技术。围绕农⽥基本建设，加快中⼩型⽔利设施建设，扩⼤农⽥有效灌溉⾯https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2004/content_63144.htmPage1of7中共中央国务院关于促进农⺠增加收⼊若⼲政策的意⻅__2004年第9号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:37积，提⾼排涝和抗旱能⼒。提⾼农业机械化⽔平，对农民个⼈、农场职⼯、农机专业户和直接从事农业⽣产的农机服务组织购置和更新⼤型农机具给予⼀定补贴。（⼆）⽀持主产区进⾏粮⾷转化和加⼯。主产区要⽴⾜粮⾷优势促进农民增加收⼊、发展区域经济，并按照市场需求，把粮⾷产业做⼤做强。充分利⽤主产区丰富的饲料资源，积极发展农区畜牧业，通过⼩额贷款、贴息补助、提供保险服务等形式，⽀持农民和企业购买优良畜禽、繁育良种，通过发展养殖业带动粮⾷增值。按照国家产业政策要求，引导农产品加⼯业合理布局，扶持主产区发展以粮⾷为主要原料的农产品加⼯业，重点是发展精深加⼯。国家通过技改贷款贴息、投资参股、税收政策等措施，⽀持主产区建⽴和改造⼀批⼤型农产品加⼯、种⼦营销和农业科技型企业。（三）增加对粮⾷主产区的投⼊。现有农业固定资产投资、农业综合开发资⾦、⼟地复垦基⾦等要相对集中使⽤，向主产区倾斜。继续增加农业综合开发资⾦，新增部分主要⽤于主产区。为切实⽀持粮⾷主产区振兴经济、促进农民增收，要开辟新的资⾦来源渠道。从2004年起，确定⼀定⽐例的国有⼟地出让⾦，⽤于⽀持农业⼟地开发，建设⾼标准基本农⽥，提⾼粮⾷综合⽣产能⼒。主销区和产销平衡区也要加强粮⾷⽣产能⼒建设。进⼀步密切产销区的关系。粮⾷销区的经营主体到产区建⽴粮⾷⽣产基地、仓储设施和加⼯企业，应享受国家对主产区的有关扶持政策。产区粮⾷企业到销区建⽴仓储、加⼯等设施，开拓粮⾷市场，销区政府应予以⽀持并实⾏必要的优惠政策。**⼆、继续推进农业结构调整，挖掘农业内部增收潜⼒**（四）全⾯提⾼农产品质量安全⽔平。近⼏年，农业结构调整迈出较⼤步伐，⽅向正确，成效明显，要坚定不移地继续推进。要在保护和提⾼粮⾷综合⽣产能⼒的前提下，按照⾼产、优质、⾼效、⽣态、安全的要求，⾛精细化、集约化、产业化的道路，向农业发展的⼴度和深度进军，不断开拓农业增效增收的空间。要加快实施优势农产品区域布局规划，充分发挥各地的⽐较优势，继续调整农业区域布局。农产品市场和加⼯布局、技术推⼴和质量安全检验等服务体系的建设，都要着眼和有利于促进优势产业带的形成。2004年要增加资⾦规模，在⼩麦、⼤⾖等粮⾷优势产区扩⼤良种补贴范围。进⼀步加强农业标准化⼯作，深⼊开展农业标准化⽰范区建设。要进⼀步完善农产品的检验检测、安全监测及质量认证体系，推⾏农产品原产地标记制度，开展农业投⼊品强制性产品认证试点，扩⼤⽆公害⾷品、绿⾊⾷品、有机⾷品等优质农产品的⽣产和供应。加强动物防疫体系建设，实施重点区域动物疫病应急防治⼯程，⿎励乡村建⽴畜禽养殖⼩区，2004年要启动兽医管理体制改⾰试点。加快实⾏法定检验和商业检验分开的制度，对法定检验要减少项⽬并给予财政补贴，对商业检验要控制收费标准并加强监管。（五）加快发展农业产业化经营。各级财政要安排⽀持农业产业化发展的专项资⾦，较⼤幅度地增加对龙头企业的投⼊。对符合条件的龙头企业的技改贷款，可给予财政贴息。对龙头企业为农户提供培训、营销服务，以及研发引进新品种新技术、开展基地建设和污染治理等，可给予财政补助。创造条件，完善农产品加⼯的增值税政策。对新办的中⼩型农副产品加⼯企业，要加强创业扶持和服务。不管哪种所有制和经营形式的龙头企业，只要能带动农户，与农民建⽴起https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2004/content_63144.htmPage2of7中共中央国务院关于促进农⺠增加收⼊若⼲政策的意⻅__2004年第9号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:37合理的利益联结机制，给农民带来实惠，都要在财政、税收、⾦融等⽅⾯⼀视同仁地给予⽀持。（六）加强农业科研和技术推⼴。要围绕增强我国农业科技的创新能⼒、储备能⼒和转化能⼒，改⾰农业科技体制，较⼤幅度地增加预算内农业科研投⼊。继续安排引进国外先进农业科技成果的资⾦。增加农业科技成果转化资⾦。⽀持已有科研成果的中试和⼤⾯积⽰范推⼴。引导和推动企业成为农业技术创新主体，允许各类农业企业和民营农业科技组织申请使⽤国家有关农业科技的研发、引进和推⼴等资⾦。深化农业科技推⼴体制改⾰，加快形成国家推⼴机构和其他所有制推⼴组织共同发展、优势互补的农业技术推⼴体系。积极发挥农业科技⽰范场、科技园区、龙头企业和农民专业合作组织在农业科技推⼴中的作⽤。建⽴与农业产业带相适应的跨区域、专业性的新型农业科技推⼴服务组织。⽀持农业⼤中专院校参与农业技术的研究、推⼴。**三、发展农村⼆、三产业，拓宽农民增收渠道**（七）推进乡镇企业改⾰和调整。发展乡镇企业是充分利⽤农村各种资源和⽣产要素，全⾯发展农村经济、拓展农村内部就业空间的重要途径。要适应市场需求变化、产业结构升级和增长⽅式转变的要求，调整乡镇企业发展战略和发展模式，加快技术进步，加快体制和机制创新，重点发展农产品加⼯业、服务业和劳动密集型企业。加⼤对规模以上乡镇企业技术改造的⽀持⼒度，促进产品更新换代和产业优化升级。引导农村集体企业改制成股份制和股份合作制等混合所有制企业，⿎励有条件的乡镇企业建⽴现代企业制度。农村中⼩企业对增加农民就业作⽤明显，只要符合安全⽣产标准和环境保护要求，有利于资源的合理利⽤，都应当允许其存在和发展。有关部门要根据乡镇企业发展的新形势新情况，加强调查研究，尽快制定促进乡镇企业改⾰和发展的指导性意见。（⼋）⼤⼒发展农村个体私营等⾮公有制经济。法律法规未禁⼊的基础设施、公⽤事业及其他⾏业和领域，农村个体⼯商户和私营企业都可以进⼊。要在税收、投融资、资源使⽤、⼈才政策等⽅⾯，对农村个体⼯商户和私营企业给予⽀持。对合法经营的农村流动性⼩商⼩贩，除国家另有规定外，免于⼯商登记和收取有关税费。（九）繁荣⼩城镇经济。⼩城镇建设要同壮⼤县域经济、发展乡镇企业、推进农业产业化经营、移民搬迁结合起来，引导更多的农民进⼊⼩城镇，逐步形成产业发展、⼈⼜聚集、市场扩⼤的良性互动机制，增强⼩城镇吸纳农村⼈⼜、带动农村发展的能⼒。国家固定资产投资要继续⽀持⼩城镇建设，引导⾦融机构按市场经济规律⽀持⼩城镇发展。重点渔区渔港、林区和垦区场部建设要与⼩城镇发展结合起来。有条件的地⽅，要加快推进村庄建设与环境整治。**四、改善农民进城就业环境，增加外出务⼯收⼊**（⼗）保障进城就业农民的合法权益。进⼀步清理和取消针对农民进城就业的歧视性规定和不合理收费，简化农民跨地区就业和进城务⼯的各种⼿续，防⽌变换⼿法向进城就业农民及⽤⼯单位乱收费。进城就业的农民⼯已经成为产业⼯⼈的重要组成部分，为城市创造了财富、提供了税收。城市政府要切实把对进城农民⼯的职业培训、⼦⼥教育、劳动保障及其他服务和管理经费，纳⼊正常的财政预算，已经落实的要完善政策，没有落实的要加快落实。对及时兑现进城就业农民⼯资、改善劳动条件、解决⼦⼥⼊学等问题，国家已有明确政策，各地区和https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2004/content_63144.htmPage3of7中共中央国务院关于促进农⺠增加收⼊若⼲政策的意⻅__2004年第9号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:37有关部门要采取更得⼒的措施，明确牵头部门，落实管理责任，加强督促检查。健全有关法律法规，依法保障进城就业农民的各项权益。推进⼤中城市户籍制度改⾰，放宽农民进城就业和定居的条件。（⼗⼀）加强对农村劳动⼒的职业技能培训。这是提⾼农民就业能⼒、增强我国产业竞争⼒的⼀项重要的基础性⼯作，各地区和有关部门要作为⼀件⼤事抓紧抓好。要根据市场和企业的需求，按照不同⾏业、不同⼯种对从业⼈员基本技能的要求，安排培训内容，实⾏定向培训，提⾼培训的针对性和适⽤性。要调动社会各⽅⾯参与农民职业技能培训的积极性，⿎励各类教育培训机构、⽤⼈单位开展对农民的职业技能培训。各级财政都要安排专门⽤于农民职业技能培训的资⾦。为提⾼培训资⾦的使⽤效率和培训效果，应由农民⾃主选择培训机构、培训内容和培训时间，政府对接受培训的农民给予⼀定的补贴和资助。要防⽌和纠正各种强制农民参加有偿培训和职业资格鉴定的错误做法。**五、发挥市场机制作⽤，搞活农产品流通**（⼗⼆）培育农产品营销主体。⿎励发展各类农产品专业合作组织、购销⼤户和农民经纪⼈。积极推进有关农民专业合作组织的⽴法⼯作。从２００４年起，中央和地⽅要安排专门资⾦，⽀持农民专业合作组织开展信息、技术、培训、质量标准与认证、市场营销等服务。有关⾦融机构⽀持农民专业合作组织建设标准化⽣产基地、兴办仓储设施和加⼯企业、购置农产品运销设备，财政可适当给予贴息。深化供销社改⾰，发挥其带动农民进⼊市场的作⽤。加快发展农产品连锁、超市、配送经营，⿎励有条件的地⽅将城市农贸市场改建成超市，⽀持农业龙头企业到城市开办农产品超市，逐步把⽹络延伸到城市社区。进⼀步加强产地和销地批发市场建设，创造条件发展现代物流业。加强农业⽣产资料市场管理，有关部门要保证货源充⾜、价格基本稳定，严厉打击制售假冒伪劣农资等坑农伤农⾏为。⽀持鲜活农产品运销，在全国建⽴⾼效率的绿⾊通道，各地要从实际出发进⼀步改善农产品的流通环境。（⼗三）扩⼤优势农产品出⼜。要进⼀步完善促进我国优势农产品出⼜的政策措施。外贸发展基⾦要向促进农产品出⼜倾斜，主要⽤于⽀持企业研发新产品新技术、开拓国际市场、参与国际认证等，扶持出⼜⽣产基地。⿎励和引导农产品出⼜加⼯企业进⼊出⼜加⼯贸易区。抓紧启动园艺产品⾮疫区建设。完善农产品出⼜政策性信⽤保险制度。有关部门要密切跟踪监测和及时通报国内外市场供需、政策法规和疫病疫情、检验检疫标准等动态，为农产品出⼜企业提供信息服务。加强对外谈判交涉，签订我国与重点市场国家和地区的双边检验检疫和优惠贸易协定，为我国农产品出⼜创造有利环境。适应农产品国际贸易的新形势，加快建⽴健全禽⾁、蔬菜、⽔果等重点出⼜农产品的⾏业和商品协会。**六、加强农村基础设施建设，为农民增收创造条件**（⼗四）继续增加财政对农业和农村发展的投⼊。加强农业基础建设、解决“三农”问题，必须进⼀步调整国民收⼊分配结构和财政⽀出结构。各级政府要依法安排并落实对农业和农村的预算⽀出，严格执⾏预算，建⽴健全财政⽀农资⾦的稳定增长机制。按照统⼀规划、明确分⼯、统筹安排的要求，整合现有各项⽀农投资，集中财⼒，突出重点，提⾼资⾦使⽤效率。积极运⽤税收、贴息、补助等多种经济杠杆，⿎励和引导各种社会资本投向农业和农村。各地区和有关部门要切实把发展农村社会事业作为⼯作重点，落实好新增教育、卫⽣、⽂化等事业经https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2004/content_63144.htmPage4of7中共中央国务院关于促进农⺠增加收⼊若⼲政策的意⻅__2004年第9号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:37费主要⽤于农村的政策规定，今后每年要对执⾏情况进⾏专项检查。（⼗五）进⼀步加强农业和农村基础设施建设。国家固定资产投资⽤于农业和农村的⽐例要保持稳定，并逐步提⾼。适当调整对农业和农村的投资结构，增加⽀持农业结构调整和农村中⼩型基础设施建设的投⼊。节⽔灌溉、⼈畜饮⽔、乡村道路、农村沼⽓、农村⽔电、草场围栏等“六⼩⼯程”，对改善农民⽣产⽣活条件、带动农民就业、增加农民收⼊发挥着积极作⽤，要进⼀步增加投资规模，充实建设内容，扩⼤建设范围。各地要从实际出发，因地制宜地开展⾬⽔集蓄、河渠整治、牧区⽔利、⼩流域治理、改⽔改厕和秸秆⽓化等各种⼩型设施建设。创新和完善农村基础设施建设的管理体制和运营机制。继续搞好⽣态建设，对天然林保护、退耕还林还草和湿地保护等⽣态⼯程，要统筹安排，因地制宜，巩固成果，注重实效。**七、深化农村改⾰，为农民增收减负提供体制保障**（⼗六）加快⼟地征⽤制度改⾰。各级政府要切实落实最严格的耕地保护制度，按照保障农民权益、控制征地规模的原则，严格遵守对⾮农占地的审批权限和审批程序，严格执⾏⼟地利⽤总体规划。要严格区分公益性⽤地和经营性⽤地，明确界定政府⼟地征⽤权和征⽤范围。完善⼟地征⽤程序和补偿机制，提⾼补偿标准，改进分配办法，妥善安置失地农民，并为他们提供社会保障。积极探索集体⾮农建设⽤地进⼊市场的途径和办法。（⼗七）深化粮⾷流通体制改⾰。从2004年开始，国家将全⾯放开粮⾷收购和销售市场，实⾏购销多渠道经营。有关部门要抓紧清理和修改不利于粮⾷⾃由流通的政策法规。加快国有粮⾷购销企业改⾰步伐，转变企业经营机制，完善粮⾷现货和期货市场，严禁地区封锁，搞好产销区协作，优化储备布局，加强粮⾷市场管理和宏观调控。当前，粮⾷主产区要注意发挥国有及国有控股粮⾷购销企业的主渠道作⽤。为保护种粮农民利益，要建⽴对农民的直接补贴制度。２００４年，国家从粮⾷风险基⾦中拿出部分资⾦，⽤于主产区种粮农民的直接补贴。其他地区也要对本省（区、市）粮⾷主产县（市）的种粮农民实⾏直接补贴。要本着调动农民种粮积极性的原则，制定便于操作和监督的实施办法，确保补贴资⾦真正落实到农民⼿中。（⼗⼋）继续推进农村税费改⾰。要巩固和发展税费改⾰的成果，进⼀步减轻农民的税费负担，为最终实现城乡税制的统⼀创造条件。逐步降低农业税税率，２００４年农业税税率总体上降低１个百分点，同时取消除烟叶外的农业特产税。降低税率后减少的地⽅财政收⼊，沿海发达地区原则上由⾃⼰消化，粮⾷主产区和中西部地区由中央财政通过转移⽀付解决。有条件的地⽅，可以进⼀步降低农业税税率或免征农业税。各地要严格按照减税⽐例调减到户，真正让农民得到实惠；确保各级转移⽀付资⾦专款专⽤，及时⾜额下拨到位。要据实核减合法征占耕地⽽减少的计税⾯积。要加快推进配套改⾰，继续加强农民负担监督管理，防⽌农民负担反弹，巩固农村税费改⾰成果。进⼀步精简乡镇机构和财政供养⼈员，积极稳妥地调整乡镇建制，有条件的可实⾏并村，提倡⼲部交叉任职。优化农村学校布局和教师队伍。进⼀步清理和规范涉农⾏政事业性收费。巩固治理利⽤职权发⾏报刊的成果。积极探索化解乡村债务的有效途径。尽快制定农业税的征管办法。（⼗九）改⾰和创新农村⾦融体制。要从农村实际和农民需要出发，按照有https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2004/content_63144.htmPage5of7中共中央国务院关于促进农⺠增加收⼊若⼲政策的意⻅__2004年第9号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:37利于增加农户和企业贷款，有利于改善农村⾦融服务的要求，加快改⾰和创新农村⾦融体制。建⽴⾦融机构对农村社区服务的机制，明确县域内各⾦融机构为“三农”服务的义务。扩⼤农村贷款利率浮动幅度。进⼀步完善邮政储蓄的有关政策，加⼤农村信⽤社改⾰的⼒度，缓解农村资⾦外流。农业银⾏等商业银⾏要创新⾦融产品和服务⽅式，拓宽信贷资⾦⽀农渠道。农业发展银⾏等政策性银⾏要调整职能，合理分⼯，扩⼤对农业、农村的服务范围。要总结农村信⽤社改⾰试点经验，创造条件，在全国逐步推开。继续扩⼤农户⼩额信⽤贷款和农户联保贷款。⿎励有条件的地⽅，在严格监管、有效防范⾦融风险的前提下，通过吸引社会资本和外资，积极兴办直接为“三农”服务的多种所有制的⾦融组织。有关部门要针对农户和农村中⼩企业的实际情况，研究提出多种担保办法，探索实⾏动产抵押、仓单质押、权益质押等担保形式。⿎励政府出资的各类信⽤担保机构积极拓展符合农村特点的担保业务，有条件的地⽅可设⽴农业担保机构，⿎励现有商业性担保机构开展农村担保业务。加快建⽴政策性农业保险制度，选择部分产品和部分地区率先试点，有条件的地⽅可对参加种养业保险的农户给予⼀定的保费补贴。**⼋、继续做好扶贫开发⼯作，解决农村贫困⼈⼜和受灾群众的⽣产⽣活困难**（⼆⼗）完善扶贫开发机制。各级党委和政府要进⼀步加⼤扶贫开发⼒度，强化扶贫⼯作责任制，提⾼扶贫成效。2004年国家继续增加扶贫资⾦投⼊。要在认真总结经验、切实摸清底数的基础上，对尚未解决温饱的贫困⼈⼜，进⼀步采取更有针对性的扶贫措施，切实做到扶贫到村到户。对丧失劳动能⼒的特困⼈⼜，要实⾏社会救济，适当提⾼救济标准。对缺乏基本⽣存条件地区的贫困⼈⼜，要积极稳妥地进⾏⽣态移民和易地扶贫。对低收⼊贫困⼈⼜，要着⼒帮助改善⽣产⽣活条件，发展特⾊产业，开辟增收渠道，减少和防⽌返贫。健全扶贫投⼊机制，加强资⾦管理，提⾼使⽤效益，所有扶贫资⾦的使⽤都要实⾏公⽰、公告和报账制度，严格监督和审计，确保资⾦及时⾜额到位，真正使贫困户受益。（⼆⼗⼀）认真安排好灾区和困难农户的⽣产⽣活。2003年不少地⽅遭受了严重的⾃然灾害，⼀些农民⽣产⽣活遇到严重困难。各级党委和政府要切实负起责任，组织⼲部深⼊灾区和贫困地区，摸底排查，核实灾情，及时把救济款物发放到户，按规定减免有关税费，组织和引导灾区群众开展⽣产⾃救。有条件的地⽅要探索建⽴农民最低⽣活保障制度。落实好农垦企业参加企业职⼯基本养⽼保险的政策。**九、加强党对促进农民增收⼯作的领导，确保各项增收政策落到实处**（⼆⼗⼆）要把解决好农业、农村、农民问题作为全党⼯作的重中之重。全党同志特别是各级领导⼲部要始终重视农业的基础地位，始终重视严格保护耕地和保护、提⾼粮⾷综合⽣产能⼒，始终重视维护粮⾷主产区和种粮农民的利益，始终重视增加农民特别是种粮农民的收⼊。对“三农”问题，不仅分管领导要直接抓，⽽且党政⼀把⼿要亲⾃抓，地、县两级领导要把主要精⼒放在农业和农村⼯作上。要树⽴科学发展观和正确的政绩观，把增加农民收⼊作为事关全局的⼤事，放在更加突出的位置。要切实转变⼯作作风，深⼊基层，深⼊群众，落实各项增收措施，为农民增收出主意、想办法、办实事、多服务，⼒戒浮夸和做表⾯⽂章，把增加农民收⼊作为衡量⼯作成效的⼀个重要标准。要加强对农村基层⼲部的培训，增强宗旨意识和法制、政策观念，增进与农民群众的感情，提⾼他们带领农民增收致富的⾃觉性和本领。各⾏各业都要树⽴全局观念，为农民增收贡https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2004/content_63144.htmPage6of7中共中央国务院关于促进农⺠增加收⼊若⼲政策的意⻅__2004年第9号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:37献⼒量，在全社会形成有利于农民增收的良好氛围。要激发⼴⼤农民群众艰苦创业的积极性，发扬⾃强不息的精神，通过⾟勤劳动⾛上富裕之路。同时，要按照中央的部署和要求，加强农村基层组织建设、精神⽂明建设和民主法制建设，做好农村其他各项⼯作，为农民增收提供有⼒的组织保障、智⼒⽀持和安定的社会环境。做好新阶段的农业和农村⼯作，努⼒增加农民收⼊，意义重⼤，任重道远。我们要紧密团结在以胡锦涛同志为总书记的党中央周围，⾼举邓⼩平理论伟⼤旗帜，认真实践“三个代表”重要思想，坚定信⼼，奋⼒开拓，扎实⼯作，为全⾯建设⼩康社会作出新的贡献。https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2004/content_63144.htmPage7of7

name_chn: 国务院关于推进资本市场改革开放和稳定发展的若干意见
text: **State Council Opinions on Advancing Reform, Opening-Up, and the Stable Development of the Capital Market**  Guo Fa [2004] No. 3To the people’s governments of all provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities directly under the Central Government; and to all ministries and commissions of the State Council, and all agencies directly under the State Council:Since the issuance of the *Notice of the State Council on Further Strengthening the Macroscopic Administration of the Securities Market* (Guo Fa [1992] No. 68), China’s capital market has developed rapidly and achieved remarkable results, becoming an important component of the socialist market economy. It has contributed significantly to reform and development of state-owned enterprises and the financial market, to optimizing resource allocation, and to promoting economic restructuring and growth. To implement the spirit of the 16th CPC National Congress and the Third Plenum of the 16th CPC Central Committee, and around the strategic goal of building a moderately prosperous society in all respects, we hereby put forward the following opinions on proactively advancing reform, opening-up, and the stable development of the capital market.## I. Fully recognize the importance of vigorously developing the capital marketVigorously developing the capital market is an important strategic task and bears on the goal of doubling GDP in the first 20 years of this century.  (1) It helps improve the socialist market economy, allowing the capital market to better optimize resource allocation and effectively transform societal funds into long-term investment.  (2) It benefits structural adjustment and strategic reorganization of the state-owned economy and accelerates the development of the non-state economy.  (3) It raises the share of direct financing, improves the structure and efficiency of the financial market, and safeguards financial security.China’s capital market has developed in step with economic reform. Due to uncoordinated reforms and limits in early institutional design, deep-seated problems and structural contradictions remain, constraining market functions. These are issues encountered in development and must likewise be resolved through development. The 16th Party Congress set the goal of building a moderately prosperous society in all respects; the Third Plenum adopted the *Decision on Some Issues Concerning the Improvement of the Socialist Market Economy*, which deployed capital-market development and pointed the way forward. We must recognize the situation, seize opportunities, shift mindsets, vigorously develop the capital market, raise the share of direct financing, foster a sound investment environment, and give full play to the capital market in capital formation, resource allocation, economic restructuring, and corporate governance—thus contributing to sustained, rapid, coordinated, and sound economic development and to building a moderately prosperous society in all respects.## II. Guiding principles and tasks for advancing reform, opening-up, and stable developmentGuiding principles: guided by Deng Xiaoping Theory and the Important Thought of the “Three Represents,” fully implement the spirit of the 16th Party Congress and the Third Plenum; uphold the principles of openness, fairness, and impartiality and the policy of rule of law, supervision, self-discipline, and standardization; serve the overall national economy and achieve coordinated development with it; govern the market according to law and protect investors—especially public investors; keep to a market-oriented reform approach, giving full play to market mechanisms; align reform intensity and development speed with market tolerance, balancing reform, development, and stability; solve problems encountered along the way through development while guarding against risk; and advance opening-up in a steady, step-by-step manner.Tasks: with expanding direct financing and improving the modern market system so the market plays a more fundamental role in resource allocation as the goals, build a transparent, efficient, well-structured, well-functioning, and safe capital market. To this end, establish a market system conducive to fundraising by diverse enterprises and to meeting varied investor needs efficiently; improve a market-led mechanism for product innovation and form a product structure in which price discovery and risk management advance together and equity and debt financing are coordinated; cultivate listed companies and intermediaries that are honest, compliant, well-governed, and disciplined by market forces with survival-of-the-fittest mechanisms; and improve a supervisory system with clear mandates, effective risk control, and good coordination so as to protect investors’ lawful rights and interests.## III. Further improve supporting policies to promote stable developmentA stable capital market requires policy guidance and support. All departments shall refine relevant policies to create a favorable environment.— **Improve the offering and listing approval system.** Establish mechanisms that allow quality enterprises of all types to access the market on an equal basis and raise allocation efficiency.  — **Emphasize investment returns.** Take practical measures to change the tendency among some listed companies to focus on listing over restructuring and on financing over returns; raise overall quality and provide investors with opportunities to share in economic growth and increase wealth.  — **Encourage compliant funds to enter the market.** Continue to develop securities investment funds. Support insurance funds in directly investing in the market in various ways; gradually raise the proportion of social security funds, enterprise annuities, and commercial insurance funds invested in the market. Foster a cohort of honest, law-abiding, professional institutional investors—making fund managers and insurers the market’s leading forces.  — **Broaden securities firms’ financing channels.** Continue supporting eligible firms to raise long-term funds via equity or bond issuance. Improve rules for pledge loans and access to the interbank market; set standards for M&A and underwriting-related loans; under sound risk control, create favorable conditions for prudent use of loans. Steadily pilot financing for fund management companies.  — **Address split-share structures prudently.** Regulate transfers of non-tradable shares and prevent state-asset losses. Address the circulation of currently non-tradable shares in a steady manner, respecting market laws, supporting stability and development, and protecting investors—especially public investors.  — **Refine tax policies.** Study and introduce tax policies that encourage public investment; improve turnover and income-tax administration for securities and futures firms; where conditions permit, implement centralized income-tax administration.## IV. Improve the market system and enrich investable instruments— **Build a multi-tier equity market.** On the basis of rational layout and clear functional positioning, gradually establish a multi-tier system to meet diverse financing needs, with corresponding offering and listing conditions and selection mechanisms. Continue to regulate and develop the main-board market and improve its issuer mix. Advance the growth-enterprise market in stages; improve venture-capital mechanisms; and broaden financing channels for SMEs. Explore and improve a share-transfer system under unified supervision.  — **Develop the bond market prudently.** Under strict risk control, encourage eligible enterprises to issue corporate bonds, change the lagging state of bond financing, enrich bond varieties, and promote coordinated development. Formulate and improve rules on issuance, trading, disclosure, and ratings; strengthen collateral and guarantees. Gradually build a centrally supervised, interconnected bond market.  — **Develop the futures market steadily.** Under strict risk control, gradually launch commodity futures that serve producers and consumers with price discovery and hedging functions.  — **Establish a market-led product-innovation mechanism.** Research and develop new instruments related to equities and bonds and their derivatives. Increase development of lower-risk fixed-income products as savings substitutes. Explore and develop asset-securitization products.## V. Further raise listed-company quality and advance standardized operations— **Improve quality.** The value of the securities market stems from the quality of listed companies. Directors and senior executives must maximize shareholder interests and steadily raise profitability. Further improve offering administration, implement a sponsor system, and support competitive, well-run, profitable companies in going public to enhance quality at the source. Encourage market-oriented M&A conducive to sustainable development. Improve refinancing policy and support quality listed firms in leveraging the market to grow stronger.  — **Standardize operations.** Improve corporate governance to form true checks and balances among the shareholders’ meeting, the board, the supervisory body, and management. Reinforce fiduciary duties of directors and executives and improve the independent-director system. Regulate controlling-shareholder behavior and pursue accountability where they harm listed companies or minority investors. Strengthen disclosure obligations of listed companies and other liable parties to ensure truthful, accurate, complete, and timely information. Establish sound incentive and restraint mechanisms for executives.  — **Improve exit mechanisms.** Take effective measures in tandem with multi-tier market building to improve exit. While enabling survival of the fittest, establish accountability for dereliction by executives of delisted firms and protect investors’ rights.## VI. Regulate the development of intermediaries and raise professional standards— **Build competitive modern financial enterprises in securities and futures.** Under prudential supervision, improve market-entry rules; urge firms to完善 governance,规范 shareholder behavior, and strengthen fiduciary duties of boards and managers. Reform client trading-settlement fund management and study sound custodial mechanisms. Strictly prohibit misappropriation of client assets. Improve internal controls and centralized management of branches.完善 risk metrics centered on net capital and urge prudent financial policies. Encourage growth via M&A and integration, and establish market-exit mechanisms.  — **Strengthen oversight of other intermediaries.** Regulate the development of investment advisors and credit-rating agencies; tighten management of accounting, legal, and asset-valuation institutions; and raise professional service quality.## VII. Strengthen the legal and integrity framework and raise supervisory capacity— **Improve laws and integrity.** In line with the overall plan to develop the capital market,完善 laws that support stable development and investor protection. Clean up administrative and local regulations, departmental rules, and policy documents that impede development, thereby creating a sound legal environment. Formulate market integrity codes, maintain order, and decisively bar institutions and individuals with egregious violations or serious bad faith.  — **Advance law-based administration and strengthen supervision.** In line with administrative-approval reform and the *Administrative Licensing Law*, improve the caliber and capacity of enforcers. Update supervisory concepts, establish approaches suited to the stage of market development,完善 tools, and raise efficiency. Further bolster supervisory forces, integrate resources, and build a politically and professionally strong team. Through effective oversight, raise fairness, transparency, and efficiency; lower systemic risk; and safeguard participants’ rights.  — **Leverage self-discipline and public oversight.** Give full play to the self-regulation of exchanges, the depository and clearing company, industry associations in securities and futures, and professional associations for lawyers, accountants, and valuers. Guide and strengthen the media’s role in publicity and supervision.## VIII. Strengthen coordination and guard against and defuse risks— **Foster a favorable environment.** Risk prevention in the capital market bears on financial security and healthy economic development. All regions and departments must support规范 development; when introducing policies related to the market, fully consider its sensitivity, complexity, and particularity; and establish mechanisms for information sharing, smooth communication, clear accountability, and coordination to create good conditions for stable development.  — **Jointly prevent and defuse risks.** All regions and departments must fulfill duties under the *Company Law* and other laws; take effective measures to prevent and promptly rectify false capital contributions by promoters and asset misappropriation by controlling shareholders or actual controllers; and strengthen lawful oversight of delisted firms to ensure orderly delisting. For securities and futures companies with major operational risks that must exit the market or face other administrative measures, local governments, financial regulators, and public-security and judicial organs shall coordinate and, pursuant to laws and policies, take active and effective steps in risk disposal. All regions and departments must establish rapid-response mechanisms for market contingencies and long-term mechanisms for risk prevention and resolution.  — **Crack down on violations.** Implement the State Council’s directives on rectifying and regulating market order; strictly prohibit illegal securities issuance; illegal establishment of securities/futures firms; illegal brokerage of securities/futures; illegal or disguised establishment of trading venues; and other violations. Fiscal, public-security, audit, and market-regulation departments and state-asset supervisors shall strengthen coordination, intensify enforcement, and maintain market order.## IX. Summarize experience and advance opening-up prudently— **Honor WTO commitments on opening the securities services sector.** Encourage qualified foreign institutions to take equity stakes in securities firms and fund managers, and continue the Qualified Foreign Institutional Investor (QFII) program.  — **Make active use of overseas markets.** In line with market rules and international practice, support qualified mainland enterprises in issuing and listing securities overseas. Support qualified mainland institutions and personnel in conducting overseas capital-market-related services and futures hedging. Carefully study a Qualified Domestic Institutional Investor (QDII) regime.  — **Strengthen exchanges and cooperation.** Implement Closer Economic Partnership Arrangements with Hong Kong and Macao. Further enhance ties and cooperation with relevant international organizations and overseas securities regulators.Vigorously developing the capital market is a major decision of the CPC Central Committee and the State Council from an overall and strategic perspective. All regions and departments must attach great importance, adopt a whole-of-government perspective, fully recognize its significance, strengthen confidence, seize opportunities, and innovate—jointly creating conditions to promote reform, opening-up, and the stable development of China’s capital market, and contributing to the grand goal of building a moderately prosperous society in all respects.State Council  January 31, 2004
