2005年中央⼀号⽂件2025/9/12,10:38中⽂简体|中⽂繁体|英⽂|邮箱|本⽹站搜索搜索删除**⽹站⾸页**|**今⽇中国**|**中国概况**|**法律法规**|**公⽂公报**|**政务互动**|**政府建设**|**⼯作动态**|**⼈事任免**|**新闻发布**当前位置：中国概况中央政府门户⽹站www.gov.cn2006年02⽉22⽇来源：新华⽹【字体：⼤中⼩】打印本⻚关闭窗⼝**2005年中央⼀号⽂件****中共中央国务院关于进⼀步加强农村⼯作提⾼农业综合⽣产能⼒若⼲政策的意见**（２００４年１２⽉３１⽇）党中央、国务院历来⾼度重视农业、农村和农民⼯作。２００４年，在宏观调控中注重加强农业，实⾏⼀系列更直接、更有⼒的政策措施。各地区各部门认真贯彻落实中央决策，保护和调动了农民积极性，农村呈现出良好的发展局⾯。粮⾷⽣产出现重要转机，农民收⼊实现较快增长，农村改⾰迈出重⼤步伐，农村社会事业取得新的进展。这对促进国民经济发展和保持社会稳定发挥了⾄关重要的作⽤。但必须清醒地看到，农业依然是国民经济发展的薄弱环节，投⼊不⾜、基础脆弱的状况并没有改变，粮⾷增产、农民增收的长效机制并没有建⽴，制约农业和农村发展的深层次⽭盾并没有消除，农村经济社会发展明显滞后的局⾯并没有根本改观，农村改⾰和发展仍然处在艰难的爬坡和攻坚阶段，保持农村发展好势头的任务⾮常艰巨。２００５年农业和农村⼯作的总体要求是：认真贯彻党的⼗六⼤和⼗六届三中、四中全会精神，全⾯落实科学发展观，坚持统筹城乡发展的⽅略，坚持“多予少取放活”的⽅针，稳定、完善和强化各项⽀农政策，切实加强农业综合⽣产能⼒建设，继续调整农业和农村经济结构，进⼀步深化农村改⾰，努⼒实现粮⾷稳定增产、农民持续增收，促进农村经济社会全⾯发展。加强农业基础，繁荣农村经济，必须继续采取综合措施。当前和今后⼀个时期，要把加强农业基础设施建设，加快农业科技进步，提⾼农业综合⽣产能⼒，作为⼀项重⼤⽽紧迫的战略任务，切实抓紧抓好。这既是确保国家粮⾷安全的物质基础，又是促进农民增收的必要条件；既是解决当前农业发展突出⽭盾的迫切需要，又是增强农业发展后劲的战略选择；既是推动农村经济发展的重⼤举措，又是实现农村社会进步的重要保https://www.gov.cn/test/2006-02/22/content_207406.htmPage1of92005年中央⼀号⽂件2025/9/12,10:38障。抓住了这个重点，就抓住了农业发展的关键；把握了这个环节，就把握了农业现代化的根本；做好了这项⼯作，就为农村全⾯建设⼩康社会打下了坚实的基础。要进⼀步调动农民群众务农种粮的积极性和地⽅政府重农抓粮的积极性，以严格保护耕地为基础，以加强农⽥⽔利建设为重点，以推进科技进步为⽀撑，以健全服务体系为保障，⼒争经过⼏年的努⼒，使农业的物质技术条件明显改善，⼟地产出率和劳动⽣产率明显提⾼，农业综合效益和竞争⼒明显增强。**⼀、稳定、完善和强化扶持农业发展的政策，进⼀步调动农民的积极性**（⼀）继续加⼤“两减免、三补贴”等政策实施⼒度。减免农业税、取消除烟叶以外的农业特产税，对种粮农民实⾏直接补贴，对部分地区农民实⾏良种补贴和农机具购置补贴，是党中央、国务院为加强农业和粮⾷⽣产采取的重⼤措施，对调动农民种粮积极性、保护和提⾼粮⾷⽣产能⼒意义重⼤。这些⾏之有效的政策不能改变，给农民的实惠不能减少，⽀农的⼒度要不断加⼤。进⼀步扩⼤农业税免征范围，加⼤农业税减征⼒度。２００５年，在国家扶贫开发⼯作重点县实⾏免征农业税试点，在其他地区进⼀步降低农业税税率。在牧区开展取消牧业税试点。国有农垦企业执⾏与所在地同等的农业税减免政策。因减免农（牧）业税⽽减少的地⽅财政收⼊，由中央财政安排专项转移⽀付给予适当补助。有条件的地⽅，可⾃主决定进⾏农业税免征试点。继续对种粮农民实⾏直接补贴，有条件的地⽅可进⼀步加⼤补贴⼒度。中央财政继续增加良种补贴和农机具购置补贴资⾦，地⽅财政也要根据当地财⼒和农业发展实际安排⼀定的良种补贴和农机具购置补贴资⾦。继续对短缺的重点粮⾷品种在主产区实⾏最低收购价政策，逐步建⽴和完善稳定粮⾷市场价格、保护种粮农民利益的制度和机制。搞好农业⽣产资料供应和市场管理，继续实⾏化肥出⼚限价政策，通过税收等⼿段合理调节化肥进出⼜，控制农资价格过快上涨，严厉打击制售假冒伪劣农业⽣产资料等各种坑农害农⾏为。（⼆）切实加强对粮⾷主产区的⽀持。为调动地⽅政府发展粮⾷⽣产的积极性，缓解中西部地区特别是粮⾷主产区县乡的财政困难，中央财政要采取有效措施，根据粮⾷播种⾯积、产量和商品量等因素，对粮⾷主产县通过转移⽀付给予奖励和补助。建⽴粮⾷主产区与主销区之间的利益协调机制，调整中央财政对粮⾷风险基⾦的补助⽐例，并通过其他经济⼿段筹集⼀定资⾦，⽀持粮⾷主产区加强⽣产能⼒建设，有关部门要抓紧研究提出具体实施⽅案。（三）建⽴稳定增长的⽀农资⾦渠道。要下决⼼调整国民收⼊分配结构，在稳定现有各项农业投⼊的基础上，新增财政⽀出和固定资产投资要切实向农业、农村、农民倾斜，逐步建⽴稳定的农业投⼊增长机制。针对当前农⽥⽔利设施薄弱、亟待加强的状况，从２００５年起，要在继续搞好⼤中型农⽥⽔利基础设施建设的同时，不断加⼤对⼩型农⽥⽔利基础设施建设的投⼊⼒度。中央和省级财政要在整合有关专项资⾦的基础上，从预算内新增财政收⼊中安排⼀部分资⾦，设⽴⼩型农⽥⽔利设施建设补助专项资https://www.gov.cn/test/2006-02/22/content_207406.htmPage2of92005年中央⼀号⽂件2025/9/12,10:38⾦，对农户投⼯投劳开展⼩型农⽥⽔利设施建设予以⽀持。预算内经常性固定资产投资和国债资⾦要增加安排⼩型农⽥⽔利基础设施建设项⽬。⼟地出让⾦⽤于农业⼟地开发部分和新增建设⽤地有偿使⽤费，要结合⼟地开发整理安排⼀定资⾦⽤于⼩型农⽥⽔利建设。市、县两级政府也要切实增加对⼩型农⽥⽔利建设的投⼊。要尽快⽴法，把国家的重⼤⽀农政策制度化、规范化。**⼆、坚决实⾏最严格的耕地保护制度，切实提⾼耕地质量**（四）严格保护耕地。控制⾮农建设占⽤耕地，确保基本农⽥总量不减少、质量不下降、⽤途不改变，并落实到地块和农户。严禁占⽤基本农⽥挖塘养鱼、种树造林或进⾏其他破坏耕作层的活动。修订耕地占⽤税暂⾏条例，提⾼耕地占⽤税税率，严格控制减免。搞好乡镇⼟地利⽤总体规划和村庄、集镇规划，引导农户和农村集约⽤地。加强集体建设⽤地和农民宅基地管理，⿎励农村开展⼟地整理和村庄整治，推动新办乡村⼯业向镇区集中，提⾼农村各类⽤地的利⽤率。加快推进农村⼟地征收、征⽤制度改⾰。（五）认真落实农村⼟地承包政策。针对⼀些地⽅存在的随意收回农户承包地、强迫农户流转承包地等问题，各地要对⼟地⼆轮承包政策落实情况进⾏全⾯检查，对违反法律和政策的要坚决予以纠正，并追究责任。要妥善处理⼟地承包纠纷，及时化解⽭盾，维护农民合法权益。尊重和保障农户拥有承包地和从事农业⽣产的权利，尊重和保障外出务⼯农民的⼟地承包权和经营⾃主权。承包经营权流转和发展适度规模经营，必须在农户⾃愿、有偿的前提下依法进⾏，防⽌⽚⾯追求⼟地集中。各省、⾃治区、直辖市要尽快制定农村⼟地承包法实施办法。（六）努⼒培肥地⼒。中央和省级财政要较⼤幅度增加农业综合开发投⼊，新增资⾦主要安排在粮⾷主产区集中⽤于中低产⽥改造，建设⾼标准基本农⽥。搞好“沃⼟⼯程”建设，增加投⼊，加⼤⼟壤肥⼒调查和监测⼯作⼒度，尽快建⽴全国耕地质量动态监测和预警系统，为农民科学种⽥提供指导和服务。改⾰传统耕作⽅法，发展保护性耕作。推⼴测⼟配⽅施肥，推⾏有机肥综合利⽤与⽆害化处理，引导农民多施农家肥，增加⼟壤有机质。**三、加强农⽥⽔利和⽣态建设，提⾼农业抗御⾃然灾害的能⼒**（七）加快实施以节⽔改造为中⼼的⼤型灌区续建配套。新增固定资产投资要把⼤型灌区续建配套作为重点，并不断加⼤投⼊⼒度，着⼒搞好⽥间⼯程建设，更新改造⽼化机电设备，完善灌排体系。开展续建配套灌区的末级渠系建设试点。继续推进节⽔灌溉⽰范，在粮⾷主产区进⾏规模化建设试点。有条件的地区要加快农村⽔利现代化步伐。⽔源条件较好的地区要结合重点⽔利枢纽建设，扩⼤灌溉⾯积。⼲旱缺⽔地区要积极发展节⽔旱作农业，继续建设旱作农业⽰范区。各地要加强灌溉⽤⽔计量，积极实⾏⽤⽔总量控制和定额管理。从２００５年起，选择部分地区开展对农民购买节⽔设备实https://www.gov.cn/test/2006-02/22/content_207406.htmPage3of92005年中央⼀号⽂件2025/9/12,10:38⾏补助的试点。继续搞好病险⽔库除险加固。抓好地⽅中型⽔源、中⼩河流治理等⼯程建设。（⼋）狠抓⼩型农⽥⽔利建设。重点建设⽥间灌排⼯程、⼩型灌区、⾮灌区抗旱⽔源⼯程。加⼤粮⾷主产区中低产⽥盐碱和渍害治理⼒度。加快丘陵⼭区和其他⼲旱缺⽔地区⾬⽔集蓄利⽤⼯程建设。地⽅政府要切实承担起搞好⼩型农⽥⽔利建设的责任。在坚决按时取消劳动积累⼯和义务⼯制度的同时，各地要积极探索新形势下开展农⽥⽔利基本建设的新机制、新办法。要严格区分加重农民负担与农民⾃愿投⼯投劳改善⾃⼰⽣产⽣活条件的政策界限，发扬农民⾃⼒更⽣的好传统，在切实加强民主决策和民主管理的前提下，本着⾃愿互利、注重实效、控制标准、严格规范的原则，引导农民对直接受益的⼩型农⽥⽔利设施建设投⼯投劳，国家对农民兴建⼩微型⽔利设施所需材料给予适当补助，有关部门要抓紧研究制定具体办法。（九）坚持不懈搞好⽣态重点⼯程建设。继续实施天然林保护等⼯程，完善相关政策。退耕还林⼯作要科学规划，突出重点，注重实效，稳步推进。要采取有效措施，在退耕还林地区建设好基本⼜粮⽥，培育后续产业，切实解决农民的长期⽣计问题，进⼀步巩固退耕还林成果。抓好防护林体系和农⽥林⽹建设，为建设⾼标准农⽥营造良好的⽣态屏障。切实搞好京津风沙源治理等防沙治沙⼯程。继续推进⼭区综合开发。进⼀步加强草原建设和保护，加快实施退牧还草⼯程，搞好牧区⽔利建设，加强森林草原防⽕和草原⿏⾍害防治⼯作。继续搞好长江、黄河等重点流域的⽔⼟保持⼯作，采取淤地坝等多种措施推进⼩流域综合治理，加强南⽅丘陵红⼟区、东北⿊⼟漫岗区和西南⽯漠化区的⽔⼟流失综合治理。切实防治耕地和⽔污染。**四、加快农业科技创新，提⾼农业科技含量**（⼗）加强农业科技创新能⼒建设。要⼤幅度增加对农业科研的投⼊，加快建⽴以政府为主导、社会⼒量⼴泛参与的多元化农业科研投⼊体系，形成稳定的投⼊增长机制。要不断提⾼国家科技投⼊⽤于农业科研的⽐重，有关重⼤科技项⽬和攻关计划要较⼤幅度增加农业科研投资的规模。深化农业科研体制改⾰，抓紧建⽴国家农业科技创新体系。加强国家基地的创新能⼒建设，搞好农业基础研究和关键技术的研究开发，加快⽣物技术和信息技术等⾼新技术的研究。根据全国农业综合区划，在整合现有资源基础上，依托具有明显优势的省级农业科研单位和⾼等学校，建设区域性的农业科研中⼼，负责推进区域农业科技创新，开展重⼤应⽤技术攻关和试验研究。加强农业领域的国家实验室、改良中⼼、⼯程中⼼和重点实验室建设，改善农业科研机构设施条件和装备⽔平，加快建设国家农业科研⾼级⼈才培养基地。（⼗⼀）加⼤良种良法的推⼴⼒度。继续实施“种⼦⼯程”、“畜禽⽔产良种⼯程”，搞好⼤宗农作物、畜禽良种繁育基地建设和扩繁推⼴。从２００５年起，国家设⽴超级稻https://www.gov.cn/test/2006-02/22/content_207406.htmPage4of92005年中央⼀号⽂件2025/9/12,10:38推⼴项⽬。扩⼤重⼤农业技术推⼴项⽬专项补贴规模，优先扶持优质⾼产、节本增效的组装集成与配套技术开发。加强农作物重⼤病⾍害防治。认真组织实施“科技⼊户⼯程”，扶持科技⽰范户，提⾼他们的辐射带动能⼒。继续安排农业科技成果转化资⾦和国外先进农业技术引进资⾦。（⼗⼆）加快改⾰农业技术推⼴体系。要按照强化公益性职能、放活经营性服务的要求，加⼤农业技术推⼴体系的改⾰⼒度。国家的公益性农技推⼴机构主要承担关键技术的引进、试验、⽰范，农作物病⾍害、动物疫病及农业灾害的监测、预报、防治和处置，农产品⽣产过程中的质量安全检测、监测和强制性检验，农业资源、农业⽣态环境和农业投⼊品使⽤监测，⽔资源管理和防汛抗旱，农业公共信息和培训教育服务等职能。对公益性技术推⼴⼯作，各级财政要在经费上予以保证。同时，积极稳妥地将⼀般性技术推⼴和经营性服务分离出去，按照市场化⽅式运作。发挥农业院校在农业技术推⼴中的作⽤。积极培育农民专业技术协会和农业科技型企业。探索农业技术推⼴的新机制和新办法，对农技推⼴项⽬实⾏招投标制度，⿎励各类农技推⼴组织、⼈员及有关企业公平参与申报。在总结试点经验基础上，有关部门要抓紧提出加强农业技术推⼴体系建设的指导意见。**五、加强农村基础设施建设，改善农业发展环境**（⼗三）加⼤农村⼩型基础设施建设⼒度。要继续增加农村“六⼩⼯程”的投资规模，扩⼤建设范围，提⾼⼯程质量。在巩固⼈畜饮⽔解困成果的基础上，⾼度重视农村饮⽔安全，解决好⾼氟⽔、⾼砷⽔、苦咸⽔、⾎吸⾍病等地区的饮⽔安全问题，有关部门要抓紧制定规划。调整公路建设投资结构，加⼤农村公路建设⼒度，统筹考虑农村公路建设的技术标准、质量管理和养护等问题，合理确定农村公路投资补助标准。加快农村能源建设步伐，继续推进农村沼⽓建设，积极发展太阳能、风能等新型洁净能源和可再⽣能源。扩⼤“⼩⽔电代燃料”⼯程建设规模和实施范围，搞好农村电⽹改造⼯程的后续建设和经营管理。增加扶贫开发投⼊，加强贫困地区农村基础设施建设，引导农民治⽔改⼟修路，实施整村推进扶贫规划，完善扶贫开发机制，加快脱贫致富步伐。（⼗四）加快农产品流通和检验检测设施建设。在继续搞好集贸市场和批发市场建设的同时，注重发挥期货市场的引导作⽤，⿎励发展现代物流、连锁经营、电⼦商务等新型业态和流通⽅式。改造现有农产品批发市场，发展经纪⼈代理、农产品拍卖、⽹上交易等⽅式，增强交易功能。加快建设以冷藏和低温仓储运输为主的农产品冷链系统，对农产品仓储设施建设⽤地按⼯业⽤地对待。重视发挥供销合作社在农产品流通和⽣产资料供应等⽅⾯的作⽤。⿎励邮政系统开展直接为农民⽣产⽣活服务的连锁配送业务。加强农业信息化建设。⽓象⼯作要加强对农业的服务。各省、⾃治区、直辖市要加快开通整车运输鲜活农产品的绿⾊通道，抓紧落实降低或免交车辆通⾏费的有关规定，并尽快实现省际互通。积极推进农业标准化。要加强农产品检验检测基础设施建设，提⾼进https://www.gov.cn/test/2006-02/22/content_207406.htmPage5of92005年中央⼀号⽂件2025/9/12,10:38出境检验检疫装备和检测技术⽔平，增强防范和处理外来有害⽣物⼊侵的能⼒。加强农产品质量安全⼯作，实施农产品认证认可，禁⽌⽣产、销售和使⽤⾼毒、⾼残留农药，加快农产品质量安全⽴法。（⼗五）加强农业发展的综合配套体系建设。搞好种养业良种体系、农业科技创新与应⽤体系、动植物保护体系、农产品质量安全体系、农产品市场信息体系、农业资源与⽣态保护体系、农业社会化服务与管理体系等“七⼤体系”建设。有关部门要抓紧制定建设规划，加强政策引导，明确职责分⼯，多渠道增加投⼊，加快建设步伐。**六、继续推进农业和农村经济结构调整，提⾼农业竞争⼒**（⼗六）进⼀步抓好粮⾷⽣产。要坚持⽴⾜国内实现粮⾷基本⾃给的⽅针，以市场需求为导向，改善品种结构，优化区域布局，着⼒提⾼单产，努⼒保持粮⾷供求总量⼤体平衡。稳定和增加粮⾷播种⾯积，改⾰种植制度，提⾼复种指数。实施优质粮⾷产业⼯程，建设商品粮⽣产基地，推进优质粮⾷产业带建设。加强粮⾷⽣产技术、农机、信息和产销等服务，搞好良种培育和供应，促进粮⾷⽣产节本增效。完善和落实粮⾷省长负责制，粮⾷主销区和产销平衡区也要认真抓好粮⾷⽣产，保证必要的粮⾷储备，维护粮⾷市场的稳定。（⼗七）⼤⼒发展特⾊农业。要发挥区域⽐较优势，建设农产品产业带，发展特⾊农业。各地要⽴⾜资源优势，选择具有地域特⾊和市场前景的品种作为开发重点，尽快形成有竞争⼒的产业体系。各地和有关部门要专门制定规划，明确相关政策，加快发展特⾊农业。建设特⾊农业标准化⽰范基地，筛选、繁育优良品种，把传统⽣产⽅式与现代技术结合起来，提升特⾊农产品的品质和⽣产⽔平。加⼤对特⾊农产品的保护⼒度，加快推⾏原产地等标识制度，维护原产地⽣产经营者的合法权益。整合特⾊农产品品牌，⽀持做⼤做强名牌产品。提⾼农产品国际竞争⼒，促进优势农产品出⼜，扩⼤农业对外开放。（⼗⼋）加快发展畜牧业。增强农业综合⽣产能⼒必须培育发达的畜牧业。牧区要加快推⾏围栏放牧、轮牧休牧等⽣产⽅式，搞好饲草料地建设，改良牲畜品种，进⼀步减轻草场过牧的压⼒。农区要充分发挥作物秸秆和劳动⼒资源丰富的优势，积极发展节粮型畜牧业，提⾼规模化、集约化饲养⽔平。通过⼩额信贷、财政贴息等⽅式，引导有条件的地⽅发展养殖⼩区。要增加投⼊，⽀持养殖⼩区建设畜禽粪便和污⽔⽆害化处理设施。从２００５年起，实施奶⽜良种繁育项⽬补贴。加快建⽴安全优质⾼效的饲料⽣产体系。搞好动物防疫是确保畜牧业稳定发展的根本保障，事关⼈民群众的⾝体健康和社会公共安全，要下决⼼增加投⼊，加强建设，完善制度，健全体系。要抓紧制定动物防疫体系建设规划，加快建设重⼤动物疫病监测预警、动物疫病预防控制、动物防疫检疫监督、兽药质量监察和残留监控、动物防疫技术⽀撑、动物防疫物质保障等系统。加https://www.gov.cn/test/2006-02/22/content_207406.htmPage6of92005年中央⼀号⽂件2025/9/12,10:38快重点兽⽤⽣物制品⽣产企业的技术改造。尽快建⽴健全动物疫病防治队伍，动物检疫监督机构的⼈员经费和⼯作经费全额纳⼊各级财政预算。（⼗九）重点⽀持粮⾷主产区发展农产品加⼯业。⼤⼒扶持⾷品加⼯业特别是粮⾷主产区以粮⾷为主要原料的加⼯业。粮⾷主产区要⽴⾜本地优势，以发展农产品加⼯业为突破⼜，⾛新型⼯业化道路，促进农业增效、农民增收和地区经济发展。采取财政贴息等⽅式，⽀持粮⾷主产区农产品加⼯企业进⾏技术引进和技术改造，建设仓储设施。尽快完善农产品加⼯业增值税政策。按照增值税转型改⾰的统⼀部署，加快⾷品等农产品加⼯业增值税转型的步伐。（⼆⼗）发展农业产业化经营。继续加⼤对多种所有制、多种经营形式的农业产业化龙头企业的⽀持⼒度。⿎励龙头企业以多种利益联结⽅式，带动基地和农户发展。农业银⾏和其他国有商业银⾏要按照有关规定，加快改进对龙头企业的信贷服务，切实解决龙头企业收购资⾦紧张的问题。农业发展银⾏对符合条件的以粮棉油⽣产、流通或加⼯转化为主业的龙头企业，可以提供贷款。积极探索龙头企业和专业合作组织为农户承贷承还、提供贷款担保等有效办法。⽀持农民专业合作组织发展，对专业合作组织及其所办加⼯、流通实体适当减免有关税费。集体经济组织要增强实⼒，搞好服务，同其他专业合作组织⼀起发挥联结龙头企业和农户的桥梁和纽带作⽤。乡镇企业要加快结构调整、技术进步和体制创新，积极参与农业产业化经营。**七、改⾰和完善农村投融资体制，健全农业投⼊机制**（⼆⼗⼀）完善农业投资管理体制。进⼀步放宽农业和农村基础设施投资领域，采取贴息、补助、税收等措施，发挥国家农业资⾦投⼊的导向作⽤，⿎励社会资本积极投资开发农业和建设农村基础设施。逐步降低中西部地区对涉农固定资产投资的资⾦配套⽐例，不得采取加重农民负担的⽅式进⾏资⾦配套。继续加⼤国家农业资⾦投⼊的整合⼒度，⿎励以县为单位，通过规划引导、统筹安排、明确职责、项⽬带动等⽅式整合投资，提⾼资⾦使⽤效率。对国家投资和补助的乡村建设项⽬，要加快实⾏公⽰制度，通过招投标、资⾦跟踪监督和项⽬后评估等办法，确保管好⽤好资⾦，保证项⽬质量。（⼆⼗⼆）加快农村⼩型基础设施产权制度改⾰。要在总结经验的基础上，加⼤改⾰⼒度，明晰产权，明确责任，充分调动各⽅⾯投资建设和管好农村⼩型基础设施的积极性。农户⾃建或⾃⽤为主的⼩微型⼯程，产权归个⼈所有，由乡镇⼈民政府核发产权证。对受益户较多的⼯程，可组建合作管理组织，国家补助形成的资产归合作组织所有。对经营性的⼯程，可组建法⼈实体，实⾏企业化运作，也可拍卖给个⼈经营。对业主开发建设的农村基础设施，地⽅⼈民政府要给予扶持，并规范其收费标准和服务⾏为。加快⼩型农村⽔利⼯程管理体制改⾰步伐。推进农村⼩型基础设施产权制度改⾰，要充分尊重农民意愿，维护⼯程原受益者的合法权益。https://www.gov.cn/test/2006-02/22/content_207406.htmPage7of92005年中央⼀号⽂件2025/9/12,10:38（⼆⼗三）推进农村⾦融改⾰和创新。要针对农村⾦融需求的特点，加快构建功能完善、分⼯合理、产权明晰、监管有⼒的农村⾦融体系。抓紧研究制定农村⾦融总体改⾰⽅案。继续深化农村信⽤社改⾰，要在完善治理结构、强化约束机制、增强⽀农服务能⼒等⽅⾯取得成效，进⼀步发挥其农村⾦融的主⼒军作⽤。抓紧制定县域内各⾦融机构承担⽀持“三农”义务的政策措施，明确⾦融机构在县及县以下机构、⽹点新增存款⽤于⽀持当地农业和农村经济发展的⽐例。采取有效办法，引导县及县以下吸收的邮政储蓄资⾦回流农村。加⼤政策性⾦融⽀农⼒度，增加⽀持农业和农村发展的中长期贷款，在完善运⾏机制基础上强化农业发展银⾏的⽀农作⽤，拓宽业务范围。农业银⾏要继续发挥⽀持农业、服务农村的作⽤。培育竞争性的农村⾦融市场，有关部门要抓紧制定农村新办多种所有制⾦融机构的准⼊条件和监管办法，在有效防范⾦融风险的前提下，尽快启动试点⼯作。有条件的地⽅，可以探索建⽴更加贴近农民和农村需要、由⾃然⼈或企业发起的⼩额信贷组织。加快落实对农户和农村中⼩企业实⾏多种抵押担保形式的有关规定。扩⼤农业政策性保险的试点范围，⿎励商业性保险机构开展农业保险业务。**⼋、提⾼农村劳动者素质，促进农民和农村社会全⾯发展**（⼆⼗四）全⾯开展农民职业技能培训⼯作。要结合农业结构调整、发展特⾊农业和⽣产实际的需要，开展针对性强、务实有效、通俗易懂的农业科技培训。农村中学也要加强农业先进实⽤技术教育。适应产业结构升级和提⾼竞争⼒的需要，进⼀步搞好农民转业转岗培训⼯作，扩⼤“农村劳动⼒转移培训阳光⼯程”实施规模，加快农村劳动⼒转移。各级财政要⼤幅度增加农民职业技能培训投⼊，采取补助、培训券、报账制等⽅式，努⼒提⾼培训的实⽤性和资⾦的使⽤效率。⼴泛调动社会各⽅⾯⼒量参与农民职业技能培训的积极性。（⼆⼗五）进⼀步发展农村教育、卫⽣、⽂化等社会事业。要落实新增教育、卫⽣、⽂化、计划⽣育等事业经费主要⽤于农村的规定，⽤于县以下的⽐例不低于７０％。到２００７年，争取全国农村义务教育阶段贫困家庭学⽣都能享受到免书本费、免杂费、补助寄宿⽣⽣活费，国家扶贫开发⼯作重点县要加快实施步伐。坚持以农村为重点的卫⽣⼯作⽅针，积极稳妥推进新型农村合作医疗试点和农村医疗救助⼯作，实施农村医疗卫⽣基础设施建设规划，加快农村医疗卫⽣⼈才培养，提⾼农村医疗服务⽔平和应对突发公共卫⽣事件的能⼒。加强艾滋病、⾎吸⾍病等重点疾病的防治⼯作，推动改⽔改厕等农村环境卫⽣综合治理。搞好农村计划⽣育，对农村部分计划⽣育家庭实⾏奖励扶助制度，抓好“少⽣快富扶贫⼯程”试点。有条件的地⽅可以探索建⽴农村社会保障制度。加⼤农村重⼤⽂化建设项⽬实施⼒度，完善农村公共⽂化服务体系，⿎励社会⼒量参与农村⽂化建设。巩固农村宣传⽂化阵地，加强农村⽂化市场管理。切实提⾼农村⼴播电视“村村通”⽔平，做好送书下乡、电影放映、⽂化信息资源共享等⼯作。**九、加强和改善党对农村⼯作的领导**https://www.gov.cn/test/2006-02/22/content_207406.htmPage8of92005年中央⼀号⽂件2025/9/12,10:38（⼆⼗六）坚持把解决好“三农”问题作为全党⼯作的重中之重。这是推进⼯业化、城镇化和现代化历史进程中必须长期坚持的⼀个重⼤⽅针。全党同志特别是各级领导⼲部要深刻认识“三农”⼯作的长期性、复杂性和艰巨性。在当前粮⾷增产、农民增收的好形势下，要始终保持清醒认识，对农业和农村⼯作不能有丝毫松懈。要适应我国⼯业化发展阶段和政策趋向的变化，按照⼯业反哺农业、城市⽀持农村的要求，切实把农业和农村经济发展放到国民经济全局中统筹安排，更加⾃觉地调整国民收⼊分配结构，更加主动地加强农业基础地位，进⼀步加⼤农村改⾰⼒度，加⼤对农业的⽀持⼒度，加⼤对“三农”⼯作的领导⼒度。（⼆⼗七）进⼀步加强农村党建⼯作。要认真贯彻党的⼗六届四中全会精神，按照开展保持共产党员先进性教育活动的要求，深⼊开展农村党的建设“三级联创”活动，增强农村基层党组织的创造⼒、凝聚⼒和战⽃⼒，充分发挥农村基层党组织的领导核⼼作⽤，进⼀步巩固党在农村的执政基础。加⼤农村党员⼲部的教育培训⼒度，扩⼤农村党员⼲部远程教育试点，增强他们为民服务、廉洁⾃律的意识，转变作风，提⾼执⾏政策、依法办事、发展经济、维护稳定的能⼒，树⽴基层⼲部的良好形象。要关⼼农村基层⼲部，帮助他们解决⼯作和⽣活上的困难。扩⼤农村基层民主，完善村务公开、政务公开和民主管理，建⽴健全村党组织领导的充满活⼒的村民⾃治机制，切实维护农民的民主权利。推进农村法制建设，加强农村普法教育，搞好农业综合执法。做好新形势下的农村群众⼯作，妥善处理各种社会⽭盾，关⼼农村困难群众⽣产⽣活，营造和谐的社会氛围。搞好农村社会治安综合治理，依法打击各种犯罪活动。深⼊推进群众性精神⽂明创建活动，引导⼴⼤农民群众艰苦奋⽃、⾃强不息，加快全⾯建设⼩康社会的步伐。进⼀步加强农村⼯作，提⾼农业综合⽣产能⼒，实现粮⾷增产、农业增效、农民增收，意义重⼤，任务艰巨。我们要紧密团结在以胡锦涛同志为总书记的党中央周围，⾼举邓⼩平理论和“三个代表”重要思想伟⼤旗帜，坚定信⼼，奋⼒开拓，扎实⼯作，为全⾯完成农业和农村⼯作各项任务⽽努⼒奋⽃。【E-mail推荐发送】【纠错】打印本⻚关闭窗⼝Copyright©2013www.gov.cnAllRightsReserved**版权所有：中国政府⽹**https://www.gov.cn/test/2006-02/22/content_207406.htmPage9of9

name_chn: 中共中央 国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若干意见
text: # **Opinions of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council on Vigorously Developing Modern Agriculture and Steadily Advancing the Building of a New Socialist Countryside***(December 31, 2006)***Zhong Fa [2007] No. 1**Agricultural abundance strengthens the nation’s foundations; the prosperity of farmers enriches the country; and rural stability safeguards social peace. Strengthening work related to agriculture, rural areas, and farmers (the “three rurals”), vigorously developing modern agriculture, and steadily advancing the building of a new socialist countryside are essential for fully implementing the Scientific Outlook on Development, for building a socialist harmonious society, and for accelerating socialist modernization.Since 2006, all regions and departments have earnestly implemented the decisions of the central authorities, and the building of a new socialist countryside has made a good start. Despite severe natural disasters, grain output has continued to grow, farmers’ incomes have kept rising, comprehensive rural reforms have progressed steadily, rural public undertakings have been visibly strengthened, and rural society has become more stable. Nevertheless, there remain prominent contradictions and problems in rural development: agricultural infrastructure is still weak; sustained income growth for farmers remains difficult; the development of rural social undertakings still lags behind; and changing the backward appearance of rural areas and narrowing the urban–rural gap will require arduous effort. We must heighten our sense of urgency; unwaveringly uphold the strategic principle that solving the “three rural” issues is the top priority of the entire Party; never relax in promoting stable agricultural development and sustained increases in farmers’ incomes; never weaken policies that support and benefit agriculture and farmers; and never slacken in the solid advancement of all tasks for building the new countryside.Developing modern agriculture is the primary task in building the new socialist countryside and an inevitable requirement for leading rural work with the Scientific Outlook on Development. Advancing modern agriculture accords with the objective trend of China’s economic development and with the general laws of contemporary agricultural development worldwide. It is the fundamental path to increasing farmers’ incomes, an important measure to enhance comprehensive agricultural production capacity, and the industrial foundation for building the new socialist countryside. We must equip agriculture with modern material conditions, transform agriculture with modern science and technology, upgrade agriculture through modern industrial systems, advance agriculture with modern business forms, guide agriculture with modern development concepts, and develop agriculture by cultivating a new type of farmer. We must raise the levels of irrigation and water conservancy, mechanization, and informatization; increase land output rates, resource utilization rates, and agricultural labor productivity; and enhance the quality, efficiency, and competitiveness of agriculture. The process of building modern agriculture is the very process of transforming traditional agriculture and continuously developing rural productive forces, and of changing the mode of agricultural growth to promote sound and rapid development. We must regard the building of modern agriculture as a long-term and arduous task running through the entire process of new countryside construction and modernization, and carry it out with real resolve and concrete actions.The overall requirements for agricultural and rural work in 2007 are as follows: guided by Deng Xiaoping Theory and the important thought of the “Three Represents,” fully implement the Scientific Outlook on Development; continue to treat the “three rural” issues as the top priority of the entire Party; coordinate urban and rural economic and social development; implement the policy of industry supporting agriculture, cities supporting the countryside, and “giving more, taking less, and loosening control”; consolidate, improve, and strengthen policies that support and benefit agriculture and farmers; substantially increase agricultural investment; actively promote the building of modern agriculture; strengthen rural public services; deepen comprehensive rural reform; promote stable grain development, sustained increases in farmers’ incomes, and greater rural harmony; ensure new progress in building the new countryside; and consolidate and expand the sound momentum in agriculture and rural areas.## **I. Increase Investment in the “Three Rurals” and Establish an Investment Safeguard Mechanism to Promote Modern Agriculture**Increasing agricultural investment is urgently needed to build modern agriculture and strengthen agricultural fundamentals. We must continually open new channels of agricultural investment and gradually form a diversified mechanism in which farmers actively raise funds and contribute labor, governments continually increase inputs, and social forces participate extensively. In particular, we must seize the current opportunity of rapid economic growth and rising fiscal revenues to further consolidate, improve, and strengthen policies that support and benefit agriculture and farmers, substantially increase investment in the “three rurals,” and deliver practical benefits to farmers.1. **Substantially increase investment in the “three rurals.”** All levels of government must shift the focus of infrastructure construction and social undertakings toward rural areas. Increments in national fiscal expenditures for education, health, culture, and fixed-asset investment shall mainly be used in rural areas, and the share of government land transfer proceeds used in rural areas shall be gradually increased. A mechanism for the steady growth of “three rural” investment shall be established by actively adjusting the structures of fiscal expenditure, fixed-asset investment, and credit allocation. The annual growth in total agricultural inputs from central and sub-provincial (county level and above) finances shall exceed the growth in their regular fiscal revenues, so as to rapidly form stable funding sources for building the new countryside. In 2007, incremental fiscal inputs supporting agriculture shall continue to exceed those of the previous year; increments of national fixed-asset investment used in rural areas shall continue to exceed those of the previous year; and increments of land transfer proceeds used for rural construction shall continue to exceed those of the previous year. Additional revenues arising from higher taxes and fees on construction land shall be used primarily for the “three rurals.” The overall plan for rural financial reform shall be accelerated to form a rural financial system in which commercial finance, cooperative finance, policy finance, and microcredit organizations are complementary and functionally complete, and to explore various guarantee mechanisms that guide financial institutions to increase credit to the “three rurals.” We shall strengthen the integration of funds supporting agriculture; promptly establish mechanisms for aligning investment plans and departmental information-sharing; improve input management; and concentrate resources on key regions and projects to raise the efficiency of funds. Government funds must play a leveraging role, guiding farmers and all sectors of society to invest in rural construction. Agricultural investment legislation shall be accelerated and law enforcement inspections strengthened.2. **Improve agricultural support and subsidy systems.** The subsidy policies implemented in recent years have been well received at the grassroots and among farmers; they must be consolidated, improved, and strengthened, gradually forming an agricultural subsidy system characterized by clear objectives, direct benefits, diverse types, and simple procedures. Funds used by localities for direct subsidies to grain growers shall reach more than 50% of grain risk funds. The intensity of improved seed subsidies shall be increased, and the scope and varieties subsidized shall be expanded. The scale, models, and scope of subsidies for the purchase of agricultural machinery shall be expanded. Comprehensive subsidies for agricultural production inputs shall be increased. The central finance shall increase rewards to major grain-producing counties and increase subsidies to financially strapped counties and townships to boost revenues and cut expenditures. At the same time, minimum purchase price policies shall continue to be implemented for key regions and major grain varieties, with measures gradually refined and systems improved.3. **Establish agricultural risk prevention mechanisms.** We shall strengthen systems for forecasting and early warning, and emergency response to natural disasters and major plant and animal diseases and pests, enhancing disaster prevention and mitigation capacity in agriculture. We shall actively develop agricultural insurance and, under the principles of government guidance, policy support, market operation, and farmer voluntariness, establish and improve an agricultural insurance system. Pilot programs for policy-based agricultural insurance shall be expanded; all levels of finance shall subsidize premiums for farmers who purchase agricultural insurance; mechanisms for transferring and sharing catastrophic agricultural risks shall be improved; and a reinsurance system supported by both central and local finances shall be explored. Leading enterprises and intermediary organizations are encouraged to help farmers participate in agricultural insurance.4. **Encourage farmers and social forces to invest in modern agriculture.** We shall fully leverage farmers’ principal role in building the new countryside and developing modern agriculture, guiding them to carry forward the spirit of self-reliance, increase production and intellectual inputs, and raise scientific farming and intensive management levels. Mechanisms for village-level “one matter, one discussion” fund-raising and labor contribution shall be improved, and localities shall be supported to implement reward-and-subsidy systems for public-interest projects funded under this mechanism. Appropriate subsidies may be granted to households that invest funds or labor to build production and living facilities from which they directly benefit. Through tax incentives, subsidies, equity participation, interest discounts, guarantees, and other means, we shall create a favorable environment for social forces to invest in modern agriculture. Enterprises that donate to or invest in rural public-interest facilities may enjoy corresponding tax preferences as prescribed.## **II. Accelerate Agricultural Infrastructure and Raise the Facility and Equipment Level of Modern Agriculture**Improving agricultural facilities and equipment is an important component of building modern agriculture. We must resolutely increase inputs, strengthen infrastructure construction, and accelerate the improvement of backward production and living conditions in rural areas.1. **Vigorously advance farmland water conservancy.** Strengthening farmland water conservancy facilities must be treated as a major undertaking for modern agriculture. We shall accelerate the continued construction and water-saving renovation of large irrigation districts, improve terminal canal systems, and implement total volume control and quota management for irrigation water. The scope and scale of technological renovation for large pumping stations shall be expanded. Comprehensive agricultural development shall increase inputs for water-saving renovation in medium-sized irrigation districts. We shall strengthen water-source projects to resist drought in hilly and mountainous areas and accelerate construction of small and medium water-source projects in the southwest. Special funds for small-scale farmland water conservancy projects shall be increased. We shall intensify efforts to reinforce and rehabilitate dangerous reservoirs, strengthen the management of small and medium rivers, and improve the rural water environment. Farmers shall be guided to build small-scale water conservancy works that directly benefit them, and effective practices of farmer water-user participation in irrigation management shall be promoted.2. **Effectively improve cultivated land quality.** Responsibilities for cultivated land protection shall be strengthened and implemented, and the scale of converting agricultural land to construction land strictly controlled. Rural land use shall be guided toward conservation and intensification, and production activities that damage the arable layer must be strictly prevented. Land reclamation and consolidation shall be intensified. According to the requirements of level fields, fertile soil, and supporting roads and canals, we shall accelerate the building of high-standard farmland with drought–flood protection and stable high yields. The “Fertile Soil Project” shall be accelerated, with a focus on supporting the production of organic fertilizers and the construction of integrated water–fertilizer facilities, encouraging the development of green manure, straw incorporation, and the application of farmyard manure. Pilot projects and subsidy scales for raising soil organic matter shall be expanded. Inputs from comprehensive agricultural development shall be increased to actively support high-standard farmland construction.3. **Accelerate the development of rural clean energy.** Inputs for rural biogas construction shall continue to rise, and qualified localities shall be supported to develop medium- and large-scale biogas projects at livestock and poultry farms. In suitable areas, we shall actively develop straw gasification and such clean energies as solar and wind, speed up the building of green energy demonstration counties, and implement the program to supply one million households in the northwest with solar cookers. The rural clean-up program shall be accelerated to promote comprehensive treatment and utilization of human and animal waste, crop residues, household garbage, and sewage. Planning and management of rural hydropower resources shall be strengthened, the scope and scale of small hydropower projects substituting for fuel shall be expanded, and investment and credit support for rural hydropower development in poor areas shall be increased.4. **Increase the intensity of rural infrastructure construction.** During the Eleventh Five-Year Plan period, we shall resolve the drinking-water safety problem for 160 million rural residents, giving priority to small-population ethnic groups, reservoir resettlers, schistosomiasis-endemic areas, and rural schools, and strive to basically achieve safe drinking water for rural residents by 2015, with qualified localities accelerating progress. Rural highway construction shall be intensified, with strengthened maintenance and management and improved mechanisms for funding construction and maintenance. Rural power grid renovation and construction shall continue; policies for unified urban–rural grids and pricing shall be implemented; the “electricity-to-every-household” projects shall be accelerated; and the “Hundreds–Thousands–Ten-thousands” program for new countryside electrification shall be implemented. Farmers shall be encouraged, with government support and on a voluntary basis, to raise funds and contribute labor to build small-scale rural infrastructure. Rural living environments shall be improved; village governance planning and pilots shall be well carried out; and rural construction land shall be conserved. Small towns and county economies shall continue to develop, with full play given to their radiation effects on surrounding rural areas to drive modern agriculture and extend infrastructure and public services into rural areas.5. **Develop new agricultural industries for inputs and equipment.** Agricultural input industries are important supports to enhance agricultural material equipment. We shall actively develop new fertilizers, low-toxicity and high-efficiency pesticides, multifunctional agricultural machinery, and degradable agricultural films. Fertilizer structures shall be optimized, with faster development of specialty fertilizers and slow-release fertilizers suited to different soils and crops. Support for the creation of new pesticides shall be increased to accelerate product upgrading. Technological innovation and structural adjustment in the agricultural machinery sector shall be accelerated, focusing on large and medium tractors, multifunctional high-efficiency general-purpose combine harvesters, and various specialized machines. Policies favorable to agricultural input industries shall be formulated promptly.6. **Enhance the sustainability of agriculture.** Circular and ecological agriculture shall be encouraged; qualified localities may accelerate organic agriculture. Major ecological projects such as natural forest protection and returning farmland to forests shall continue, with further policy improvement and consolidation of achievements. A comprehensive program to control rocky desertification shall be launched, and coastal shelterbelt projects shall continue. The forest ecological benefit compensation fund system shall be improved, and a grassland ecological compensation mechanism explored. The “returning grazing land to grassland” program shall be accelerated, and forest and grassland fire prevention strengthened. Soil and water loss control shall be expedited in the upper and middle reaches of the Yangtze and Yellow Rivers and in southwest karst areas, with a comprehensive management program for slope farmland erosion initiated. Rural environmental protection shall be strengthened to reduce agricultural non-point source pollution and improve water pollution control in rivers, lakes, and seas.## **III. Promote Agricultural Science and Technology Innovation and Strengthen the Scientific and Technological Support for Modern Agriculture**Scientific and technological progress is the fundamental way to overcome the dual constraints of resources and markets on China’s agriculture. We must focus on enhancing indigenous innovation capacity, accelerating the transformation and application of scientific and technological achievements, increasing the contribution of science and technology to agricultural growth, and promoting intensive, clean, safe, and sustainable agricultural production.1. **Strengthen the agricultural science and technology innovation system.** Inputs in agricultural research shall be significantly increased, and the innovation capacity of national bases and regional agricultural research centers shall be strengthened. Industry-specific agricultural research programs shall be launched to support agricultural science and technology projects. R&D that provides important support to modern agriculture shall receive focused assistance. Funding for the transformation of agricultural scientific achievements and for introducing advanced foreign agricultural technologies shall continue. The integration and piloting of agricultural technological achievements shall be accelerated. Reforms of agricultural research institutes shall be deepened, pilots for stable support to such institutes carried out, and per-capita institutional funding levels gradually raised. Incentive mechanisms encouraging researchers’ innovation shall be established. The role of higher education institutions in agricultural science and technology research shall be fully leveraged. Agriculture-related enterprises shall be guided to undertake technological innovation; expenses incurred by enterprises in cooperating with research units and in promoting new varieties and technologies to base households shall enjoy relevant corporate income tax preferences. For agriculture-related enterprises that, in accordance with national industrial policies and provisions, import processing and production equipment, import tariffs and import-stage VAT may be exempted.2. **Advance the delivery of agricultural technologies to villages and households.** Effective mechanisms and methods shall be actively explored to deliver agricultural technological achievements to villages and households, forming a dissemination network that links technical instructors with demonstration households and surrounding farmers. Grassroots agricultural extension systems shall be further strengthened, with sound funding safeguards for public-interest functions, improved working conditions, and higher personnel quality. Integration of agriculture, science, and education shall be promoted, with agricultural colleges playing active roles in extension. Special funds for “Science and Technology for Enriching the People and Strengthening Counties” shall be expanded to enhance the transformation capacity of grassroots achievements. Major agricultural technology extension shall continue to be supported, and the “Science and Technology into Households” program shall be accelerated. Large-scale households adept at applying science and technology shall be cultivated to demonstrate and drive adoption among farmers.3. **Vigorously promote resource-conserving agricultural technologies.** We shall actively develop and apply various conservation technologies to improve the efficiency of agricultural resources and inputs. Water-saving irrigation technologies shall be widely popularized, and demonstration projects for dryland water-saving agriculture initiated. The scope and subsidy scale for soil testing and formulated fertilization shall be expanded, and advanced fertilization technologies such as diagnostic and precision application further promoted. Farming systems and cropping patterns shall be reformed; no-tillage cultivation subsidy pilots shall be carried out; and precise and semi-precise seeding technologies shall be popularized. Intensive, efficient, and ecological technologies for livestock, poultry, and aquaculture shall be promoted to reduce feed and energy consumption.4. **Actively develop agricultural mechanization.** We shall improve the structure and level of agricultural machinery and pursue a mechanization path suited to national conditions and local realities. The mechanization process of grain production shall be accelerated; operating and service areas for mechanization shall be expanded according to local conditions; and cross-regional services for plowing, sowing, and harvesting during key farming seasons shall be organized. Mechanization testing and demonstration bases shall be built, and technologies such as rice transplanting, deep loosening of land, deep fertilizer application, and straw crushing and returning shall be vigorously promoted. Agricultural producers shall be encouraged to jointly use and cooperatively operate machinery; large machinery households and professional service organizations shall be cultivated and developed; and marketization and industrialization of machinery services shall be advanced. Safety supervision of agricultural machinery shall be strengthened.5. **Accelerate agricultural informatization.** Equipping agriculture with information technology is of great significance for speeding up the transformation of traditional agriculture. Systems for agricultural information collection and release shall be improved; agriculture-related information resources shall be integrated; and the standardization of agricultural data collection and collation shall be promoted. Information service platforms shall be strengthened; the “Golden Agriculture” project shall be further implemented; and a four-level national–provincial–municipal–county interconnected agricultural information network shall be established. Public agricultural databases with unified standards and strong practicality shall be built. Integrated rural information infrastructure shall be strengthened; service models shall be innovated; and rural informatization demonstration projects shall be launched. The role of meteorological services in agricultural production and farmers’ lives shall be actively leveraged. Qualified localities are encouraged to apply GPS, GIS, remote sensing, and management information systems in agricultural production.## **IV. Develop the Multiple Functions of Agriculture and Improve the Industrial System for Modern Agriculture**Agriculture not only ensures food security but also provides raw materials, employment and income, ecological protection, leisure and tourism, and cultural inheritance. Building modern agriculture requires attention to developing agriculture’s multiple functions, advancing in both breadth and depth, and continually optimizing and upgrading agricultural structures.1. **Promote stable grain development.** We shall continue to rely on domestic production to ensure basic self-sufficiency in grain and gradually build a grain security system featuring stable supply, effective regulation, and efficient operation. In 2007, we shall strive to stabilize grain-sown area, raise yields per unit, optimize varieties, and improve quality. Projects for high-quality grain industries, seeds, plant protection, and grain yield improvement through science and technology shall continue. The construction of advantageous grain industry belts shall be advanced; qualified localities shall be encouraged to appropriately develop contiguous planting; and support for grain processing and conversion shall be increased. Major grain-producing areas shall be supported in developing grain production and promoting economic growth, with funds and projects for water conservancy, medium- and low-yield field improvement, and agro-processing tilted toward these areas. Monitoring and regulation of grain production, consumption, stocks, and imports/exports shall be strengthened, a grain security early-warning system established and improved, and domestic grain market stability maintained.2. **Develop healthy animal husbandry.** Healthy breeding is directly related to people’s life safety. We shall shift breeding concepts, adjust models, and build strong livestock industries. In line with the principle of prevention first and moving the prevention gate forward, healthy breeding methods shall be promoted and feed safety strengthened to control quality and safety at the source. Pastoral areas shall actively promote stall-feeding and semi-stall-feeding; agricultural areas with conditions shall develop scaled operations and livestock and poultry breeding zones. Subsidies for breeding zones shall be expanded, and improved-breed subsidies for dairy cattle shall continue. Inputs for animal disease prevention and control shall be increased; grassroots veterinary teams strengthened; systems for monitoring and emergency response to major animal epidemics improved; and animal identification and disease traceability systems established and refined. Aquaculture shall promote superior varieties, strengthen disease prevention, and raise healthy breeding levels.3. **Vigorously develop characteristic agriculture.** Based on local natural and cultural advantages, leading products shall be cultivated and regional layouts optimized. To meet people’s increasingly diverse material and cultural needs, various material and intangible products and industries that are special and specialized, novel and unique, and refined and beautiful shall be developed according to local conditions, with particular attention to horticulture, specialty breeding, and rural tourism. Through planning guidance, policy support, and demonstration, “one village, one product” shall be supported. A group of specialized villages and townships with distinct characteristics, diverse types, and strong competitiveness shall be cultivated rapidly.4. **Support the development of leading enterprises in agricultural industrialization.** Leading enterprises are powerful drivers guiding farmers to develop modern agriculture. Through interest subsidies, equity investment, and tax preferences, the development of agro-processing shall be supported. Central and provincial finances shall earmark funds to support agro-processing, backing leading enterprises in technology introduction and technological renovation. VAT policies for agro-processing shall be improved to reduce tax burdens. Policies supporting agricultural industrialized operations shall be implemented, and financial inputs at all levels gradually increased. Comprehensive agricultural development funds shall actively support agricultural industrialization. Financial institutions shall increase credit support for leading enterprises, focusing on resolving difficulties in procurement funding. Relevant departments shall strengthen guidance and services for leading enterprises.5. **Advance the biomass industry.** Centered on bioenergy, bio-based products, and biomass raw materials, the biomass industry is a sunrise industry that expands agricultural functions and promotes efficient resource use. We shall accelerate R&D of biomass fuels, fertilizers, and feeds using crop straw and other materials; launch pilots for straw biogasification and densified solid fuels; and support straw-for-feed utilization. Technological R&D, demonstration, reserves, and dissemination in the biomass industry shall be strengthened, and a forestry–agriculture biomass science and technology program organized. Qualified localities are encouraged to utilize barren mountains and wastelands to develop biomass raw material crops. Supportive policies favorable to the biomass industry shall be formulated rapidly.## **V. Improve the Rural Market System and Develop a Logistics Industry Suited to Modern Agriculture**A developed logistics industry and a sound market system are important guarantees for modern agriculture. We must strengthen rural circulation infrastructure, develop modern circulation methods and new business formats, cultivate diversified and multi-tiered market participants, and build an open, unified, and orderly market system.1. **Build agricultural product circulation facilities and develop new formats.** Preferential fiscal and tax measures shall support rural circulation infrastructure and logistics enterprises. With rational layout, a batch of wholesale markets for fresh agricultural products featuring advanced facilities, complete functions, and standardized transactions shall be built at a faster pace. Modern circulation methods such as rural chain operations and e-commerce shall be energetically developed. Projects such as the “Ten Thousand Villages and One Thousand Towns Market,” the “Double Hundred Markets,” the “New Rural Modern Circulation Network,” and “Rural Business Information Services” shall be accelerated. Leading enterprises and farmers’ professional cooperatives shall be supported to directly supply agricultural products to urban supermarkets, community markets, and convenience stores. Agricultural input supermarkets and village shops shall be vigorously supported. For chain operations in agricultural inputs and rural daily consumer goods, enterprises’ headquarters may handle unified business registration and operational approvals. The green channel policy for transporting fresh agricultural products shall be effectively implemented. The market environment for farmers selling agricultural products in cities shall be improved. Futures markets for agricultural products shall be further standardized and improved to fully play their roles in guiding production, stabilizing markets, and hedging risks.2. **Strengthen quality and safety supervision and market services for agricultural products.** The Agricultural Product Quality and Safety Law shall be conscientiously implemented, and regulatory capabilities improved. The standard system for quality and safety shall be accelerated, and a traceability system established. Standardized production and management shall be promoted for key regions, varieties, links, and enterprises. Exclusive operation for pesticides and veterinary drugs and standardized use of additives shall be implemented, and pilots for Good Agricultural Practices initiated. Efforts shall continue to strengthen testing of production environments and product quality; certifications for pollution-free, green, and organic products shall be performed; and registered trademarks, geographical indications, and well-known brands protected according to law. Labeling systems for GM foods, liquid milk, and other products shall be strictly enforced. Intellectual property protection in agriculture shall be strengthened. A plan for building quality and safety testing systems shall be launched. Supervision over agricultural inputs and the quality and safety of rural food and drugs shall be strengthened, and a credit file system and quality assurance compensation mechanism for agricultural input circulation enterprises explored.3. **Strengthen regulation of agricultural imports and exports.** The strategy of “going global” in agriculture shall be accelerated. Export bases for agricultural products shall be strengthened, enterprise health registration systems and international certification implemented for exports, and mutual recognition of testing results promoted. Enterprises exporting agricultural products shall be supported to register brands in foreign markets and conduct overseas market research, marketing planning, and product promotion. Relevant departments and industry associations shall actively carry out training services on technical standards and international market promotion. Credit and insurance services for agricultural exports shall be improved. Fees for inspection and quarantine of export agricultural products shall be reduced or exempted, procedures simplified, and customs clearance for agricultural exports, especially fresh products, expedited. Regulation and management of imports of major agricultural commodities shall be strengthened to protect farmers’ interests and maintain domestic production and market stability.4. **Actively develop diversified market participants in circulation.** Rural brokers, specialized households in agricultural product transportation and marketing, and various rural circulation intermediaries shall be cultivated at a faster pace. Through fiscal, tax, and financial measures, all kinds of industrial and commercial enterprises shall be encouraged to participate in rural market construction and in the operation of agricultural products and inputs via acquisition, merger, equity participation, and franchising, thereby cultivating large agriculture-related commercial groups. Supply and marketing cooperatives shall promote open operations, develop alliances and cooperation, and enhance operational vitality and market competitiveness. The postal system shall leverage its logistics networks to expand services to farmers. State-owned grain enterprises shall accelerate reform and play their roles in linking production and sales and stabilizing markets. Enterprises in commerce, pharmaceuticals, communications, and culture shall actively develop rural markets.## **VI. Cultivate a New Type of Farmer and Build the Talent Team for Modern Agriculture**Ultimately, modern agriculture depends on farmers who are educated, skilled in technology, and adept at management. We must leverage rural human resources, significantly increase investment in human resource development, comprehensively improve the quality of rural laborers, and provide strong talent and intellectual support for building the new countryside.1. **Cultivate modern agricultural business entities.** Skills training in agricultural production shall be carried out widely; the scale of the new-type farmer science-and-technology training program and the “Science Popularization for Enriching the People and Revitalizing Villages” program shall be expanded; and a practical talent training program for the new countryside shall be organized. Efforts shall be made to cultivate the broad masses of farm households into modern agricultural operators with strong market awareness, high production skills, and certain management capacities. Various business entities suited to modern agriculture—such as specialized households in planting and breeding, farmers’ professional cooperatives, leading enterprises, and collective economic organizations—shall be actively developed. Through supportive policies, migrant workers shall be encouraged to return home with technology and capital to start businesses and become leaders in modern agriculture. Industrial and commercial enterprises, graduates from colleges and vocational schools, and local talents shall be supported in establishing modern agricultural enterprises.2. **Strengthen training for farmers’ employment transfer and protect their rights and interests.** Support for employment-transfer training programs such as the “Sunshine Project” shall be increased; subsidy standards raised; training content enriched; methods innovated; and mechanisms improved. To meet the needs of the manufacturing sector, cohorts of intermediate- and senior-level technicians shall be cultivated among migrant workers. Employers and training institutions are encouraged to conduct targeted, order-based training. Social forces shall be organized and mobilized to participate widely in training for employment transfer. In line with unified urban–rural and fair employment principles, institutional safeguards for farmers seeking employment outside shall be improved. Public employment services for migrant workers shall be strengthened; problems related to schooling for their children, work injury, medical care, and pension security shall be addressed more quickly; and their quality of life and social status shall be effectively improved.3. **Accelerate the development of rural social undertakings.** This is both an inevitable requirement for enhancing farmers’ overall quality and an important component of building a harmonious socialist society. Rural schooling conditions shall continue to improve, and balanced development of compulsory education between urban and rural areas shall be promoted. In 2007, all rural students in the compulsory-education stage shall be exempted from tuition and miscellaneous fees; textbooks shall be provided free to students from poor families; and boarding students shall receive living subsidies; qualified localities may expand the scope of exemptions and subsidies. Rural vocational and adult education shall be accelerated, and enrollments targeting rural areas expanded. Assistance to students in agriculture and forestry majors at colleges and vocational schools shall be increased; and qualified localities may reduce or exempt tuition for students in planting and breeding majors. Efforts shall be made to eliminate illiteracy among young and middle-aged rural residents. Pilots for the new rural cooperative medical system shall continue to expand, with standardized management strengthened, beneficiary coverage enlarged, and the rural medical assistance system continuously improved. Family planning in rural areas shall be strengthened, policies for awards and assistance to rural family-planning households fully implemented, and the “fewer births, quicker prosperity” program intensified. Investments in rural culture shall increase; rural public cultural service systems shall be strengthened; and the “village-by-village access to radio and television” and rural cultural information-sharing projects accelerated.4. **Improve the capacity of rural public service personnel.** Training systems shall be established for township and village cadres, rural teachers, village doctors, family-planning workers, grassroots agricultural extension personnel, and other service personnel related to farmers’ production and livelihoods; on-the-job training shall be strengthened to raise service capacity. Employment mechanisms for township public institutions shall be further reformed; methods for involving beneficiary farmers in performance appraisal of grassroots service personnel shall be explored. Support from urban teachers, medical workers, and cultural workers to rural areas shall be increased; measures encouraging graduates of colleges and vocational schools to serve in rural areas shall be improved; and they shall be guided to start businesses in the countryside. Qualified localities may select graduates to hold village and township positions to improve grassroots cadre structures.## **VII. Deepen Comprehensive Rural Reform and Innovate the Institutions and Mechanisms that Drive Modern Agriculture**Deepening comprehensive rural reform is an objective requirement for consolidating the achievements of rural tax-and-fee reform and for advancing modern agriculture. We must accelerate reform to provide institutional safeguards for building modern agriculture.1. **Deepen comprehensive rural reform.** Qualified provinces shall pilot township institutional reforms province-wide; those not yet qualified shall further expand pilots at municipal and county levels. Based on rural realities, township government functions shall be transformed, grassroots administrative management systems and working mechanisms improved, and public service levels enhanced. Reform measures for guaranteeing funding for rural compulsory education shall be earnestly implemented, educational personnel system reforms carried out, and rural teaching forces strengthened. A sub-provincial fiscal management system matching financial resources with administrative responsibilities shall be established and improved, the fiscal transfer payment system further enhanced, and the capacity of grassroots governments to provide public goods and services strengthened. Central and provincial finances shall allocate certain funds to reward and subsidize localities that advance comprehensive rural reform.2. **Coordinate and advance other rural reforms.** The Agricultural Bank of China and the Agricultural Development Bank of China shall further play backbone and pillar roles in rural finance; reform of rural credit cooperatives shall be deepened; and the proportions of newly increased deposits that financial institutions within a county invest locally shall be clarified as soon as possible. Postal savings and other funds shall be guided back to rural areas; rural microcredit shall be vigorously developed; and in poor areas, pilots for developing rural multi-ownership financial organizations shall be launched first. The basic rural operation system shall be upheld; land contract relations stabilized; the transfer of contracted management rights standardized; and land expropriation reform accelerated. Fishermen’s rights to use water areas and tidal flats for aquaculture shall be stabilized. Reform of rural collective forest tenure shall be accelerated, with clear land-use rights and tree ownership, liberalized operational rights, and implemented disposal rights; reform pilots for state-owned forest region tenure shall continue. Water-rights reform shall be actively pursued, exploring systems for allocation, registration, transfer, and other management. Reform of state farms shall continue to advance, enterprise operating mechanisms transformed, and the demonstrative role of state farms in modern agriculture leveraged.3. **Clean up and resolve township and village debts.** A comprehensive verification of township and village debts shall be carried out to ascertain totals, lock in legacy debts, stop new debts, and actively explore measures and approaches for resolution, giving priority to debts arising from compulsory education, infrastructure, and social public undertakings. Localities shall properly handle arrears of agricultural taxes from past years; under strict policy control and strengthened review, debts that should be reduced or exempted must be resolutely reduced or exempted, and those that can be forgiven shall be forgiven. Central and provincial finances shall allocate certain reward funds to encourage localities to proactively resolve township and village debts.4. **Vigorously develop farmers’ professional cooperative organizations.** The Farmers’ Professional Cooperatives Law shall be conscientiously implemented to support the accelerated development of cooperative organizations. Localities shall speed up the formulation of detailed implementation measures; relevant departments shall promptly issue specific registration measures, financial and accounting systems, and supporting policies. Tax and financial policies favorable to cooperatives shall be adopted; funding scales for demonstration projects shall be increased; and cooperatives shall be supported in marketing, information services, technical training, agro-processing and storage, and agricultural input procurement and operation.## **VIII. Strengthen the Party’s Leadership over Rural Work to Ensure Tangible Results in Building Modern Agriculture**Party leadership over rural work is a fine tradition and a major principle of our Party, and the fundamental guarantee for building modern agriculture and advancing the new socialist countryside. The entire Party must attach great importance to the “three rural” work, place the building of modern agriculture prominently on its agenda, and attend to it with real resolve and practical measures. We must adapt to new situations arising from profound changes in rural economy and society, adjust working ideas, transform working styles, and improve working methods.1. **Party committees and governments at all levels must persevere in the “three rural” work.** Top leaders at all levels must personally take charge of the “three rural” work; provincial, municipal, and county Party committees shall designate responsible comrades to oversee it. Comprehensive institutions for the “three rural” work shall be strengthened to implement the Party’s policies supporting and benefiting agriculture and farmers. All departments shall adopt an overall perspective, strengthen service awareness, and support modern agriculture more proactively. Leading cadres at all levels shall improve conduct by going deep into villages and among the masses to help resolve practical problems at the grassroots. Regional types shall be further refined, measures made more specific, and guidance provided with stronger targeting. Rural grassroots organizations shall be strengthened, and the results of the Party’s campaign to maintain the advanced nature of Communist Party members in rural areas shall be consolidated and developed. Activities for creating “three-level joint excellence” in rural Party building shall continue; leadership teams of township and village Party organizations shall be well selected and strengthened; and village-level organizational systems centered on village Party organizations shall be improved. The modern distance education project for rural Party members and cadres shall be accelerated, and the building of village-level activity venues vigorously promoted. Effective pathways shall be explored to select outstanding village cadres as township civil servants and township leaders; care shall be shown for village cadres’ work and lives; and their compensation and security levels reasonably raised. Rural grassroots Party conduct and clean government shall be strengthened to enhance the creativity, cohesion, and combat effectiveness of rural Party organizations.2. **Strengthen and improve rural social governance.** In response to new changes in rural economic and social development, social governance systems and mechanisms shall be innovated, and the maintenance of rural social stability strengthened. Channels for expressing rural public sentiment and opinion shall be broadened; mechanisms for investigating and mediating conflicts and disputes established and improved; and comprehensive methods shall be employed to properly resolve emerging and trending issues in rural society. The “Safe Countryside” initiative shall be carried out in depth; rural policing strengthened; comprehensive management of public security improved; and rural order kept stable. Extensive legal publicity and education shall be carried out to raise legal awareness, guiding farmers to express interests rationally and lawfully, and to exercise their rights and fulfill obligations in accordance with the law. Rural emergency management systems shall be established to enhance crisis response capacity.3. **Promote rural harmony and development.** A dynamic villagers’ self-governance mechanism under the leadership of village Party organizations shall be improved, village affairs disclosure systems perfected, and grassroots democracy promoted. Rural spiritual civilization shall be strengthened; education in the socialist concept of honor and disgrace centered on the “Eight Honors and Eight Shames” shall be carried out; mass spiritual civilization creation activities advanced; and farmers guided to revere science, resist superstition, and change outdated customs. Support shall be increased for developing social undertakings and improving production and living conditions in central and western regions, especially old revolutionary base areas, areas inhabited by ethnic minorities, border regions, and poor areas. Development-oriented poverty alleviation shall continue, with a whole-village approach and household-specific measures to enhance effectiveness. A national rural minimum living security system shall be established; localities shall determine coverage and standards based on economic development and fiscal capacity; regions that have established the system shall be encouraged to improve it; regions that have not shall be supported to establish it; and the central finance shall provide appropriate subsidies to fiscally difficult areas. Qualified localities may explore various forms of rural pension insurance systems. Great attention shall be paid to undertakings for rural persons with disabilities; practical difficulties of families of migrant workers addressed properly. Rural fire safety and other safety work shall be strengthened; the spread of polluting enterprises into rural areas resolutely stopped; monitoring of geological disasters strengthened; disaster relief done well; and the people’s sense of security effectively enhanced.Accelerating the building of modern agriculture and advancing the new socialist countryside are of great significance and entail arduous tasks. Let us unite closely around the Party Central Committee with Comrade Hu Jintao as General Secretary, hold high the great banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory and the important thought of the “Three Represents,” fully implement the Scientific Outlook on Development, strengthen confidence, work in a down-to-earth manner, and forge ahead with determination to make new contributions to building a socialist harmonious society.
