中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅__2007年第8号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:40**中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代****农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意见**（2006年12⽉31⽇）中发〔2007〕1号农业丰则基础强，农民富则国家盛，农村稳则社会安。加强“三农”⼯作，积极发展现代农业，扎实推进社会主义新农村建设，是全⾯落实科学发展观、构建社会主义和谐社会的必然要求，是加快社会主义现代化建设的重⼤任务。2006年以来，各地区各部门认真贯彻中央部署，社会主义新农村建设开局良好。在⾃然灾害较重的情况下，粮⾷继续增产，农民持续增收，农村综合改⾰稳步推进，农村公共事业明显加强，农村社会更加稳定。但当前农村发展仍存在许多突出⽭盾和问题，农业基础设施依然薄弱，农民稳定增收依然困难，农村社会事业发展依然滞后，改变农村落后⾯貌、缩⼩城乡差距仍需付出艰苦努⼒。要增强危机感，坚持解决好“三农”问题是全党⼯作重中之重的战略思想丝毫不能动摇，促进农业稳定发展、农民持续增收的重要任务丝毫不能放松，⽀农惠农的政策⼒度丝毫不能减弱，扎实推进新农村建设的各项⼯作丝毫不能松懈。发展现代农业是社会主义新农村建设的⾸要任务，是以科学发展观统领农村⼯作的必然要求。推进现代农业建设，顺应我国经济发展的客观趋势，符合当今世界农业发展的⼀般规律，是促进农民增加收⼊的基本途径，是提⾼农业综合⽣产能⼒的重要举措，是建设社会主义新农村的产业基础。要⽤现代物质条件装备农业，⽤现代科学技术改造农业，⽤现代产业体系提升农业，⽤现代经营形式推进农业，⽤现代发展理念引领农业，⽤培养新型农民发展农业，提⾼农业⽔利化、机械化和信息化⽔平，提⾼⼟地产出率、资源利⽤率和农业劳动⽣产率，提⾼农业素质、效益和竞争⼒。建设现代农业的过程，就是改造传统农业、不断发展农村⽣产⼒的过程，就是转变农业增长⽅式、促进农业又好又快发展的过程。必须把建设现代农业作为贯穿新农村建设和现代化全过程的⼀项长期艰巨任务，切实抓紧抓好。2007年农业和农村⼯作的总体要求是：以邓⼩平理论和“三个代表”重要思想为指导，全⾯落实科学发展观，坚持把解决好“三农”问题作为全党⼯作的重中之重，统筹城乡经济社会发展，实⾏⼯业反哺农业、城市⽀持农村和多予少取放活的⽅针，巩固、完善、加强⽀农惠农政策，切实加⼤农业投⼊，积极推进现代农业建设，强化农村公共服务，深化农村综合改⾰，促进粮⾷稳定发展、农民持续增收、农村更加和谐，确保新农村建设取得新的进展，巩固和发展农业农村的好形势。**⼀、加⼤对“三农”的投⼊⼒度，建⽴促进现代农业建设的投⼊保障机制**增加农业投⼊，是建设现代农业、强化农业基础的迫切需要。必须不断开辟https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2007/content_548921.htmPage1of9中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅__2007年第8号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:40新的农业投⼊渠道，逐步形成农民积极筹资投劳、政府持续加⼤投⼊、社会⼒量⼴泛参与的多元化投⼊机制。特别要抓住当前经济发展较快和财政增收较多的时机，继续巩固、完善、加强⽀农惠农政策，切实加⼤对“三农”的投⼊，实实在在为农民办⼀些实事。（⼀）⼤幅度增加对“三农”的投⼊。各级政府要切实把基础设施建设和社会事业发展的重点转向农村，国家财政新增教育、卫⽣、⽂化等事业经费和固定资产投资增量主要⽤于农村，逐步加⼤政府⼟地出让收⼊⽤于农村的⽐重。要建⽴“三农”投⼊稳定增长机制，积极调整财政⽀出结构、固定资产投资结构和信贷投放结构，中央和县级以上地⽅财政每年对农业总投⼊的增长幅度应当⾼于其财政经常性收⼊的增长幅度，尽快形成新农村建设稳定的资⾦来源。2007年，财政⽀农投⼊的增量要继续⾼于上年，国家固定资产投资⽤于农村的增量要继续⾼于上年，⼟地出让收⼊⽤于农村建设的增量要继续⾼于上年。建设⽤地税费提⾼后新增收⼊主要⽤于“三农”。加快制定农村⾦融整体改⾰⽅案，努⼒形成商业⾦融、合作⾦融、政策性⾦融和⼩额贷款组织互为补充、功能齐备的农村⾦融体系，探索建⽴多种形式的担保机制，引导⾦融机构增加对“三农”的信贷投放。加⼤⽀农资⾦整合⼒度，抓紧建⽴⽀农投资规划、计划衔接和部门信息沟通⼯作机制，完善投⼊管理办法，集中⽤于重点地区、重点项⽬，提⾼⽀农资⾦使⽤效益。要注重发挥政府资⾦的带动作⽤，引导农民和社会各⽅⾯资⾦投⼊农村建设。加快农业投⼊⽴法进程，加强执法检查。（⼆）健全农业⽀持补贴制度。近⼏年实⾏的各项补贴政策，深受基层和农民欢迎，要不断巩固、完善和加强，逐步形成⽬标清晰、受益直接、类型多样、操作简便的农业补贴制度。各地⽤于种粮农民直接补贴的资⾦要达到粮⾷风险基⾦的50%以上。加⼤良种补贴⼒度，扩⼤补贴范围和品种。扩⼤农机具购置补贴规模、补贴机型和范围。加⼤农业⽣产资料综合补贴⼒度。中央财政要加⼤对产粮⼤县的奖励⼒度，增加对财政困难县乡增收节⽀的补助。同时，继续对重点地区、重点粮⾷品种实⾏最低收购价政策，并逐步完善办法、健全制度。（三）建⽴农业风险防范机制。要加强⾃然灾害和重⼤动植物病⾍害预测预报和预警应急体系建设，提⾼农业防灾减灾能⼒。积极发展农业保险，按照政府引导、政策⽀持、市场运作、农民⾃愿的原则，建⽴完善农业保险体系。扩⼤农业政策性保险试点范围，各级财政对农户参加农业保险给予保费补贴，完善农业巨灾风险转移分摊机制，探索建⽴中央、地⽅财政⽀持的农业再保险体系。⿎励龙头企业、中介组织帮助农户参加农业保险。（四）⿎励农民和社会⼒量投资现代农业。充分发挥农民在建设新农村和发展现代农业中的主体作⽤，引导农民发扬⾃⼒更⽣精神，增加⽣产投⼊和智⼒投⼊，提⾼科学种⽥和集约经营⽔平。完善农村“⼀事⼀议”筹资筹劳办法，⽀持各地对“⼀事⼀议”建设公益设施实⾏奖励补助制度。对农户投资投劳兴建直接受益的⽣产⽣活设施，可给予适当补助。综合运⽤税收、补助、参股、贴息、担保等⼿段，为社会⼒量投资建设现代农业创造良好环境。企业捐款和投资建设农村公益设施，可以按规定享受相应的税收优惠政策。**⼆、加快农业基础建设，提⾼现代农业的设施装备⽔平**改善农业设施装备，是建设现代农业的重要内容。必须下决⼼增加投⼊，加强基础设施建设，加快改变农村⽣产⽣活条件落后的局⾯。https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2007/content_548921.htmPage2of9中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅__2007年第8号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:40（⼀）⼤⼒抓好农⽥⽔利建设。要把加强农⽥⽔利设施建设作为现代农业建设的⼀件⼤事来抓。加快⼤型灌区续建配套和节⽔改造，搞好末级渠系建设，推⾏灌溉⽤⽔总量控制和定额管理。扩⼤⼤型泵站技术改造实施范围和规模。农业综合开发要增加对中型灌区节⽔改造投⼊。加强丘陵⼭区抗旱⽔源建设，加快西南地区中⼩型⽔源⼯程建设。增加⼩型农⽥⽔利⼯程建设补助专项资⾦规模。加⼤病险⽔库除险加固⼒度，加强中⼩河流治理，改善农村⽔环境。引导农民开展直接受益的农⽥⽔利⼯程建设，推⼴农民⽤⽔户参与灌溉管理的有效做法。（⼆）切实提⾼耕地质量。强化和落实耕地保护责任制，切实控制农⽤地转为建设⽤地的规模。合理引导农村节约集约⽤地，切实防⽌破坏耕作层的农业⽣产⾏为。加⼤⼟地复垦、整理⼒度。按照⽥地平整、⼟壤肥沃、路渠配套的要求，加快建设旱涝保收、⾼产稳产的⾼标准农⽥。加快实施沃⼟⼯程，重点⽀持有机肥积造和⽔肥⼀体化设施建设，⿎励农民发展绿肥、秸秆还⽥和施⽤农家肥。扩⼤⼟壤有机质提升补贴项⽬试点规模和范围。增加农业综合开发投⼊，积极⽀持⾼标准农⽥建设。（三）加快发展农村清洁能源。继续增加农村沼⽓建设投⼊，⽀持有条件的地⽅开展养殖场⼤中型沼⽓建设。在适宜地区积极发展秸秆⽓化和太阳能、风能等清洁能源，加快绿⾊能源⽰范县建设，实施西北地区百万户太阳灶建设⼯程。加快实施乡村清洁⼯程，推进⼈畜粪便、农作物秸秆、⽣活垃圾和污⽔的综合治理和转化利⽤。加强农村⽔能资源开发规划和管理，扩⼤⼩⽔电代燃料⼯程实施范围和规模，加⼤对贫困地区农村⽔电开发的投⼊和信贷⽀持。（四）加⼤乡村基础设施建设⼒度。“⼗⼀五”时期，要解决1.6亿农村⼈⼜的饮⽔安全问题，优先解决⼈⼜较少民族、⽔库移民、⾎吸⾍病区和农村学校的安全饮⽔，争取到2015年基本实现农村⼈⼜安全饮⽔⽬标，有条件的地⽅可加快步伐。加⼤农村公路建设⼒度，加强农村公路养护和管理，完善农村公路筹资建设和养护机制。继续推进农村电⽹改造和建设，落实城乡同⽹同价政策，加快户户通电⼯程建设，实施新农村电⽓化建设“百千万”⼯程。⿎励农民在政府⽀持下，⾃愿筹资筹劳开展农村⼩型基础设施建设。治理农村⼈居环境，搞好村庄治理规划和试点，节约农村建设⽤地。继续发展⼩城镇和县域经济，充分发挥辐射周边农村的功能，带动现代农业发展，促进基础设施和公共服务向农村延伸。（五）发展新型农⽤⼯业。农⽤⼯业是增强农业物质装备的重要依托。积极发展新型肥料、低毒⾼效农药、多功能农业机械及可降解农膜等新型农业投⼊品。优化肥料结构，加快发展适合不同⼟壤、不同作物特点的专⽤肥、缓释肥。加⼤对新农药创制⼯程⽀持⼒度，推进农药产品更新换代。加快农机⾏业技术创新和结构调整，重点发展⼤中型拖拉机、多功能通⽤型⾼效联合收割机及各种专⽤农机产品。尽快制定有利于农⽤⼯业发展的⽀持政策。（六）提⾼农业可持续发展能⼒。⿎励发展循环农业、⽣态农业，有条件的地⽅可加快发展有机农业。继续推进天然林保护、退耕还林等重⼤⽣态⼯程建设，进⼀步完善政策、巩固成果。启动⽯漠化综合治理⼯程，继续实施沿海防护林⼯程。完善森林⽣态效益补偿基⾦制度，探索建⽴草原⽣态补偿机制。加快实施退牧还草⼯程。加强森林草原防⽕⼯作。加快长江、黄河上中游和西南⽯灰岩等地区⽔⼟流失治理，启动坡耕地⽔⼟流失综合整治⼯程。加强农村环境保护，减少农业⾯源污染，搞好江河湖海的⽔污染治理。https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2007/content_548921.htmPage3of9中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅__2007年第8号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:40**三、推进农业科技创新，强化建设现代农业的科技⽀撑**科技进步是突破资源和市场对我国农业双重制约的根本出路。必须着眼增强农业科技⾃主创新能⼒，加快农业科技成果转化应⽤，提⾼科技对农业增长的贡献率，促进农业集约⽣产、清洁⽣产、安全⽣产和可持续发展。（⼀）加强农业科技创新体系建设。⼤幅度增加农业科研投⼊，加强国家基地、区域性农业科研中⼼创新能⼒建设。启动农业⾏业科研专项，⽀持农业科技项⽬。着⼒扶持对现代农业建设有重要⽀撑作⽤的技术研发。继续安排农业科技成果转化资⾦和国外先进农业技术引进资⾦。加快推进农业技术成果的集成创新和中试熟化。深化农业科研院所改⾰，开展稳定⽀持农业科研院所的试点⼯作，逐步提⾼农业科研院所的⼈均事业费⽔平。建⽴⿎励科研⼈员科技创新的激励机制。充分发挥⼤专院校在农业科技研究中的作⽤。引导涉农企业开展技术创新活动，企业与科研单位进⾏农业技术合作、向基地农户推⼴农业新品种新技术所发⽣的有关费⽤，享受企业所得税的相关优惠政策。对于涉农企业符合国家产业政策和有关规定引进的加⼯⽣产设备，允许免征进⼜关税和进⼜环节增值税。（⼆）推进农业科技进村⼊户。积极探索农业科技成果进村⼊户的有效机制和办法，形成以技术指导员为纽带，以⽰范户为核⼼，连接周边农户的技术传播⽹络。继续加强基层农业技术推⼴体系建设，健全公益性职能经费保障机制，改善推⼴条件，提⾼⼈员素质。推进农科教结合，发挥农业院校在农业技术推⼴中的积极作⽤。增⼤国家富民强县科技专项资⾦规模，提⾼基层农业科技成果转化能⼒。继续⽀持重⼤农业技术推⼴，加快实施科技⼊户⼯程。着⼒培育科技⼤户，发挥对农民的⽰范带动作⽤。（三）⼤⼒推⼴资源节约型农业技术。要积极开发运⽤各种节约型农业技术，提⾼农业资源和投⼊品使⽤效率。⼤⼒普及节⽔灌溉技术，启动旱作节⽔农业⽰范⼯程。扩⼤测⼟配⽅施肥的实施范围和补贴规模，进⼀步推⼴诊断施肥、精准施肥等先进施肥技术。改⾰农业耕作制度和种植⽅式，开展免耕栽培技术推⼴补贴试点，加快普及农作物精量半精量播种技术。积极推⼴集约、⾼效、⽣态畜禽⽔产养殖技术，降低饲料和能源消耗。（四）积极发展农业机械化。要改善农机装备结构，提升农机装备⽔平，⾛符合国情、符合各地实际的农业机械化发展道路。加快粮⾷⽣产机械化进程，因地制宜地拓展农业机械化的作业和服务领域，在重点农时季节组织开展跨区域的机耕、机播、机收作业服务。建设农机化试验⽰范基地，⼤⼒推⼴⽔稻插秧、⼟地深松、化肥深施、秸秆粉碎还⽥等农机化技术。⿎励农业⽣产经营者共同使⽤、合作经营农业机械，积极培育和发展农机⼤户和农机专业服务组织，推进农机服务市场化、产业化。加强农机安全监理⼯作。（五）加快农业信息化建设。⽤信息技术装备农业，对于加速改造传统农业具有重要意义。健全农业信息收集和发布制度，整合涉农信息资源，推动农业信息数据收集整理规范化、标准化。加强信息服务平台建设，深⼊实施“⾦农”⼯程，建⽴国家、省、市、县四级农业信息⽹络互联中⼼。加快建设⼀批标准统⼀、实⽤性强的公⽤农业数据库。加强农村⼀体化的信息基础设施建设，创新服务模式，启动农村信息化⽰范⼯程。积极发挥⽓象为农业⽣产和农民⽣活服务的作⽤。⿎励有条件的地⽅在农业⽣产中积极采⽤全球卫星定位系统、地理信息系统、遥感和管理信息系统等技术。https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2007/content_548921.htmPage4of9中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅__2007年第8号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:40**四、开发农业多种功能，健全发展现代农业的产业体系**农业不仅具有⾷品保障功能，⽽且具有原料供给、就业增收、⽣态保护、观光休闲、⽂化传承等功能。建设现代农业，必须注重开发农业的多种功能，向农业的⼴度和深度进军，促进农业结构不断优化升级。（⼀）促进粮⾷稳定发展。继续坚持⽴⾜国内保障粮⾷基本⾃给的⽅针，逐步构建供给稳定、调控有⼒、运转⾼效的粮⾷安全保障体系。2007年，要努⼒稳定粮⾷播种⾯积，提⾼单产、优化品种、改善品质。继续实施优质粮⾷产业、种⼦、植保和粮⾷丰产科技等⼯程。推进粮⾷优势产业带建设，⿎励有条件的地⽅适度发展连⽚种植，加⼤对粮⾷加⼯转化的扶持⼒度。⽀持粮⾷主产区发展粮⾷⽣产和促进经济增长，⽔利建设、中低产⽥改造和农产品加⼯转化等资⾦和项⽬安排，要向粮⾷主产区倾斜。加强对粮⾷⽣产、消费、库存及进出⼜的监测和调控，建⽴和完善粮⾷安全预警系统，维护国内粮⾷市场稳定。（⼆）发展健康养殖业。健康养殖直接关系⼈民群众的⽣命安全。转变养殖观念，调整养殖模式，做⼤做强畜牧产业。按照预防为主、关⼜前移的要求，积极推⾏健康养殖⽅式，加强饲料安全管理，从源头上把好养殖产品质量安全关。牧区要积极推⼴舍饲半舍饲饲养，农区有条件的要发展规模养殖和畜禽养殖⼩区。扩⼤对养殖⼩区的补贴规模，继续安排奶⽜良种补贴资⾦。加⼤动物疫病防控投⼊⼒度，加强基层兽医队伍建设，健全重⼤动物疫情监测和应急处置机制，建⽴和完善动物标识及疫病可追溯体系。⽔产养殖业要推⼴优良品种，加强⽔产养殖品种病害防治，提⾼健康养殖⽔平。（三）⼤⼒发展特⾊农业。要⽴⾜当地⾃然和⼈⽂优势，培育主导产品，优化区域布局。适应⼈们⽇益多样化的物质⽂化需求，因地制宜地发展特⽽专、新⽽奇、精⽽美的各种物质、⾮物质产品和产业，特别要重视发展园艺业、特种养殖业和乡村旅游业。通过规划引导、政策⽀持、⽰范带动等办法，⽀持“⼀村⼀品”发展。加快培育⼀批特⾊明显、类型多样、竞争⼒强的专业村、专业乡镇。（四）扶持农业产业化龙头企业发展。龙头企业是引导农民发展现代农业的重要带动⼒量。通过贴息补助、投资参股和税收优惠等政策，⽀持农产品加⼯业发展。中央和省级财政要专门安排扶持农产品加⼯的补助资⾦，⽀持龙头企业开展技术引进和技术改造。完善农产品加⼯业增值税政策，减轻农产品加⼯企业税负。落实扶持农业产业化经营的各项政策，各级财政要逐步增加对农业产业化的资⾦投⼊。农业综合开发资⾦要积极⽀持农业产业化发展。⾦融机构要加⼤对龙头企业的信贷⽀持，重点解决农产品收购资⾦困难问题。有关部门要加强对龙头企业的指导和服务。（五）推进⽣物质产业发展。以⽣物能源、⽣物基产品和⽣物质原料为主要内容的⽣物质产业，是拓展农业功能、促进资源⾼效利⽤的朝阳产业。加快开发以农作物秸秆等为主要原料的⽣物质燃料、肥料、饲料，启动农作物秸秆⽣物⽓化和固化成型燃料试点项⽬，⽀持秸秆饲料化利⽤。加强⽣物质产业技术研发、⽰范、储备和推⼴，组织实施农林⽣物质科技⼯程。⿎励有条件的地⽅利⽤荒⼭、荒地等资源，发展⽣物质原料作物种植。加快制定有利于⽣物质产业发展的扶持政策。**五、健全农村市场体系，发展适应现代农业要求的物流产业**发达的物流产业和完善的市场体系，是现代农业的重要保障。必须强化农村https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2007/content_548921.htmPage5of9中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅__2007年第8号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:40流通基础设施建设，发展现代流通⽅式和新型流通业态，培育多元化、多层次的市场流通主体，构建开放统⼀、竞争有序的市场体系。（⼀）建设农产品流通设施和发展新型流通业态。采取优惠财税措施，⽀持农村流通基础设施建设和物流企业发展。要合理布局，加快建设⼀批设施先进、功能完善、交易规范的鲜活农产品批发市场。⼤⼒发展农村连锁经营、电⼦商务等现代流通⽅式。加快建设“万村千乡市场”、“双百市场”、“新农村现代流通⽹络”和“农村商务信息服务”等⼯程。⽀持龙头企业、农民专业合作组织等直接向城市超市、社区菜市场和便利店配送农产品。积极⽀持农资超市和农家店建设，对农资和农村⽇⽤消费品连锁经营，实⾏企业总部统⼀办理⼯商注册登记和经营审批⼿续。切实落实鲜活农产品运输绿⾊通道政策。改善农民进城销售农产品的市场环境。进⼀步规范和完善农产品期货市场，充分发挥引导⽣产、稳定市场、规避风险的作⽤。（⼆）加强农产品质量安全监管和市场服务。认真贯彻农产品质量安全法，提⾼农产品质量安全监管能⼒。加快完善农产品质量安全标准体系，建⽴农产品质量可追溯制度。在重点地区、品种、环节和企业，加快推⾏标准化⽣产和管理。实⾏农药、兽药专营和添加剂规范使⽤制度，实施良好农业操作规范试点。继续加强农产品⽣产环境和产品质量检验检测，搞好⽆公害农产品、绿⾊⾷品、有机⾷品认证，依法保护农产品注册商标、地理标志和知名品牌。严格执⾏转基因⾷品、液态奶等农产品标识制度。加强农业领域知识产权保护。启动实施农产品质量安全检验检测体系建设规划。加强对农资⽣产经营和农村⾷品药品质量安全监管，探索建⽴农资流通企业信⽤档案制度和质量保障赔偿机制。（三）加强农产品进出⼜调控。加快实施农业“⾛出去”战略。加强农产品出⼜基地建设，实⾏企业出⼜产品卫⽣注册制度和国际认证，推进农产品检测结果国际互认。⽀持农产品出⼜企业在国外市场注册品牌，开展海外市场研究、营销策划、产品推介活动。有关部门和⾏业协会要积极开展农产品技术标准、国际市场促销等培训服务。搞好对农产品出⼜的信贷和保险服务。减免出⼜农产品检验检疫费⽤，简化检验检疫程序，加快农产品特别是鲜活产品出⼜的通关速度。加强对⼤宗农产品进⼜的调控和管理，保护农民利益，维护国内⽣产和市场稳定。（四）积极发展多元化市场流通主体。加快培育农村经纪⼈、农产品运销专业户和农村各类流通中介组织。采取财税、⾦融等措施，⿎励各类⼯商企业通过收购、兼并、参股和特许经营等⽅式，参与农村市场建设和农产品、农资经营，培育⼀批⼤型涉农商贸企业集团。供销合作社要推进开放办社，发展联合与合作，提⾼经营活⼒和市场竞争⼒。邮政系统要发挥邮递物流⽹络的优势，拓展为农服务领域。国有粮⾷企业要加快改⾰步伐，发挥衔接产销、稳定市场的作⽤。商贸、医药、通信、⽂化等企业要积极开拓农村市场。**六、培养新型农民，造就建设现代农业的⼈才队伍**建设现代农业，最终要靠有⽂化、懂技术、会经营的新型农民。必须发挥农村的⼈⼒资源优势，⼤幅度增加⼈⼒资源开发投⼊，全⾯提⾼农村劳动者素质，为推进新农村建设提供强⼤的⼈才智⼒⽀持。（⼀）培育现代农业经营主体。普遍开展农业⽣产技能培训，扩⼤新型农民科技培训⼯程和科普惠农兴村计划规模，组织实施新农村实⽤⼈才培训⼯程，努⼒把⼴⼤农户培养成有较强市场意识、有较⾼⽣产技能、有⼀定管理能⼒的现代https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2007/content_548921.htmPage6of9中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅__2007年第8号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:40农业经营者。积极发展种养专业⼤户、农民专业合作组织、龙头企业和集体经济组织等各类适应现代农业发展要求的经营主体。采取各类⽀持政策，⿎励外出务⼯农民带技术、带资⾦回乡创业，成为建设现代农业的带头⼈。⽀持⼯商企业、⼤专院校和中等职业学校毕业⽣、乡⼟⼈才创办现代农业企业。（⼆）加强农民转移就业培训和权益保护。加⼤“阳光⼯程”等农村劳动⼒转移就业培训⽀持⼒度，进⼀步提⾼补贴标准，充实培训内容，创新培训⽅式，完善培训机制。适应制造业发展需要，从农民⼯中培育⼀批中⾼级技⼯。⿎励⽤⼯企业和培训机构开展定向、订单培训。组织动员社会⼒量⼴泛参与农民转移就业培训。按照城乡统⼀、公平就业的要求，进⼀步完善农民外出就业的制度保障。做好农民⼯就业的公共服务⼯作，加快解决农民⼯的⼦⼥上学、⼯伤、医疗和养⽼保障等问题，切实提⾼农民⼯的⽣活质量和社会地位。（三）加快发展农村社会事业。这是增强农民综合素质的必然要求，也是构建社会主义和谐社会的重要内容。继续改善农村办学条件，促进城乡义务教育均衡发展。2007年全国农村义务教育阶段学⽣全部免除学杂费，对家庭经济困难学⽣免费提供教科书并补助寄宿⽣⽣活费，有条件的地⽅可扩⼤免、补实施范围。加快发展农村职业技术教育和农村成⼈教育，扩⼤职业教育⾯向农村的招⽣规模。加⼤对⼤专院校和中等职业学校农林类专业学⽣的助学⼒度，有条件的地⽅可减免种植、养殖专业学⽣的学费。努⼒扫除农村青壮年⽂盲。继续扩⼤新型农村合作医疗制度试点范围，加强规范管理，扩⼤农民受益⾯，并不断完善农村医疗救助制度。加强农村计划⽣育⼯作，全⾯推⾏农村计划⽣育家庭奖励扶助政策，加⼤少⽣快富⼯程实施⼒度。增加农村⽂化事业投⼊，加强农村公共⽂化服务体系建设，加快⼴播电视“村村通”和农村⽂化信息资源共享⼯程建设步伐。（四）提⾼农村公共服务⼈员能⼒。建⽴农村基层⼲部、农村教师、乡村医⽣、计划⽣育⼯作者、基层农技推⼴⼈员及其他与农民⽣产⽣活相关服务⼈员的培训制度，加强在岗培训，提⾼服务能⼒。进⼀步转换乡镇事业单位⽤⼈机制，积极探索由受益农民参与基层服务⼈员业绩考核评定的相关办法。加⼤城市教师、医务⼈员、⽂化⼯作者⽀援农村的⼒度，完善⿎励⼤专院校和中等职业学校毕业⽣到农村服务的有关办法，引导他们到农村创业。有条件的地⽅，可选拔⼤专院校和中等职业学校毕业⽣到乡村任职，改善农村基层⼲部队伍结构。**七、深化农村综合改⾰，创新推动现代农业发展的体制机制**深化农村综合改⾰，是巩固农村税费改⾰成果、推进现代农业建设的客观要求。必须加快改⾰步伐，为建设现代农业提供体制机制保障。（⼀）深化农村综合改⾰。有条件的地⽅要在全省范围内开展乡镇机构改⾰试点，暂不具备条件的省份要进⼀步扩⼤市、县试点范围，从乡村实际出发转变乡镇政府职能，完善农村基层⾏政管理体制和⼯作机制，提⾼农村公共服务⽔平。认真落实农村义务教育经费保障机制改⾰措施，搞好教育⼈事制度改⾰，加强农村教师队伍建设。建⽴健全财⼒与事权相匹配的省以下财政管理体制，进⼀步完善财政转移⽀付制度，增强基层政府公共产品和公共服务的供给能⼒。中央和省级财政要安排⼀定资⾦，对地⽅推进农村综合改⾰给予奖励补助。（⼆）统筹推进农村其他改⾰。进⼀步发挥中国农业银⾏、中国农业发展银⾏在农村⾦融中的⾻⼲和⽀柱作⽤，继续深化农村信⽤社改⾰，尽快明确县域内各⾦融机构新增存款投放当地的⽐例，引导邮政储蓄等资⾦返还农村，⼤⼒发展https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2007/content_548921.htmPage7of9中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅__2007年第8号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:40农村⼩额贷款，在贫困地区先⾏开展发育农村多种所有制⾦融组织的试点。坚持农村基本经营制度，稳定⼟地承包关系，规范⼟地承包经营权流转，加快征地制度改⾰。稳定渔民的⽔域滩涂养殖使⽤权。加快推进农村集体林权制度改⾰，明晰林地使⽤权和林⽊所有权，放活经营权，落实处置权，继续搞好国有林区林权制度改⾰试点。积极搞好⽔权制度改⾰，探索建⽴⽔权分配、登记、转让等各项管理制度。继续推进农垦体制改⾰，转换企业经营机制，发挥农垦企业在现代农业建设中的⽰范带动作⽤。（三）清理化解乡村债务。全⾯清理核实乡村债务，摸清底数，锁定旧债，制⽌发⽣新债，积极探索化解债务的措施和办法，优先化解农村义务教育、基础设施建设和社会公益事业发展等⽅⾯的债务。各地要妥善处理好历年农业税尾⽋，在严格把握政策和加强审核的前提下，该减免的要坚决减免，能豁免的应予以豁免。中央和省级财政要安排⼀定奖励资⾦，⿎励地⽅主动化解乡村债务。（四）⼤⼒发展农民专业合作组织。认真贯彻农民专业合作社法，⽀持农民专业合作组织加快发展。各地要加快制定推动农民专业合作社发展的实施细则，有关部门要抓紧出台具体登记办法、财务会计制度和配套⽀持措施。要采取有利于农民专业合作组织发展的税收和⾦融政策，增⼤农民专业合作社建设⽰范项⽬资⾦规模，着⼒⽀持农民专业合作组织开展市场营销、信息服务、技术培训、农产品加⼯储藏和农资采购经营。**⼋、加强党对农村⼯作的领导，确保现代农业建设取得实效**党管农村⼯作是我们党的⼀个传统和重⼤原则，也是建设现代农业、推进社会主义新农村建设的根本保证。全党要⾼度重视“三农”⼯作，把建设现代农业作为⼀件⼤事列⼊重要议事⽇程，切实抓紧抓好。要适应农村经济社会深刻变化的新形势，调整⼯作思路，转变⼯作作风，改进⼯作⽅法。（⼀）各级党委和政府要坚持不懈抓好“三农”⼯作。各级党政主要领导要亲⾃抓“三农”⼯作，省、市、县党委要有负责同志分管“三农”⼯作。充实和加强“三农”⼯作综合机构，贯彻落实好党的⽀农惠农政策。各部门要树⽴全局观念，强化服务意识，更加积极主动地⽀持现代农业建设。各级领导⼲部要转变作风，深⼊乡村、深⼊群众，帮助基层解决实际问题。要进⼀步细分地域类型，细化⼯作措施，更有针对性地搞好分类指导。加强农村基层组织建设，巩固和发展农村保持共产党员先进性教育活动成果。继续开展农村党的建设“三级联创”活动，选好配强乡村党组织领导班⼦，加强以村党组织为核⼼的村级组织配套建设。加快推进农村党员⼲部现代远程教育⼯程，⼤⼒推进村级组织活动场所建设。积极探索从优秀村⼲部中考录乡镇公务员、选任乡镇领导⼲部的有效途径，关⼼村⼲部的⼯作和⽣活，合理提⾼村⼲部的待遇和保障⽔平。加强农村基层党风廉政建设，增强农村基层党组织的创造⼒、凝聚⼒、战⽃⼒。（⼆）加强和改进农村社会管理。针对农村经济社会发展的新变化，要创新农村社会管理体制机制，切实加强维护农村社会稳定⼯作。拓宽农村社情民意表达渠道，建⽴健全⽭盾纠纷的排查调处机制，综合运⽤多种⼿段和办法，妥善解决农村社会的苗头性、倾向性问题。深⼊开展平安农村建设，加强农村警务建设，搞好农村社会治安综合治理，保持农村安定有序。在农村⼴泛开展法制宣传教育，增强群众的法律意识，引导农民以理性合法的⽅式表达利益诉求，依法⾏使权利、履⾏义务。建⽴农村应急管理体制，提⾼危机处置能⼒。https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2007/content_548921.htmPage8of9中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅__2007年第8号国务院公报_中国政府⽹2025/9/12,10:40（三）促进农村和谐发展。健全村党组织领导的充满活⼒的村民⾃治机制，完善村务公开制度，促进农村基层民主健康发展。加强农村精神⽂明建设，开展以“⼋荣⼋耻”为主要内容的社会主义荣辱观教育，推进群众性精神⽂明创建活动，引导农民崇尚科学、抵制迷信、移风易俗。加⼤对中西部地区特别是⽼少边穷地区发展社会事业、改善⽣产⽣活条件的⽀持⼒度。继续搞好开发式扶贫，实⾏整村推进扶贫⽅式，分户制定更有针对性的扶贫措施，提⾼扶贫开发成效。在全国范围建⽴农村最低⽣活保障制度，各地应根据当地经济发展⽔平和财⼒状况，确定低保对象范围、标准，⿎励已建⽴制度的地区完善制度，⽀持未建⽴制度的地区建⽴制度，中央财政对财政困难地区给予适当补助。有条件的地⽅，可探索建⽴多种形式的农村养⽼保险制度。⾼度重视农村残疾⼈事业，妥善解决外出务⼯农民家庭的实际困难。做好农村消防及其他安全⼯作，坚决制⽌污染企业向农村扩散，强化对各类地质灾害的监控，做好救灾救济⼯作，切实增强群众安全感。加快建设现代农业，推进社会主义新农村建设，意义重⼤，任务艰巨。我们要紧密团结在以胡锦涛同志为总书记的党中央周围，⾼举邓⼩平理论和“三个代表”重要思想伟⼤旗帜，全⾯落实科学发展观，坚定信⼼，扎实苦⼲，奋⼒开拓，为构建社会主义和谐社会作出新的贡献。https://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2007/content_548921.htmPage9of9

name_chn: 期货交易管理条例（国务院令第489号）
text: # Decree of the State Council of the People’s Republic of China**No. 489**The *Regulation on the Administration of Futures Trading* was adopted at the 168th Executive Meeting of the State Council on 7 February 2007 and is hereby promulgated. It shall enter into force on 15 April 2007.**Premier: Wen Jiabao**6 March 2007------# Regulation on the Administration of Futures Trading## Chapter I General Provisions**Article 1** This Regulation is formulated in order to regulate futures trading activities, strengthen the supervision and administration of futures trading, maintain market order, prevent risks, protect the lawful rights and interests of all parties to futures trading as well as the public interest, and promote the active and steady development of the futures market.**Article 2** Any entity or individual engaging in futures trading—including trading in commodity and financial futures contracts, options contracts, and related activities—shall abide by this Regulation.**Article 3** Participants in futures trading shall follow the principles of openness, fairness, impartiality, and good faith. Fraud, insider trading, manipulation of futures prices, and other illegal acts are prohibited.**Article 4** Futures trading shall be conducted on futures exchanges lawfully established, or on other trading venues approved by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.Futures trading conducted outside trading venues approved by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council is prohibited, as is disguised futures trading.**Article 5** The futures regulatory authority of the State Council shall exercise centralized and unified supervision and administration over the futures market.Dispatched offices of the futures regulatory authority of the State Council shall, in accordance with the provisions of this Regulation and the authorization of the said authority, perform supervisory and administrative duties.## Chapter II Futures Exchanges**Article 6** The establishment of a futures exchange shall be subject to approval by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.Without such approval, no entity or individual may establish a futures exchange or organize, in any form, futures trading and related activities.**Article 7** A futures exchange shall be a non-profit institution and shall implement self-regulation in accordance with its articles of association. A futures exchange shall be liable for civil obligations to the extent of all its assets. The principal persons in charge of a futures exchange shall be appointed or removed by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.Administrative measures for futures exchanges shall be formulated by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.**Article 8** Members of a futures exchange shall be legal persons or other economic organizations registered within the territory of the People’s Republic of China.A futures exchange may implement a tiered clearing membership system. Under such system, members shall consist of clearing members and non-clearing members.The clearing qualifications of clearing members shall be approved by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council, which shall make a decision to approve or disapprove within three months from accepting an application.**Article 9** Persons who fall under Article 147 of the *Company Law of the People’s Republic of China* or any of the following circumstances shall not serve as principal persons in charge of a futures exchange or as finance and accounting personnel:1. Principals of a futures exchange, a securities exchange, or a securities registration and clearing institution, or directors, supervisors, or senior management personnel of a futures company or a securities company, or other persons as specified by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council, who were removed from their posts due to violations of laws or disciplines, within five years from the date of removal;2. Lawyers, certified public accountants, or professionals of investment advisory, financial advisory, credit rating, asset appraisal, or verification institutions whose qualifications were revoked due to violations of laws or disciplines, within five years from the date of revocation.**Article 10** A futures exchange shall, in accordance with this Regulation and the provisions of the futures regulatory authority of the State Council, establish and improve its internal rules and systems, strengthen risk control over trading activities, and supervise and administer its members and staff. A futures exchange shall perform the following duties:1. Provide trading venues, facilities, and services;2. Design contracts and arrange their listing;3. Organize and supervise trading, clearing, and delivery;4. Ensure the performance of contracts;5. Supervise and manage members in accordance with its articles of association and trading rules;6. Other duties as prescribed by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.A futures exchange shall not, directly or indirectly, participate in futures trading. Without review by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council and approval by the State Council, a futures exchange shall not engage in businesses unrelated to its duties, such as trust investment, stock investment, or investment in non-self-use real estate.**Article 11** A futures exchange shall, in accordance with State provisions, establish and improve the following risk management systems:1. Margin system;2. Mark-to-market settlement on a daily, no-debt basis;3. Price limit (limit up/limit down) system;4. Position limits and large-trader position reporting system;5. Risk reserve system;6. Other risk management systems as prescribed by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.A futures exchange implementing a tiered clearing membership system shall also establish and improve a clearing guarantee fund system.**Article 12** When abnormal circumstances arise in the futures market, a futures exchange may, within the authority and procedures stipulated in its articles of association, decide to take the following emergency measures and shall immediately report to the futures regulatory authority of the State Council:1. Raise margin requirements;2. Adjust limits on price movements;3. Restrict the maximum positions of members or clients;4. Temporarily suspend trading;5. Take other emergency measures.“Abnormal circumstances” as used in the preceding paragraph refer to manipulation of futures prices during trading, force majeure emergencies, and other circumstances as prescribed by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.Once abnormal circumstances cease, the futures exchange shall promptly lift the emergency measures.**Article 13** A futures exchange shall obtain approval from the futures regulatory authority of the State Council for the following matters:1. Formulating or amending its articles of association or trading rules;2. Listing, suspending, delisting, or relisting a product;3. Listing, amending, or terminating a contract;4. Changing its domicile or business premises;5. Merger, division, or dissolution;6. Other matters as prescribed by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.When approving the listing of a new futures product, the futures regulatory authority of the State Council shall solicit the opinions of relevant State Council departments.**Article 14** The income of a futures exchange shall be administered and used in accordance with State provisions, but shall be used first to ensure the operation and improvement of its trading venues and facilities.## Chapter III Futures Companies**Article 15** A futures company is a financial institution that engages in futures business established in accordance with the *Company Law of the People’s Republic of China* and this Regulation. The establishment of a futures company shall be subject to the approval of the futures regulatory authority of the State Council and registration with the company registration authority.Without such approval, no entity or individual may establish, or in disguised form establish, a futures company or engage in futures business.**Article 16** An applicant for establishing a futures company shall comply with the *Company Law of the People’s Republic of China* and meet the following conditions:1. The minimum registered capital shall be RMB 30 million;2. Directors, supervisors, and senior management personnel shall possess the qualifications for office, and practitioners shall hold futures practice qualifications;3. The company shall have articles of association that comply with laws and administrative regulations;4. Major shareholders and actual controllers shall have continuous profitability, good credit, and no major violations of laws or regulations in the last three years;5. The company shall have qualified business premises and facilities;6. The company shall have sound risk management and internal control systems;7. Other conditions as prescribed by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.Based on prudential supervision principles and the risk profile of various businesses, the futures regulatory authority of the State Council may raise the minimum registered capital requirement. Registered capital shall be paid-in capital. Shareholders shall contribute in monetary funds or in non-monetary assets necessary for the operation of the futures company, and monetary contributions shall not be less than 85%.Within six months from accepting an application for establishment, the futures regulatory authority of the State Council shall, based on prudential supervision principles, conduct a review and make a decision to approve or disapprove.Without approval by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council, no entity or individual may entrust others or accept entrustment to hold or manage the equity of a futures company.**Article 17** Futures company business is subject to licensing. Licenses for commodity futures and financial futures business categories shall be issued by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council. In addition to applying to conduct domestic futures brokerage, a futures company may apply to conduct overseas futures brokerage, futures investment advisory, and other futures businesses prescribed by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.A futures company shall not engage in activities unrelated to futures business unless otherwise provided by laws, administrative regulations, or the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.A futures company shall not engage in, or in disguised form engage in, proprietary futures trading.A futures company shall not provide financing to its shareholders, actual controllers, or other affiliates, nor provide external guarantees.**Article 18** In conducting brokerage business, a futures company shall accept client mandates, trade in its own name on behalf of clients, and the results of the trades shall be borne by the clients.**Article 19** A futures company shall obtain approval from the futures regulatory authority of the State Council for the following matters:1. Merger, division, suspension of business, dissolution, or bankruptcy;2. Change of company form;3. Change of business scope;4. Change of registered capital;5. Change of 5% or more of equity;6. Establishment, acquisition, equity participation in, or termination of overseas futures-related operating institutions;7. Other matters as prescribed by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.For the matters listed in items (4) and (7) of the preceding paragraph, the futures regulatory authority of the State Council shall decide whether to approve within 20 days from accepting the application; for the other matters listed, a decision shall be made within two months from acceptance.**Article 20** A futures company shall obtain approval from the dispatched office of the futures regulatory authority of the State Council for the following matters:1. Change of legal representative;2. Change of domicile or business premises;3. Establishment or termination of domestic branches;4. Change of a domestic branch’s business premises, person in charge, or business scope;5. Other matters as prescribed by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.For the matters listed in items (1), (2), (4), and (5), the dispatched office shall decide whether to approve within 20 days from accepting the application; for the matter in item (3), a decision shall be made within two months.**Article 21** Where a futures company or its branch falls under Article 70 of the *Administrative Licensing Law of the People’s Republic of China* or any of the following circumstances, the futures regulatory authority of the State Council shall cancel its futures business license in accordance with law:1. Its business license has been lawfully canceled by the company registration authority;2. Without justifiable reason, it has failed to commence business for more than three months after establishment, or has ceased business for more than three consecutive months without justifiable reason after opening;3. It voluntarily applies for cancellation;4. Other circumstances as prescribed by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.Before cancellation of a futures business license, a futures company shall settle relevant futures business and lawfully return client margins and other assets. Before cancellation of an operating license, a branch shall cease operations and properly handle client assets.**Article 22** A futures company shall establish, improve, and strictly implement business management rules and risk management systems, comply with information disclosure requirements, ensure the safety of client margin custody, and, in accordance with the rules of the futures exchange, report large-trader lists and trading conditions to the exchange.**Article 23** Other futures operating institutions engaging in futures investment advisory or intermediary introduction services for futures companies shall obtain business qualifications approved by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council. Specific administrative measures shall be formulated by that authority.## Chapter IV Basic Rules of Futures Trading**Article 24** Persons conducting futures trading on a futures exchange shall be members of the exchange.**Article 25** When accepting a client mandate to conduct futures trading, a futures company shall first present to the client a risk disclosure statement; after the client signs to confirm receipt, the company shall enter into a written contract with the client. A futures company shall not, without a client’s mandate or contrary to a client’s mandate, conduct futures trading on its own initiative.A futures company shall not provide profit guarantees to clients; it shall not, in brokerage business, agree with clients to share profits or jointly bear risks.**Article 26** The following entities and individuals shall not engage in futures trading, and a futures company shall not accept their mandates to trade:1. State organs and public institutions;2. Staff of the futures regulatory authority of the State Council, futures exchanges, the futures margin safety depository monitoring institution, and the futures industry association;3. Persons banned from entering the securities or futures markets;4. Entities and individuals unable to provide account-opening documentation;5. Other entities and individuals prohibited by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.**Article 27** Clients may place trading instructions with a futures company in writing, by telephone, via the Internet, or by other means prescribed by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council. Client instructions shall be clear and complete.A futures company shall not conceal material facts or use improper means to induce clients to issue trading instructions.**Article 28** A futures exchange shall promptly publish transaction volume, transaction price, open interest, highest and lowest prices, opening and closing prices, and other real-time market data for listed contracts, and shall ensure the truthfulness and accuracy of such data. A futures exchange shall not publish price forecasts.Without the permission of a futures exchange, no entity or individual may disseminate real-time futures market data.**Article 29** Futures trading shall strictly implement the margin system. Margins collected by a futures exchange from members and by a futures company from clients shall not be lower than the standards set by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council and the futures exchange, and shall be segregated from proprietary funds and kept in dedicated accounts.Margins collected by a futures exchange from members belong to the members and shall not be misappropriated for any purpose other than members’ trading settlement.Margins collected by a futures company from clients belong to the clients and shall not be misappropriated, except in the following transferable circumstances:1. Payment of available funds at the client’s request;2. For the client’s margin deposits and payment of commissions and taxes;3. Other circumstances as prescribed by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.**Article 30** A futures company shall open a dedicated account and set a trading code for each client, and shall not mix codes for trading.**Article 31** Where a futures company conducts brokerage business alongside other futures businesses, it shall strictly implement business and fund separation, and shall not commingle operations.**Article 32** Members of futures exchanges and clients may use standard warehouse receipts, government bonds, and other highly liquid, stable-value securities to offset margins. The categories of such securities, methods for valuing them, and offset ratios shall be prescribed by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.**Article 33** Banking financial institutions engaging in margin depository or futures clearing business shall obtain approval from the futures regulatory authority of the State Council after consent by the banking regulatory authority of the State Council.**Article 34** Futures exchanges, futures companies, and non-futures-company clearing members shall, in accordance with the provisions of the futures regulatory authority of the State Council and the finance authorities, accrue, administer, and use risk reserves, and shall not misappropriate them.**Article 35** Items and standards of fees for futures trading and their administrative measures shall be formulated and published by the relevant competent departments of the State Council.**Article 36** Futures trading shall adopt open centralized trading or other methods approved by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.**Article 37** Clearing of futures trades shall be uniformly organized by the futures exchange.A futures exchange shall implement daily mark-to-market settlement on a no-debt basis and shall promptly notify members of settlement results on the same day.A futures company shall, based on the settlement results of the futures exchange, settle with clients and promptly notify clients of the results in the manner agreed with them. Clients shall promptly check and properly manage their positions.**Article 38** When a member’s margin is insufficient, it shall promptly add margin or liquidate positions on its own. If a member fails to add margin or liquidate positions within the time specified by the exchange, the exchange shall forcibly liquidate the member’s contracts, and the relevant expenses and losses shall be borne by the member.When a client’s margin is insufficient, the client shall promptly add margin or liquidate positions. If the client fails to do so within the time specified by the futures company, the futures company shall forcibly liquidate the client’s contracts, and the relevant expenses and losses shall be borne by the client.**Article 39** Delivery in futures trading shall be uniformly organized by the futures exchange.Delivery warehouses shall be designated by the futures exchange. A futures exchange shall not restrict the total volume of physical deliveries and shall conclude agreements with delivery warehouses specifying mutual rights and obligations. Delivery warehouses shall not:1. Issue false warehouse receipts;2. Restrict the storage in or out of deliverable commodities in violation of exchange business rules;3. Disclose trade secrets related to futures trading;4. Participate in futures trading in violation of State provisions;5. Engage in other conduct as prescribed by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.**Article 40** Where a member defaults in futures trading, the futures exchange shall first use the member’s margins to bear default liabilities; where margins are insufficient, the exchange shall use its risk reserves and proprietary funds to assume liabilities on behalf of the member and thereby obtain corresponding rights of recourse.Where a client defaults in futures trading, the futures company shall first use the client’s margins to bear default liabilities; where margins are insufficient, the futures company shall use its risk reserves and proprietary funds to assume liabilities on behalf of the client and thereby obtain corresponding rights of recourse.**Article 41** A futures exchange implementing a tiered clearing membership system shall collect clearing guarantee funds from clearing members. The exchange shall clear only with clearing members, collect and call margins, assume default liabilities with guarantee funds, risk reserves, and proprietary funds, and take related measures. For non-clearing members, clearing, margin collection and calls, assumption of default liabilities, and related measures shall be performed by the clearing members.**Article 42** Futures exchanges, futures companies, and non-futures-company clearing members shall ensure the integrity and security of records related to trading, clearing, and delivery.**Article 43** No entity or individual may fabricate or disseminate false information about futures trading, or collude maliciously, conduct wash trades, or otherwise manipulate futures prices.**Article 44** No entity or individual may illegally use credit funds or fiscal funds for futures trading.The qualifications of banking financial institutions to engage in financing or guaranteeing for futures trading shall be approved by the banking regulatory authority of the State Council.**Article 45** State-owned enterprises and state-controlled enterprises engaging in domestic or overseas futures trading shall follow the principle of hedging and strictly comply with provisions of the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration authority of the State Council and other relevant departments on the entry of state-owned assets into the futures market.**Article 46** The competent commerce department of the State Council shall approve the varieties for overseas commodity futures trading by domestic entities or individuals.Foreign exchange purchases and settlements, and foreign exchange receipts and payments under overseas futures shall comply with State foreign exchange administration provisions.Measures for domestic entities or individuals engaging in overseas futures trading shall be formulated by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council jointly with the competent commerce department of the State Council, the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration authority, the banking regulatory authority, the foreign exchange authority, and other relevant departments, and implemented after approval by the State Council.## Chapter V Futures Industry Association**Article 47** The Futures Industry Association is a self-regulatory organization of the futures industry and a social organization legal person.Futures companies and other institutions specialized in futures business shall join the Futures Industry Association and pay membership fees.**Article 48** The supreme authority of the Futures Industry Association shall be the general assembly of all members.The charter of the Association shall be formulated by the general assembly and filed with the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.The Association shall have a council, whose members shall be elected in accordance with the charter.**Article 49** The Futures Industry Association shall perform the following duties:1. Educate and organize members to comply with futures laws, regulations, and policies;2. Formulate self-regulatory rules for members, supervise and inspect member conduct, and impose disciplinary sanctions for violations of the charter and self-regulatory rules;3. Be responsible for the accreditation, administration, and revocation of qualifications of futures practitioners;4. Accept complaints related to futures business and mediate disputes among members or between members and clients;5. Protect members’ lawful rights and interests in accordance with law and communicate members’ proposals and requests to the futures regulatory authority of the State Council;6. Organize business training for practitioners and exchanges among members;7. Organize research on the development and operation of the futures industry and related matters;8. Other duties as stipulated in the Association’s charter.The business activities of the Association shall be subject to the guidance and supervision of the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.## Chapter VI Supervision and Administration**Article 50** The futures regulatory authority of the State Council shall implement supervision and administration over the futures market and perform the following duties according to law:1. Formulate rules and regulations on supervision and administration of the futures market and exercise approval authority according to law;2. Supervise and administer listing, trading, clearing, delivery, and other futures trading and related activities;3. Supervise and administer the futures business activities of futures exchanges, futures companies and other futures operating institutions, non-futures-company clearing members, the margin safety depository monitoring institution, margin depository banks, delivery warehouses, and other market participants;4. Formulate qualification standards and administrative measures for futures practitioners and supervise their implementation;5. Supervise and inspect the disclosure of futures trading information;6. Guide and supervise the activities of the Futures Industry Association;7. Investigate and handle violations of futures market supervisory laws and administrative regulations;8. Conduct international exchanges and cooperation related to futures market supervision and administration;9. Other duties prescribed by laws and administrative regulations.**Article 51** In performing duties according to law, the futures regulatory authority of the State Council may take the following measures:1. Conduct on-site inspections of futures exchanges, futures companies and other futures operating institutions, non-futures-company clearing members, the margin safety depository monitoring institution, and delivery warehouses;2. Enter sites suspected of illegal conduct to investigate and collect evidence;3. Question parties and relevant entities and individuals and require them to explain matters related to the investigation;4. Examine and copy materials such as property rights registration related to the investigation;5. Examine and copy futures trading records, financial and accounting materials, and other relevant documents and materials of parties and relevant entities and individuals; documents and materials that may be transferred, concealed, or destroyed may be sealed;6. Inquire into margin accounts and bank accounts of entities related to the investigation;7. When investigating major futures violations such as manipulation of futures prices or insider trading, with the approval of the principal person in charge of the futures regulatory authority of the State Council, restrict a party’s futures trading; the restriction shall not exceed 15 trading days, and may be extended to 30 trading days in complicated cases;8. Other measures prescribed by laws and administrative regulations.**Article 52** Futures exchanges, futures companies and other futures operating institutions, and the margin safety depository monitoring institution shall submit financial and accounting reports, business data, and other relevant materials to the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.For annual reports submitted by futures companies and other futures operating institutions, the futures regulatory authority of the State Council shall designate personnel to review and prepare review reports, which shall be signed by the reviewers. Where problems are identified during review, appropriate measures shall be taken in a timely manner.When necessary, non-futures-company clearing members, delivery warehouses, as well as shareholders, actual controllers, or other affiliates of futures companies may be required to submit relevant materials.**Article 53** When the futures regulatory authority of the State Council performs its duties according to law and conducts supervision, inspection, or investigation, the entities and individuals being inspected or investigated shall cooperate, truthfully provide documents and materials, and shall not refuse, obstruct, or conceal. Other relevant departments and entities shall provide support and cooperation.**Article 54** The State shall, based on the needs of futures market development, establish a Futures Investor Protection Fund.Specific measures for the raising, administration, and use of the Fund shall be formulated by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council jointly with the finance authorities of the State Council.**Article 55** The futures regulatory authority of the State Council shall establish and improve a monitoring system for the safe custody of margins and shall set up a margin safety depository monitoring institution.Clients, futures exchanges, futures companies and other futures operating institutions, non-futures-company clearing members, and margin depository banks shall comply with provisions of the futures regulatory authority of the State Council on the monitoring of margin safety depository.**Article 56** The margin safety depository monitoring institution shall, in accordance with relevant provisions, monitor margin safety and conduct daily audits; upon discovering problems, it shall immediately report to the futures regulatory authority of the State Council, which shall handle them in a timely manner pursuant to this Regulation.**Article 57** The futures regulatory authority of the State Council shall implement a qualification management system for directors, supervisors, senior management personnel, and other practitioners of futures exchanges, futures companies and other futures operating institutions, and the margin safety depository monitoring institution.**Article 58** The futures regulatory authority of the State Council shall formulate rules on the continuous operation of futures companies and set risk regulatory indicators, including the ratio of net capital to net assets, the ratio of net capital to business scale for domestic and overseas brokerage, and the ratio of current assets to current liabilities. It shall also set requirements for business conditions, risk management, internal control, margin depository, and related-party transactions of futures companies and their branches.**Article 59** Where a futures company or its branch fails to meet continuous operation rules or faces operational risks, the futures regulatory authority of the State Council may take supervisory measures such as interviews, reminders, and recording in credit files, or order rectification within a time limit, and shall inspect and accept the rectification.If a futures company fails to rectify on time, and its conduct seriously endangers sound operation or harms clients’ lawful rights and interests, or it is under investigation by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council for suspected serious violations, the authority may, as the case may be, take the following measures:1. Restrict or suspend certain futures businesses;2. Stop approving new businesses or branches;3. Restrict dividend distributions and restrict payment of remuneration and provision of benefits to directors, supervisors, and senior management;4. Restrict property transfers or the establishment of other rights over property;5. Order the replacement of directors, supervisors, senior management, or persons in charge of relevant departments or branches, or restrict their powers;6. Restrict the allocation and use of proprietary funds or risk reserves;7. Order controlling shareholders to transfer equity or restrict relevant shareholders from exercising shareholder rights.For companies that, after rectification, meet legal and regulatory requirements and continuous operation rules, the futures regulatory authority of the State Council shall lift the measures within three days from completion of acceptance.For companies that, after rectification, still fail to meet continuous operation rules and whose normal operation is seriously affected, the authority may revoke part or all of their futures business licenses or close their branches.**Article 60** Where a futures company operates illegally or faces major risks that seriously endanger market order or harm client interests, the futures regulatory authority of the State Council may order suspension and rectification, appoint another institution to take over custody, or implement receivership. With approval by the authority, the following measures may be taken against directors, supervisors, senior management, and other directly responsible personnel:1. Notify the exit administration to lawfully prevent their departure from the country;2. Apply to judicial organs to prohibit transfer, assignment, or other disposal of property, or the creation of other rights over property.**Article 61** Where shareholders of a futures company make false capital contributions or withdraw capital contributions, the futures regulatory authority of the State Council shall order correction within a time limit and may order the transfer of their equity in the futures company.Before the shareholders correct their illegal conduct and transfer their equity as required in the preceding paragraph, the authority may restrict the exercise of their shareholder rights.**Article 62** When abnormal circumstances arise in the futures market, the futures regulatory authority of the State Council may take necessary risk-disposal measures.**Article 63** A futures company’s trading and clearing software shall meet the prudential operation and risk management requirements of the company and the provisions of the futures regulatory authority of the State Council on monitoring the safe custody of margins. Where the software fails to meet requirements, the authority has the right to require improvement or replacement.The authority may require the software suppliers to provide relevant materials, and suppliers shall cooperate. The authority shall keep such materials confidential.**Article 64** Where a futures company is involved in major litigation or arbitration, or its equity is frozen or pledged, or other major events occur, the company and its relevant shareholders and actual controllers shall submit a written report to the futures regulatory authority of the State Council within five days from the occurrence.**Article 65** Intermediary service institutions such as accounting firms, law firms, and asset appraisal institutions shall comply with futures laws, administrative regulations, and State provisions when providing services to market participants such as futures exchanges and futures companies, and shall provide relevant materials as required by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council.**Article 66** The futures regulatory authority of the State Council shall establish mechanisms for information sharing and coordinated cooperation with relevant departments.It may also establish supervisory cooperation mechanisms with futures regulatory authorities of other countries or regions to implement cross-border supervision.**Article 67** Staff of the futures regulatory authority of the State Council, futures exchanges, the margin safety depository monitoring institution, margin depository banks, and other relevant units shall be devoted to their duties, act according to law, be fair and honest, keep State secrets and commercial secrets of members and clients, and shall not use their positions for improper gains.## Chapter VII Legal Liability**Article 68** Where a futures exchange or a non-futures-company clearing member commits any of the following acts, it shall be ordered to correct, given a warning, and its illegal gains confiscated:1. Admitting members in violation of provisions;2. Charging commissions in violation of provisions;3. Using or distributing income in violation of provisions;4. Failing to publish real-time market data as required or publishing price forecasts;5. Failing to fulfill reporting obligations to the futures regulatory authority of the State Council as required;6. Failing to submit documents and materials to the authority as required;7. Failing to establish or improve a clearing guarantee fund system as required;8. Failing to accrue, administer, or use risk reserves as required;9. Violating provisions on monitoring of margin safety depository set by the authority;10. Restricting the total volume of physical deliveries;11. Employing unqualified futures practitioners;12. Other acts in violation of provisions set by the authority.For any of the acts above, the principal persons in charge and other directly responsible persons shall be subject to disciplinary sanctions and fined between RMB 10,000 and RMB 100,000.For the act listed in item (2), the entity shall be ordered to refund overcharged commissions.Where the margin safety depository monitoring institution commits the acts listed in items (5), (6), (9), (11), or (12), penalties and sanctions shall be imposed mutatis mutandis under paragraphs 1 and 2 of this Article. Margin depository banks committing the acts listed in items (9) or (12) shall be penalized accordingly.**Article 69** Where a futures exchange or a non-futures-company clearing member commits any of the following acts, it shall be ordered to correct, warned, its illegal gains confiscated, and fined between one and five times the illegal gains; where there are no illegal gains or such gains are less than RMB 100,000, a fine between RMB 100,000 and RMB 500,000 shall be imposed; where the circumstances are serious, suspension and rectification shall be ordered:1. Handling any matter listed in Article 13 without approval;2. Allowing members to trade when their margin is insufficient;3. Directly or indirectly participating in futures trading or engaging in businesses unrelated to its duties in violation of provisions;4. Collecting margins in violation of provisions or misappropriating margins;5. Forging, altering, or failing to keep records of trading, clearing, or delivery as required;6. Failing to establish or implement daily no-debt settlement, price limits, position limits, or large-trader reporting systems;7. Refusing or obstructing supervision and inspection by the authority;8. Other acts violating provisions of the authority.The principal persons in charge and other directly responsible persons shall be given disciplinary sanctions and fined between RMB 10,000 and RMB 100,000.Where the margin safety depository monitoring institution commits the acts listed in items (3), (7), or (8), penalties and sanctions shall be imposed mutatis mutandis.**Article 70** Where a futures company commits any of the following acts, it shall be ordered to correct, warned, its illegal gains confiscated, and fined between one and three times the illegal gains; where there are no illegal gains or such gains are less than RMB 100,000, a fine between RMB 100,000 and RMB 300,000 shall be imposed; where the circumstances are serious, suspension and rectification shall be ordered or its futures business license revoked:1. Accepting mandates from entities or individuals that do not meet prescribed conditions;2. Allowing clients to trade when their margin is insufficient;3. Handling matters listed in Articles 19 or 20 without approval;4. Engaging in activities unrelated to futures business in violation of provisions;5. Engaging in, or in disguised form engaging in, proprietary futures trading;6. Providing financing to shareholders, actual controllers, or other affiliates, or providing external guarantees;7. Violating provisions on monitoring of margin safety depository set by the authority;8. Failing to fulfill reporting obligations or submit documents and materials as required;9. Using trading or clearing software that does not meet prudential operation, risk management, or margin monitoring requirements;10. Failing to accrue, administer, or use risk reserves as required;11. Forging, altering, or failing to keep records of trading, clearing, or delivery as required;12. Employing unqualified futures practitioners;13. Forging, altering, leasing, lending, buying, or selling futures business licenses or operating permits;14. Conducting mixed-code trading;15. Refusing or obstructing supervision and inspection by the authority;16. Other acts in violation of provisions of the authority.For any of the acts above, the principal persons in charge and other directly responsible persons shall be warned and fined between RMB 10,000 and RMB 50,000; where circumstances are serious, their qualifications for office or practice shall be suspended or revoked.Other futures operating institutions, for the acts listed in items (8), (12), (13), (15), or (16), shall be penalized mutatis mutandis under paragraphs 1 and 2.Where shareholders, actual controllers, or other affiliates of a futures company, without approval, entrust others or accept entrustment to hold or manage equity, or refuse to cooperate with inspections by the authority, or refuse to fulfill reporting obligations or provide information and materials as required, or submit information or materials with false records, misleading statements, or major omissions, penalties shall be imposed mutatis mutandis under paragraphs 1 and 2.**Article 71** Where a futures company engages in any of the following acts of defrauding clients, it shall be ordered to correct, warned, its illegal gains confiscated, and fined between one and five times the illegal gains; where there are no illegal gains or such gains are less than RMB 100,000, a fine between RMB 100,000 and RMB 500,000 shall be imposed; where the circumstances are serious, suspension and rectification shall be ordered or its futures business license revoked:1. Providing profit guarantees to clients or failing to present risk disclosure statements as required;2. Agreeing with clients to share profits or jointly bear risks in brokerage business;3. Failing to accept client mandates or trading contrary to client mandates as required;4. Concealing material facts or using improper means to induce clients to issue trading instructions;5. Providing clients with false execution reports;6. Failing to transmit clients’ trading instructions to the exchange as required;7. Misappropriating client margins;8. Failing to open margin accounts at depository banks as required or transferring client margins in violation of rules;9. Other fraudulent acts against clients as prescribed by the authority.For any of the acts above, the principal persons in charge and other directly responsible persons shall be warned and fined between RMB 10,000 and RMB 100,000; where circumstances are serious, their qualifications for office or practice shall be suspended or revoked.Any entity or individual that fabricates and disseminates false information about futures trading and disrupts the market shall be penalized mutatis mutandis under paragraphs 1 and 2.**Article 72** Where a futures company, other futures operating institution, non-futures-company clearing member, or margin depository bank obtains a futures business license by submitting false application documents or by other fraudulent means that conceal material facts, its license shall be revoked and illegal gains confiscated.**Article 73** Insiders of futures trading information or persons who unlawfully obtain such information who, before the information that may have a material impact on futures prices is disclosed, use the insider information to trade futures, or disclose such information to others for trading, shall have their illegal gains confiscated and be fined between one and five times the illegal gains; where there are no illegal gains or such gains are less than RMB 100,000, a fine between RMB 100,000 and RMB 500,000 shall be imposed. Where an entity engages in insider trading, the principal persons in charge and other directly responsible persons shall be warned and fined between RMB 30,000 and RMB 300,000.Staff of the futures regulatory authority of the State Council, futures exchanges, and the margin safety depository monitoring institution who engage in insider trading shall be subject to heavier penalties.**Article 74** Where any entity or individual manipulates futures prices by any of the following means, it shall be ordered to correct, its illegal gains confiscated, and fined between one and five times the illegal gains; where there are no illegal gains or such gains are less than RMB 200,000, a fine between RMB 200,000 and RMB 1 million shall be imposed:1. Acting alone or in concert, using capital or position advantages, or information advantages to jointly or continuously buy or sell contracts and manipulate prices;2. Colluding deliberately to trade with each other at prearranged times, prices, and methods to affect prices or volumes;3. Trading with oneself (wash trades) to affect prices or volumes;4. Hoarding spot commodities to affect market conditions;5. Other acts of manipulating prices as prescribed by the authority.Where an entity commits the acts above, the principal persons in charge and other directly responsible persons shall be warned and fined between RMB 10,000 and RMB 100,000.**Article 75** Where a delivery warehouse commits any of the acts listed in paragraph 2 of Article 39, it shall be ordered to correct, warned, its illegal gains confiscated, and fined between one and five times the illegal gains; where there are no illegal gains or such gains are less than RMB 100,000, a fine between RMB 100,000 and RMB 500,000 shall be imposed; where circumstances are serious, the futures exchange shall be ordered to suspend or cancel its qualification as a delivery warehouse. The principal persons in charge and other directly responsible persons shall be warned and fined between RMB 10,000 and RMB 100,000.**Article 76** Where state-owned or state-controlled enterprises violate this Regulation or provisions of the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration authority and other departments on the entry of state-owned assets into the futures market, or where entities or individuals illegally use credit or fiscal funds for futures trading, they shall be warned, their illegal gains confiscated, and fined between one and five times the illegal gains; where there are no illegal gains or such gains are less than RMB 100,000, a fine between RMB 100,000 and RMB 500,000 shall be imposed. The principal persons in charge and other directly responsible personnel shall be subject to disciplinary sanctions, up to and including dismissal.**Article 77** Where domestic entities or individuals engage in overseas futures trading in violation of provisions, they shall be ordered to correct, warned, their illegal gains confiscated, and fined between one and five times the illegal gains; where there are no illegal gains or such gains are less than RMB 200,000, a fine between RMB 200,000 and RMB 1 million shall be imposed; where circumstances are serious, their overseas futures trading shall be suspended. The principal persons in charge and other directly responsible persons shall be warned and fined between RMB 10,000 and RMB 100,000.**Article 78** Where any entity or individual illegally establishes or in disguised form establishes a futures exchange, a futures company, or other futures operating institution, or engages in futures business without authorization, or organizes disguised futures trading activities, such activities shall be banned, illegal gains confiscated, and a fine between one and five times the illegal gains imposed; where there are no illegal gains or such gains are less than RMB 200,000, a fine between RMB 200,000 and RMB 1 million shall be imposed. The principal persons in charge and other directly responsible persons shall be warned and fined between RMB 10,000 and RMB 100,000.**Article 79** Where a supplier of a futures company’s trading or clearing software refuses to cooperate with investigations by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council, or fails to provide relevant software materials as required, or provides materials with falsehoods or major omissions, it shall be ordered to correct and fined between RMB 30,000 and RMB 100,000. The principal persons in charge and other directly responsible persons shall be warned and fined between RMB 10,000 and RMB 50,000.**Article 80** Where intermediary service institutions such as accounting firms, law firms, or asset appraisal institutions fail to exercise due diligence and issue documents containing false records, misleading statements, or major omissions, they shall be ordered to correct, have their business income confiscated, have relevant business licenses suspended or revoked, and be fined between one and five times their business income. The principal persons in charge and other directly responsible persons shall be warned and fined between RMB 30,000 and RMB 100,000.**Article 81** Where any entity or individual seriously violates this Regulation, the futures regulatory authority of the State Council may declare the person, the entity, or directly responsible persons of the entity to be barred from the futures market.**Article 82** Where staff of the futures regulatory authority of the State Council, futures exchanges, the margin safety depository monitoring institution, margin depository banks, or other relevant units disclose State secrets or members’ or clients’ commercial secrets, or commit favoritism, neglect duties, abuse power, or accept bribes, they shall be subject to administrative or disciplinary sanctions according to law.**Article 83** Where a violation of this Regulation constitutes a crime, criminal liability shall be pursued according to law.**Article 84** Administrative penalties for violations stipulated in this Regulation shall be decided by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council. Where the statutory functions of other departments are involved, the authority shall handle jointly with them; where the matters fall within the statutory functions of other departments, the authority shall transfer such matters to those departments.## Chapter VIII Supplementary Provisions**Article 85** For the purposes of this Regulation, the following terms shall have the meanings indicated:1. **Futures contract**: a standardized contract uniformly formulated by a futures exchange that stipulates delivery of a specified quantity of an underlying at a specified time and place in the future. According to the underlying, futures contracts are divided into commodity futures and financial futures. Underlyings of commodity futures include agricultural products, industrial products, energy, other commodities, and related index products; underlyings of financial futures include securities, interest rates, exchange rates, and other financial products and related index products.2. **Options contract**: a standardized contract uniformly formulated by a futures exchange granting the buyer the right to buy or sell the agreed underlying (including a futures contract) at a specified price at a specified time in the future.3. **Margin**: funds paid by a futures trader according to prescribed standards for clearing and performance assurance.4. **Clearing**: the process of settling funds and effecting transfers based on profits and losses of both parties determined by settlement prices published by the futures exchange.5. **Delivery**: upon a contract’s expiration, the process of closing out open contracts in accordance with exchange rules and procedures by transfer of ownership of the underlying specified in the contract or by cash settlement at prescribed settlement prices.6. **Offsetting (closing out)**: the act by which a futures trader buys or sells a contract that is the same in variety, quantity, and delivery month as the one held but in the opposite direction, thereby concluding the futures trade.7. **Open interest**: the number of contracts held by a trader that have not been offset.8. **Position limit**: the maximum number of contracts that a trader may hold as prescribed by the futures exchange.9. **Warehouse receipt**: a standardized delivery voucher issued by a delivery warehouse and recognized by the futures exchange.10. **Price limit (limit up/limit down)**: the mechanism under which the trading price of a contract shall not exceed prescribed up or down limits within a trading day; quotations beyond the limits are invalid and cannot be executed.11. **Insider information**: information not yet disclosed that may have a material impact on futures prices, including: policies formulated by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council and other relevant departments that may materially affect futures prices; decisions made by futures exchanges that may materially affect prices; fund movements and trading trends of exchange members or clients; and other important information identified by the authority as having a significant impact on prices.12. **Insiders**: persons who, by virtue of managerial, supervisory, or professional positions, or as employees or professional advisors performing duties, can access or obtain insider information, including: managers and other practitioners of futures exchanges who can obtain insider information due to their positions; staff of the futures regulatory authority of the State Council and other relevant departments; and other persons specified by the authority.**Article 86** The futures regulatory authority of the State Council may approve the establishment of a specialized futures clearing institution to specifically perform the clearing and related duties of a futures exchange and to bear corresponding legal liabilities.**Article 87** Administrative measures for overseas institutions establishing, acquiring, or taking equity in futures operating institutions within the territory, and for overseas futures operating institutions establishing branches (including representative offices) within the territory, shall be formulated by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council jointly with the competent commerce department of the State Council, the foreign exchange authority, and other relevant departments, and implemented after approval by the State Council.**Article 88** Futures trading conducted on trading venues approved by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council other than futures exchanges shall be governed by relevant provisions of this Regulation.**Article 89** Any institution or market that, without approval by the futures regulatory authority of the State Council, conducts standardized contract trading by centralized matching and simultaneously adopts any of the following trading mechanisms or has any of the following features shall be deemed to be conducting disguised futures trading:1. Providing performance guarantees for all buyers and sellers participating in centralized trading;2. Implementing daily no-debt settlement and a margin system while the margin ratio is below 20% of the contract (or agreement) notional.Institutions or markets that, prior to the implementation of this Regulation, adopted or possessed the mechanisms or features set forth in the preceding paragraph shall make rectifications within the time limit specified by the competent commerce department of the State Council.**Article 90** Other trading activities in commodities or financial products that do not constitute futures trading shall be supervised and administered by relevant State departments and are not governed by this Regulation.**Article 91** This Regulation shall enter into force on 15 April 2007. The *Interim Regulation on the Administration of Futures Trading* promulgated by the State Council on 2 June 1999 shall be repealed simultaneously.
