关于印发《关于贯彻<中共中央国务院关于进⼀步加强农村⼯作提⾼农业综合⽣产能⼒若⼲政策的意⻅>的意⻅》的通知2025/9/12,10:43**中⽂**English⽆障碍2025年9⽉12⽇星期五农历本⽉23⽇秋分农业农村部邮箱**中国农业农村信息⽹**请输⼊关键字搜索**⾸页机构新闻****公开****政务服务专题互动数据业务管理**当前位置：⾸页>2005>第2期关于印发《关于贯彻<中共中央国务院关于进⼀步加强农村⼯作提⾼农业综合⽣产能⼒若⼲政策的意见>的意见》的通知⽇期：2005-02-2016:14作者：来源：【字号：⼤中⼩】打印本页各省、⾃治区、直辖市及计划单列市、新疆⽣产建设兵团农业、农机、畜牧、农垦、乡镇企业、渔业厅（局、委、办）、部机关各司局及有关直属单位：为了认真贯彻落实《中共中央国务院关于进⼀步加强农村⼯作提⾼农业综合⽣产能⼒若⼲政策的意见》（中发〔2005〕1号），我部起草了《关于贯彻<中共中央国务院关于进⼀步加强农村⼯作提⾼农业综合⽣产能⼒若⼲政策的意见>的意见》，现印发给你们，请结合本地区、本单位实际，及时传达学习，切实贯彻执⾏，并将贯彻落实⽅案、措施等情况，于2005年2⽉21⽇报农业部办公厅。附件：关于贯彻《中共中央国务院关于进⼀步加强农村⼯作提⾼农业综合⽣产能⼒若⼲政策的意见》的意见中华⼈民共和国农业部⼆〇〇五年⼀⽉⼗九⽇**附件：****关于贯彻《中共中央国务院关于进⼀步加强农村⼯作****提⾼农业综合⽣产能⼒若⼲政策的意见》的意见**各省、⾃治区、直辖市及计划单列市、新疆⽣产建设兵团农业、农机、畜牧、农垦、乡镇企业、渔业厅（局、委、办）、部机关各司局及有关直属单位：去年以来，各级农业部门紧紧围绕粮⾷增产、农民增收的⽬标，认真贯彻《中共中央国务院关于促进农民增加收⼊若⼲政策的意见》（中发〔2004〕1号）和中央农村⼯作会议精神，全⼒做好各项⼯作。粮⾷⽣产出现重要转机，农民收⼊实现较快增长，动物疫病防控取得重⼤胜利，农业和农村经济全⾯发展，为国家宏观调控和⼤局稳定做出了积极贡献。但必须清醒地看到，农业仍然是国民经济的薄弱环节，粮⾷稳定增产、农民持续增收的基础还不牢固，农业综合⽣产能⼒亟待加强和提⾼。对此，党中央、国务院⾼度重视，专门下发了《中共中央国务院关于进⼀步加强农村⼯作提⾼农业综合⽣产能⼒若⼲政策的意见》（中发〔2005〕1号），明确了今年农业和农村⼯作的总体要求，提出了加强农业综合⽣产能⼒建设的⽬标和任务，出台了⼀系列⼒度⼤、操作性强的政策措施。各级农业部门要按照今年中央1号⽂件要求，深⼊贯彻党的⼗六⼤和⼗六届三中、四中全会以及中央经济⼯作会议、中央农村⼯作会议精神，全⾯落实科学发展观，坚持统筹城乡发展⽅略和“多予少取放活”⽅针，认真落实各项政策，⼤⼒推进农业结构调整，促进农业增长⽅式转变，加强农业综合⽣产能⼒建设，努⼒实现粮⾷稳定增产、农民持续增收，开创农业和农村经济⼯作的新局⾯。**⼀、认真落实党在农村的各项政策，保护和调动农民的积极性****（⼀）认真落实“两减免、三补贴”政策。**切实落实好良种补贴和农机补贴政策，积极配合有关部门落实好减免农业税、取消除烟叶以外的农业特产税和对种粮农民进⾏直接补贴的政策。采取多种形式，⼴泛开展宣传，让基层和农民及时了解政策。继续坚持去年政策落实中各种⾏之有效的办法和措施，促进各项政策的落实。尽快制定落实政策的⽅案和配套措施，做到⽅案具体化、措施规范化、落实责任化。完善良种补贴⽅式和管理办法，按照公开、透明、到位、有效的原则，制定简便可⾏、管理规范的补贴办法，确保补贴资⾦真正发放到农民⼿中。坚持良种补贴与主导品种、主推技术、订单⽣https://www.moa.gov.cn/nybgb/2005/derq/201806/t20180617_6152395.htmPage1of5关于印发《关于贯彻<中共中央国务院关于进⼀步加强农村⼯作提⾼农业综合⽣产能⼒若⼲政策的意⻅>的意⻅》的通知2025/9/12,10:43产、种⼦基地四挂钩，促进粮⾷⽣产的区域化、规模化和产业化。组织好四⼤作物良种和适⽤农机具的⽣产，确保适⽤良种和农机具的供应。加强监督检查，建⽴项⽬档案，核实并督促各项资⾦及时到位。畜牧部门要配合有关部门搞好取消牧业税试点，农垦部门要配合有关部门落实好国有农垦企业农业税减免政策。及时了解政策落实过程中出现的新情况、新问题，并采取有效措施切实加以解决。**（⼆）认真落实农村⼟地承包政策。**深⼊贯彻《农村⼟地承包法》，依法稳定和完善⼟地承包关系。加快农村⼟地经营权证书发放，确认渔民的⽔域、滩涂使⽤权和牧民的草原使⽤权。开展⼟地⼆轮承包政策落实情况的全⾯检查，坚决纠正违反法律和政策的做法及各种损害农民⼟地权益的⾏为。搞好⼟地承包纠纷仲裁试点⼯作，妥善处理农村⼟地承包纠纷问题。维护农户拥有承包地和从事农业⽣产的权利，保障外出务⼯农民的⼟地承包权和经营⾃主权。实施《农村⼟地承包经营权流转管理办法》，按照依法、⾃愿、有偿的原则，正确引导农村⼟地流转，防⽌⽚⾯追求⼟地规模经营。**（三）认真落实整顿规范农资市场的各项政策。**切实加强农业⽣产资料供应和市场管理。加⼤关键农时季节农资打假⼒度，以种⼦、农药、肥料、饲料及饲料添加剂、兽药为重点，重点抓好县乡⼀级农资市场整顿治理，严厉打击⾮法制售假冒伪劣农资等坑农害农⾏为，配合有关部门控制农资价格过快上涨。通过明察暗访等形式，彻底查明假劣农资来源与流向，并依法严肃处理。深⼊开展农药残留、畜禽产品违禁药物滥⽤、⽔产品药物残留专项治理，坚决禁⽌⽣产、销售和使⽤⾼毒、⾼残留农药。继续保持毒⿏强整治⾼压态势。按照属地化管理原则，落实地⽅农资打假责任，建⽴健全农资监管长效机制。**（四）认真落实深化农村改⾰的各项政策。**积极配合有关部门，进⼀步深化农村税费改⾰，落实各项政策措施。深⼊开展减轻农民负担专项治理⼯作，进⼀步减轻农民负担。坚决执⾏农民减负的“四项制度”，严肃查处各种违规违纪⾏为，加强农民负担监控、督查、督办。严格规范农村“⼀事⼀议”，绝不能变成固定收费项⽬，加重农民负担。抓紧修订农民负担监督管理法规，推动各地制定减轻农民负担⼯作考核办法。积极参与粮⾷流通体制、农村⾦融体制和⼟地征收、征⽤制度等改⾰，落实好相关的改⾰政策措施。**⼆、加快实施优质粮⾷产业⼯程，稳定提⾼粮⾷⽣产能⼒****（五）扎实推进优质粮⾷产业⼯程建设。**以484个产粮⼤县（场）为重点，扎实推进⼯程项⽬建设，加快构建9个优势粮⾷产业带。重点实施优质专⽤良种育繁、病⾍害防控、标准粮⽥建设和现代农机装备等项⽬，引导社会资⾦投⼊粮⾷加⼯转化项⽬，努⼒使建设资⾦和⽣产技术协调运⽤，技术措施与⼯程措施有机结合，政府投资与社会投资有效配套。尽早完成2005年项⽬申报、审批和计划下达⼯作，积极协调有关部门，使⼯程资⾦及时⾜额落实到位。切实做好优粮⼯程项⽬实施⼯作，明确领导责任，完善⼯作机制，强化项⽬监管，确保项⽬建设效果。**（六）突出抓好主产区粮⾷⽣产。**落实中央扶持粮⾷主产区发展的各项政策措施，在项⽬和资⾦安排上继续向主产区倾斜。稳定和增加粮⾷播种⾯积，调整和优化品种结构，建⽴核⼼技术试验区、超级稻标准化⽣产⽰范区。⼤⼒发展优质⽔稻，扩⼤杂交稻和超级稻的种植，重点抓好长江中下游和华南⽔稻主产区的“单改双”。继续发挥黄淮海和西南地区⼩麦增产优势，⼤⼒发展优质专⽤⼩麦⽣产。稳定⽟⽶主产区的⽟⽶种植⾯积，发展青贮⽟⽶等专⽤⽟⽶，搞好⽟⽶深加⼯。继续在⼤⾖主产区推⼴优良品种，提⾼⼤⾖质量。切实抓好主销区和产销平衡区的粮⾷⽣产，积极探索建⽴粮⾷主产区与主销区之间的利益协调机制和合作途径。充分发挥垦区在发展粮⾷⽣产中的⽰范作⽤。**（七）进⼀步强化粮⾷⽣产的指导和服务。**继续坚持实⾏粮⾷⽣产责任制，强化⼯作督导、技术指导，做好农业⽣产技术、农机、信息和产销等服务。组织实施夏粮、早稻、秋粮增产⾏动，抓好关键季节的粮⾷⽣产指导。引导农民以市场为导向，改善粮⾷品种结构，改⾰种植制度，重点在粮⾷主产区推⼴多熟⼗⼤种植模式，提⾼复种指数。继续实施好“种⼦⼯程”，积极组织实施以良种良法相结合为核⼼的⽰范推⼴项⽬。尽早制订各项防灾减灾预案，切实加强植物病⾍害灾情监测和预报，提前做好抗灾物资、资⾦、技术准备，⽴⾜抗灾夺丰收。**（⼋）切实加强耕地保护和质量建设。**认真贯彻《国务院关于深化改⾰严格⼟地管理的决定》，按照基本农⽥“总量不减少、⽤途不改变、质量不下降”的要求，健全基本农⽥保护制度，认真做好基本农⽥补划⼯作，把基本农⽥落实到地块、农户。严禁占⽤基本农⽥挖塘养鱼、种树造林或进⾏其他破坏耕作层的活动。严禁通过调整农场⾪属关系、撤销农场建制等⽅式改变农场农⽤地的⽤途。开展全国耕地质量调查，加强⼟壤肥⼒监测。建⽴健全全国耕地质量动态监测和预警系统。扩⼤沃⼟⼯程实施规模，加快中低产⽥改造，推⼴测⼟配⽅施肥，发展保护性耕作。引导农民珍惜和保护⼟地，多施农家肥和绿肥，增加⼟壤有机质，提⾼耕地地⼒和肥料利⽤率。**三、深化农业结构调整，努⼒提⾼农产品竞争能⼒****（九）⼤⼒发展特⾊农业。**⼤⼒实施优势农产品区域布局规划，加快发展特⾊农业，构建特⾊鲜明的优势农产品产业带。抓好蔬菜、长江流域⾼品质棉规划的制定和实施，组织好苹果⾮疫区⽰范建设。抓紧修改和完善《西部地区特⾊农业发展规划》，⼒争尽早启动实施。加强优https://www.moa.gov.cn/nybgb/2005/derq/201806/t20180617_6152395.htmPage2of5关于印发《关于贯彻<中共中央国务院关于进⼀步加强农村⼯作提⾼农业综合⽣产能⼒若⼲政策的意⻅>的意⻅》的通知2025/9/12,10:43势农产品产业带基础设施建设，吸引农业产业化龙头企业和社会资⾦积极参与优势农产品产业带建设。启动建设⼀批龙头企业带动能⼒强、产业发展基础好的特⾊农产品标准化⽣产⽰范基地，加快建设⼀批⽣产规模较⼤、市场相对稳定的特⾊农产品⽣产基地。扩⼤特⾊农产品出⼜，加快实施园艺产品出⼜⾏动计划。积极培育和推⼴优良品种，坚持传统技术和现代技术相结合，提⾼特⾊农产品品质和⽣产⽔平。推动实⾏原产地标识等保护特⾊农产品的⼯作，整合特⾊农产品品牌，⽀持做⼤做强名牌产品。**（⼗）加快发展畜牧业。**推进畜牧业结构调整，转变畜牧业增长⽅式，实现畜牧业产业升级，积极发展现代畜牧业。加快推⾏牧区围栏放牧、轮牧休牧，发展舍饲半舍饲养殖，搞好饲草料地建设，改良牲畜品种。充分发挥农区作物秸秆和劳动⼒资源丰富的优势，⼤⼒实施秸秆养畜过腹还⽥⽰范基地建设项⽬，积极发展节粮型畜牧业。⽀持有条件的地区推进规模养殖和畜禽养殖⼩区建设，搞好畜产品出⼜基地建设。加⼤“畜禽良种⼯程”的实施⼒度，实施好奶⽜良种繁育补贴试点项⽬。强化饲料质量安全监测，建⽴安全优质⾼效的饲料⽣产体系。制定并尽快实施动物防疫体系建设规划，加快建设重⼤动物疫病监测预警，动物疫病预防控制、动物防疫检疫监督、兽药质量检测和残留监控、动物防疫技术⽀撑、动物防疫物质保障等系统。搞好重点兽⽤⽣物制品⽣产企业的技术改造。加快兽医管理体制改⾰，尽快建⽴健全动物疫病防治队伍，协助有关部门落实动物防疫监督机构⼈员经费和⼯作经费，全额纳⼊各级财政预算。完善突发重⼤动物疫情应急机制，强化重⼤动物疫病免疫⼯作。加强疫情预警预报和监测。继续搞好⽆规定动物疫病⽰范区建设。进⼀步加强兽药质量监管，做好重⼤动物疫病疫苗的⽣产、调拨⼯作。**（⼗⼀）加快发展⽔产业。**推进⽔产业结构调整，推⼴健康养殖技术和优良品种，⼤⼒发展优质、⾼效、⽣态、健康⽔产养殖业，积极开拓国内外⽔产品市场。加强⽔产原良种体系建设，提⾼苗种质量和良种覆盖率，努⼒提⾼⽔产品质量。实施远洋渔业发展总体规划，促进远洋渔业发展。继续实施海洋捕捞渔民转产转业⼯程，抓好涉外渔业管理和渔业安全⽣产。坚持和完善海洋伏季休渔和长江禁渔期制度，保护渔业资源和⽔域⽣态环境，提升渔业可持续发展能⼒。**四、⼤⼒发展农村⼆三产业，进⼀步增强农村经济发展活⼒****（⼗⼆）⼤⼒发展农业产业化经营。**加⼤对农业产业化企业的⽀持⼒度，进⼀步落实和完善扶持龙头企业的政策，积极推动统⼀农产品加⼯增值税进销项税率改⾰的落实，做⼤做强农业产业化龙头企业。组织龙头企业西部⾏活动，开展东北地区⽟⽶产销活动，推动建⽴区域性⼤型农产品⽣产、加⼯和销售基地。建⽴健全农业产业化利益联结机制，⿎励和引导龙头企业与农户采取多种利益联结⽅式，带动基地和农户发展。积极探索龙头企业和专业合作组织为农户承贷承还、提供贷款担保等有效办法。坚持“民办、民管、民受益”的原则，积极推进农民专业合作组织及农村经纪⼈、专业⼤户等中介组织的发展。做好农民专业合作组织⽰范项⽬⼯作，加强对⽰范项⽬的指导和监督。发展和壮⼤集体经济组织，提⾼对农户和社区的服务⽔平。**（⼗三）⼤⼒发展农产品加⼯业。**⽀持粮⾷主产区⽴⾜本地优势，以发展农产品加⼯业为突破⼜，加快发展农村⼆三产业，⾛新型⼯业化道路，促进农业增效、农民增收和区域经济发展。扶持以粮⾷为主要原料的农产品加⼯业，⼤⼒发展粮⾷精深加⼯，提⾼粮⾷转化增值能⼒。确定农产品加⼯重点⾏业和重点产品，建⽴⼀批农产品加⼯⽰范企业、⽰范县和农产品加⼯出⼜基地。抓紧完善农产品加⼯质量检验检测体系和质量安全控制体系。⿎励农产品加⼯企业⾃主研发与引进相结合，形成技术创新机制。充分发挥农产品加⼯业在西部⼤开发和振兴东北⽼⼯业基地中的作⽤。**（⼗四）⼤⼒发展农产品营销业。**继续搞好集贸市场和批发市场建设，改造现有农产品批发市场，发展经纪⼈代理、农产品拍卖、⽹上交易等⽅式，增强交易功能。注重发挥农产品期货市场作⽤，引导农民合理安排⽣产，规避市场风险。积极发展农产品连锁经营，发展现代营销⽅式和物流设施，逐步建⽴规范有序、安全⾼效的农产品零售体系。加快以冷藏和低温仓储运输为主的农产品冷链系统建设。积极协助有关部门加快开通整车运输鲜活农产品的“绿⾊通道”，抓紧落实降低或免交车辆通⾏费的有关规定。继续办好优质⼩麦等重要农产品的推介活动和中国国际农产品交易会。实施“⾛出去”战略，努⼒扩⼤农产品出⼜，提⾼农业对外开放⽔平。**（⼗五）⼤⼒发展乡镇企业。**坚持服务农民、服务农业、服务农村的宗旨，着⼒发展劳动密集型产业、农产品加⼯产业、规模企业配套产业和农村服务业，积极发展各类产业集群，提⾼吸纳农村富余劳动⼒的能⼒。推动信⽤担保体系建设，帮助企业解决资⾦困难问题。加强职⼯技能培训，继续实施蓝⾊证书⼯程，提⾼职⼯技能和收⼊⽔平。加快技术改造步伐，今年要组织1万项成熟关键技术在乡镇企业推⼴。完善产权制度改⾰，⽤现代产权制度和各项配套制度促进企业发展。继续推进乡镇企业东西合作，引导乡镇企业向⼩城镇集中，稳妥发展各类乡镇企业基地，壮⼤县域经济。https://www.moa.gov.cn/nybgb/2005/derq/201806/t20180617_6152395.htmPage3of5关于印发《关于贯彻<中共中央国务院关于进⼀步加强农村⼯作提⾼农业综合⽣产能⼒若⼲政策的意⻅>的意⻅》的通知2025/9/12,10:43**五、启动农业科技⼊户⼯程，提⾼农业科技创新与转化应⽤能⼒****（⼗六）精⼼组织“农业科技⼊户”。**以优势农产品和优势产区为重点，以推⼴主导品种、主推技术和实施主体培训为主要措施，以资源整合和体系创新为突破⼜，建⽴科技⼈员直接到户、良种良法直接到⽥、技术要领直接到⼈的农技推⼴新机制。在全国培育10万个科技⽰范户，辐射带动200万农户，重点推⼴应⽤50个主导品种和20项主推技术，使⽰范户先进实⽤技术⼊户率和到位率达到90%以上。按照农业科技⼊户⼯程总体实施⽅案要求，各级农业部门尽快制定具体⼯作⽅案，明确责任，落实措施，确保科技⼊户⼯作取得明显成效。**（⼗七）加⼤农业良种良法推⼴⼒度。**认真组织实施超级稻推⼴项⽬和重⼤农业技术推⼴项⽬专项补贴措施。抓好粮⾷作物丰产品种选育，培育北⽅粳型和南⽅籼型超级稻新品种，组装推⼴配套技术，充分发挥超级稻增产潜⼒，并逐步形成产业化。继续实施“农业科技跨越计划”，⽰范推⼴⼀批先进科技成果。研究对重⼤农业技术推⼴进⾏补贴的⽅式，提出实施⽅案。组织好重⼤农业技术推⼴⾏动，推⼴测⼟配⽅施肥、旱作节⽔、⾼毒农药替代、统⼀灭⿏、畜禽规模化养殖综合配套、海洋深⽔抗风浪⽹箱、⽆公害⽔产品健康养殖和割胶等技术。进⼀步加强农作物重⼤病⾍害综合防治技术推⼴。把农业机械化技术推⼴作为⼀项战略性措施抓紧抓好。充分发挥农垦在良种良法推⼴⽅⾯的⽰范作⽤。**（⼗⼋）加快农业技术推⼴体系改⾰。**按照强化公益性职能、放活经营性服务的要求，加⼤农业技术推⼴体系改⾰⼒度。严格按照国家有关规定界定公益性职能，调整和配备农技推⼴⼒量，切实履⾏好公益性职能。积极争取各级财政等有关部门⽀持，使公益性技术推⼴⼯作经费得到保证。积极稳妥地将经营性技术服务分离出去，按照市场化⽅式运作。积极培育农民专业技术协会和农业科技型企业。探索农业技术推⼴新机制和新办法，对农业科技推⼴项⽬实⾏招投标制度和⾸席专家制，⿎励各级农技推⼴组织、⼈员及有关企业公平参与项⽬申报。总结各地试点经验，尽快提出加强农业技术推⼴体系建设的指导意见。**（⼗九）加强农业科技创新能⼒建设。**加强农业科技研发和攻关，重点开展良种繁育、防灾减灾、动植物病⾍害防治等⽅⾯的技术攻关，⼒争在新品种培育、动物疫病和植物病⾍害防治等⽅⾯取得新的突破。充分利⽤国家重⼤科技计划，开展⽣物育种、航天育种、转基因技术、微⽣物⼯程、农业信息化和⾃动化控制等农业⾼新技术的研发。积极协调有关部门，争取⼤幅度增加农业科研投⼊，加快建⽴以政府为主导、社会⼒量⼴泛参与的多元化农业科研投⼊体系，形成稳定的投⼊增长机制。继续深化农业科研体制改⾰，加快建⽴农业科技创新体系。整合农业科研资源，依托具有明显优势的省级农业科研院所等，建设区域性农业科研中⼼，开展区域重⼤应⽤技术攻关和试验。建设若⼲从事农业基础性研究的国家和农业部重点开放式实验室、改良中⼼、⼯程中⼼等，建设⼀批布局合理的农业科学研究野外观测基地。加⼤对粮⾷主产省区和西部地区粮⾷作物良种繁育基础设施建设的扶持⼒度，建设⼀批育繁推销⼀体化制种基地。**（⼆⼗）加⼤农民培训⼒度。**充分利⽤农业科研、教学、推⼴机构的资源，围绕主导品种和主推技术，开展多层次、多渠道、多形式的农民科技培训，⼤⼒提⾼农民科技⽂化素质。抓好科技⽰范户的培训，增强⽰范带动作⽤，切实提⾼培训效率，全年培训⾻⼲农民100万⼈，带动周边农民1000万⼈，完成绿⾊证书培训200万⼈。继续认真实施《2003—2010年全国农民⼯培训规划》，深⼊实施阳光⼯程，加⼤农村劳动⼒⽣产技术、就业、技能、营销和经纪⼈等培训⼒度，探索建⽴培训、就业、跟踪服务⼀体化机制，全年培训农民250万⼈以上。继续配合有关部门，清理和取消针对农民进城就业的歧视性规定和不合理收费，为农民外出务⼯创造良好的外部环境。**六、加强农业基础设施建设，增强农业发展的⽀撑保障能⼒****（⼆⼗⼀）全⾯推进农业“七⼤体系”建设。**进⼀步完善规划体系，注重体系规划与“⼗⼀五”规划的衔接，急需启动的⼯程与规划长期⽬标的衔接，省级规划与整体规划的衔接，明确各层级体系建设的重点，区分轻重缓急，分步、分区域组织实施。完善农业投资管理体制，充分发挥国家投资的⽰范、引导和调控作⽤，积极吸引社会资本、⼯商资本参与体系建设，形成投⼊多元、利益共享的投资新机制。强化项⽬监管，完善项⽬监督检查办法和相关⼯作制度，确保资⾦专款专⽤，防⽌滥⽤挪⽤。加⼤检查和整改⼒度，严格落实惩戒措施，实⾏建设项⽬责任追究制，形成有效的监督和建后管护机制，切实提⾼投资效益。**（⼆⼗⼆）加强农产品质量安全设施建设。**积极推进农业标准化，尽快制定、修订农业标准，进⼀步建⽴健全农业标准体系。加快农产品标准化⽰范基地建设，加强农产品认证和产地认定⼯作。进⼀步加强农产品检验检测基础设施建设，强化农产品产地检验检疫制度，建⽴农产品市场准⼊制度和质量安全追溯制度。加⼤农产品质量安全监管试点⼯作⼒度，积极探索加强农产品质量安全管理的有效途径。建⽴健全农产品质量安全例⾏监测制度，启动省级农产品质量安全监测⼯作，完善农产品质量安全信息发布制度。加快农产品质量安全法制建设，进⼀步理顺农产品质量安全管理体制。加强“⾦农⼯程”建设，完善农业监测预警、农产品与⽣产资料市场监管、农村市场与科技信息系统，整合农业信https://www.moa.gov.cn/nybgb/2005/derq/201806/t20180617_6152395.htmPage4of5关于印发《关于贯彻<中共中央国务院关于进⼀步加强农村⼯作提⾼农业综合⽣产能⼒若⼲政策的意⻅>的意⻅》的通知2025/9/12,10:43息资源，延伸农业信息服务⽹络，积极推进农业信息化。**（⼆⼗三）加强农业⽣态⼯程建设。**认真实施退牧还草⼯程，进⼀步加强草原⽣态建设。做好草原防灾减灾和⽣态监测，搞好草原防⽕和⿏⾍害防治⼯作。加⼤草原执法⼒度，严厉打击各种破坏草原的违法⾏为。继续加强农村沼⽓建设，全年⼒争再新增农村沼⽓150万户，其中中央⽀持建设100万户，带动地⽅建设50万户。积极发展太阳能、风能等新型洁净能源和可再⽣能源。建⽴外来⼊侵⽣物风险评估机制，加⼤对外来有害物种监测和综合防控⼒度。启动重点区域农业⾯源污染调查监测⼯作，因地制宜开展农业⾯源污染防治技术试点⽰范，加⼤对农业环境污染事故的处理⼒度。加强动植物品种资源保护，建⽴⼀批野⽣植物资源原⽣境保护点（区）。加强渔业⽔域⽣态环境监测⼯作，建⽴健全⾚潮等⽔域⽣态灾害的防灾减灾机制。**七、积极推动农村基层组织建设，努⼒提⾼农业部门⾏政能⼒****（⼆⼗四）积极参与农村党建⼯作。**配合有关部门和农村基层党委和政府，贯彻落实好中央把解决“三农”问题作为全党⼯作重中之重的战略思想、统筹城乡发展⽅略和胡锦涛总书记“两个趋向”重要论断，深化对“三农”⼯作规律的认识，促进农业和农村经济更快更好发展。按照各级党委的统⼀部署和要求，积极参与农村保持共产党员先进性教育活动，促进农村基层党组织建设。利⽤农业培训资源，开展农村党员⼲部培训活动，帮助他们提⾼⾃⾝素质和⼯作能⼒。认真贯彻落实《依法⾏政实施纲要》和《⾏政许可法》等法律法规，健全农业法律法规，加强农村普法教育，推进农业综合执法试点，搞好农业执法监督。加强农村财务管理，完善财务公开制度，推动村务公开、政务公开和民主管理，促进建⽴健全充满活⼒的村民⾃治机制。**（⼆⼗五）进⼀步强化对基层和农民的服务⼯作。**牢固树⽴科学发展观和正确的政绩观，弘扬求真务实、开拓创新、勤政⾼效、清正廉洁的政风。把为农民办实事作为⼀项重要⼯作来抓，2005年农业部将继续为农民办15件实事，帮助农民解决⽣产⽣活中的困难。切实加强农业信访⼯作，建⽴健全领导接待农民群众来访制度，明确属地管理的信访⼯作责任，依法帮助农民维护⾃⾝合法权益。认真执⾏中央关于改进会风、⽂风的规定，精简会议和⽂件，切实转变⼯作作风。加快电⼦政务建设，⼤⼒推进政府上⽹和农业信息⽹络建设，强化对基层和农民的信息服务。进⼀步完善和落实党风廉政建设和反腐败⼯作责任制，抓党风、带政风、促⾏风，树⽴农业部门的良好形象。今年农业和农村经济⼯作任务⼗分繁重。各级农业部门要进⼀步转变职能，明确⼯作思路，完善⼯作机制，求真务实、开拓创新、扎实⼯作，努⼒实现粮⾷产量稳定增加，农民收⼊持续增长，农业和农村经济全⾯协调发展。

name_chn: 农业部关于印发《“十一五”时期全国农产品市场体系建设规划》的通知
text: # Notice of the Ministry of Agriculture on Issuing the "Plan for the Construction of the National Agricultural Products Market System during the Eleventh Five-Year Plan Period"**Nong Shi Fa [2006] No. 21**To: Departments (Bureaus, Commissions, Offices) of Agriculture (Animal Husbandry, Fisheries) of all provinces, autonomous regions, municipalities directly under the Central Government, cities with independent development plans, and the Agricultural Bureau of the Xinjiang Production and Construction Corps:In order to advance the construction of the agricultural products market system during the Eleventh Five-Year Plan period and provide strong support for the development of modern agriculture, the Ministry has organized the formulation of the *Plan for the Construction of the National Agricultural Products Market System during the Eleventh Five-Year Plan Period*, which is hereby issued to you. All localities are expected to take this plan as the basis, conduct thorough research, adapt it to local realities, actively implement it, and further strengthen the construction of the agricultural products market system in their respective regions during the Eleventh Five-Year Plan period.Ministry of Agriculture of the People’s Republic of China  November 28, 2006  ---# Plan for the Construction of the National Agricultural Products Market System during the Eleventh Five-Year Plan PeriodThe agricultural products market system refers to the organizational system and structural forms of operation, transaction, management, and service in the circulation of agricultural products. It serves as the bridge and link between production and consumption, and is one of the important supporting systems for the development of modern agriculture. During the Eleventh Five-Year Plan period, with further economic and social development and the comprehensive advancement of new rural construction, agricultural product circulation must become more orderly, standardized, safe, and efficient. Therefore, it is necessary to accelerate the development of the agricultural products market system, improve infrastructure, enhance integrated services, strengthen circulation capacity, increase efficiency, and create better conditions for circulation. This will enable the effective realization of agricultural product value and promote the sustained development of agriculture and the rural economy.---## I. Progress in the Construction of the Agricultural Products Market System during the Tenth Five-Year Plan PeriodDuring the Tenth Five-Year Plan period, the construction of the agricultural products market system advanced rapidly, reflected in the following:**1. Development of the market system.** By the end of the Tenth Five-Year Plan, the number of agricultural wholesale markets nationwide had stabilized at around 4,300, with annual transaction value increasing year by year, reaching 360 billion yuan in 2005. The number of agricultural trade markets slightly decreased to about 25,000, but the pace of transformation accelerated. Roadside and open-air markets were gradually replaced by standardized markets with fixed facilities. Agricultural products in supermarkets became increasingly important, with sales in cities such as Shanghai, Beijing, and Qingdao accounting for more than one-third of local retail sales of agricultural products. The futures market also advanced steadily. During this period, the state approved cotton and sugar for futures trading, bringing the number of agricultural futures varieties to nine, with an annual transaction volume exceeding 6 trillion yuan.**2. Improved policy environment.** During the Tenth Five-Year Plan period, the state increased support for agricultural market infrastructure. In 2002, six ministries, including the Ministry of Agriculture, jointly issued the *Opinions on Further Strengthening the Construction of Agricultural Product Circulation Infrastructure*. In 2004 and 2005, the Ministry issued the *Guidelines for the Construction and Management of Agricultural Wholesale Markets (Trial)* and the *Opinions on Strengthening the Work of Agricultural Product Circulation*. These provided clear requirements for direction, content, and functions, offering strong guidance for strengthening agricultural market construction nationwide.**3. Diversified market actors.** By the end of the Tenth Five-Year Plan, the number of agricultural brokers reached about 5 million, becoming an important force in agricultural product distribution. Farmers’ professional cooperatives increased to about 150,000, playing an important role in organizing farmers to enter the market, enhancing competitiveness, and raising incomes. Leading enterprises in agricultural industrialization exceeded 4,300, with an increasingly strong driving role. State-owned commercial organizations continued to dominate grain, cotton, and other major agricultural purchases and in import-export trade.**4. Strengthened market services.** By the end of the Tenth Five-Year Plan, 28 provinces (regions) had opened “green channels” for agricultural product transportation. A nationwide “five vertical and two horizontal” green channel network was established, promoting circulation and the development of a unified national market. Agricultural informatization advanced significantly: 31 provinces, about 80% of prefectures, and 40% of counties had established local agricultural information networks, and a national “One-Stop” supply-demand information system was launched, strengthening information services. Quality testing expanded, with 225 designated wholesale markets supported by the Ministry to establish testing centers, compared to only 18 at the end of the Ninth Five-Year Plan—an increase of 11.5 times. Pesticide residue detection capacity improved rapidly.---## II. The Situation Facing Agricultural Products Market System Development during the Eleventh Five-Year Plan Period**1. The major decision of building a new socialist countryside creates new opportunities.** The Fifth Plenary Session of the 16th CPC Central Committee proposed the historic task of building a new socialist countryside. The No. 1 Central Document of 2006 (*Opinions on Promoting the Construction of a New Socialist Countryside*) further clarified goals and requirements. With implementation, the external environment for agriculture and rural development will be optimized. Policies of industry supporting agriculture, urban support for rural areas, and coordinated urban-rural development will be implemented. The agricultural market system, as a key support, will receive greater policy support and new development opportunities.**2. Enhanced agricultural production capacity provides a solid material foundation.** According to the *11th Five-Year Plan for National Agricultural and Rural Economic Development (2006-2010)*, comprehensive agricultural capacity will increase. Grain output will reach 500 million tons; cotton, oilseed, and sugar production will reach 6.8 million, 32 million, and 120 million tons respectively; production of meat, eggs, milk, aquatic products, vegetables, and fruit will also rise substantially. This provides a strong material basis for prosperous markets while placing higher demands on their development.**3. Further improvement of the market economy system creates a better institutional environment.** The Eleventh Five-Year Plan period will deepen reforms, further improve the socialist market economy, and promote a unified, open, competitive, and orderly agricultural market system. Institutional barriers to free circulation will gradually be removed, green channel policies will be improved, pricing will become more transparent and fair, and information dissemination will become more efficient, providing institutional guarantees for markets to play their regulatory role effectively.**4. Increased agricultural openness provides broader space.** During this period, China will fully enter the WTO post-transition stage, further opening its agricultural market. More foreign agricultural products will enter domestic circulation, while more competitive Chinese products will seek overseas markets. This provides broader space but also higher requirements.**5. Implementation of the *Agricultural Product Quality and Safety Law* raises higher standards.** Effective November 1, 2006, this law marked a new stage of law-based administration in quality safety. It stipulates obligations and responsibilities for strengthening quality supervision in circulation. Markets must establish supporting institutions, equipment, personnel, and systems, backed by legal authority.**6. Persistent contradictions and problems pose challenges.** Despite progress, gaps remain compared to developed countries. Problems include regional imbalance (strong east, weak west; underdeveloped production-area markets), poor facilities, limited service functions, low farmer organization, fragmented market actors, low efficiency, weak resilience to risk, incomplete legal systems, and insufficient informatization. These pose severe challenges and highlight the urgency of improving the market system.---## III. Guiding Principles and Objectives**1. Guiding principles.** Guided by Deng Xiaoping Theory, the important thought of “Three Represents,” and the Scientific Outlook on Development, efforts will focus on increasing agricultural efficiency, accelerating rural development, and raising farmers’ incomes. In line with the Fifth Plenary Session of the 16th CPC Central Committee’s requirements, the goal is to meet growing demand for quantity, variety, and quality of agricultural products. This requires accelerating infrastructure upgrades, improving services, expanding business scope, and modernizing both hardware and management. The aim is to transform market constraints into drivers, enhance competitiveness, and promote sustained development.**2. Basic principles.**  - *Government guidance and market operation.* As a quasi-public infrastructure, markets require government guidance in planning, investment, and layout, while respecting economic laws, adopting market-oriented operation, enterprise management, and modern corporate systems.  - *Adaptation to local conditions with classified guidance.* Different types of markets face diverse environments; guidance should be tailored to regional characteristics, consumer demand, development stage, and economic conditions.  - *Grounded in reality, advancing gradually.* Development must consider economic, social, institutional, and human factors, moving step by step.  - *Improved facilities and innovative management.* Construction must combine hardware upgrades with management innovation, advanced circulation methods, and sound systems.**3. Development goals.** By 2010, under government guidance and support, a unified, open, competitive, and orderly agricultural market system will be established, featuring modern logistics, chain distribution, e-commerce, and futures trading. Wholesale markets will serve as the core, with trade markets, retail shops, and supermarkets as the base. This system will reach a modernization level comparable to that of mid-level developed countries. Goals include:  - *Enhanced basic functions.* Infrastructure and management improved, with stronger roles in aggregation, pricing, and information dissemination.  - *Stronger market actors.* Larger scale, better capacity, and stronger resilience; credibility and fair competition promoted.  - *Quality and safety monitoring capacity established.* Quality testing facilities and reporting systems widely implemented.  - *Modern circulation advanced.* Grading, packaging, order-based trade, auctions, online trading, chain operations, logistics, futures, and e-commerce developed.---## IV. Key Tasks during the Eleventh Five-Year Plan**1. Accelerate market upgrading.**  - *Wholesale market upgrading projects.* Ten areas of infrastructure construction and ten areas of business expansion, including ground hardening, road systems, storage, packaging, information systems, and quality testing.  - *Renovation of trade markets.* Eliminate roadside markets, promote hall-style trading markets, encourage “market-to-supermarket” reforms, and develop community convenience stores.**2. Develop modern circulation methods.**  - Promote chain operations and logistics distribution centers.  - Strengthen agricultural e-commerce and online trading platforms.  - Develop futures markets for more products, broaden services, and involve producers, processors, traders, and farmers.**3. Cultivate market actors.**  - Train and support brokers, strengthen farmer cooperatives, and support their role in circulation.**4. Promote grading and packaging.**  - Establish national grading standards, guide adoption, and develop sorting and packaging facilities in production areas.**5. Strengthen marketing and promotion services.**  - Utilize WTO rules, expand promotion platforms, enhance online exhibitions, support advertising and branding, organize large exhibitions, encourage enterprises to “go global,” and expand international markets.---## V. Safeguard Measures**1. Strengthen leadership.** Recognize agricultural market system construction as key to new rural building and modern agriculture, requiring strong leadership, policy support, and problem-solving.**2. Increase investment.** Secure financial support for infrastructure such as roads, information, testing, and sanitation. Improve financing channels and attract enterprises, individuals, and foreign capital.**3. Strengthen services.** Guide planning and upgrading, support industry associations, improve green channel policies, reduce costs, and enhance information services.**4. Strengthen law enforcement.** Implement the *Agricultural Product Quality and Safety Law*, establish testing agencies, adopt quality access systems, and promote circulation-related legislation such as a *Wholesale Market Law*.**5. Organize training.** Train managers in modern management, technical staff in testing, and farmers and brokers in marketing and legal knowledge, encouraging organized and enterprise-oriented development.**6. Promote publicity.** Publicize significance, progress, effects, and experiences through various forms to raise awareness, gain support, and encourage broad participation.---
text_chn: 农业部关于印发《“⼗⼀五”时期全国农产品市场体系建设规划》的通知2025/9/12,10:43⾼级检索农业部关于印发《“⼗⼀五”时期全国农产品市场体系建设规划》的通知发布时间：2006-12-12字体：[⼤中⼩]**农市发[2006]21号**各省、⾃治区、直辖市、计划单列市农业（畜牧、渔业）厅（局、委、办），新疆⽣产建设兵团农业局：为推进“⼗⼀五”期间农产品市场体系建设，为发展现代农业提供有⼒⽀撑，我部组织拟定了《“⼗⼀五”时期全国农产品市场体系建设规划》，现印发给你们。希望各地以本规划为依据，在深⼊调查研究的基础上，结合实际，积极贯彻，进⼀步加强“⼗⼀五”期间本地区农产品市场体系建设。⼆〇〇六年⼗⼀⽉⼆⼗⼋⽇**“⼗⼀五”时期****全国农产品市场体系建设规划**农产品市场体系，是流通领域内农产品经营、交易、管理、服务等组织系统与结构形式的总和，是沟通农产品⽣产与消费的桥梁与纽带，是现代农业发展的重要⽀撑体系之⼀。“⼗⼀五”时期，经济、社会进⼀步发展，新农村建设全⾯推进，这要求农产品流通必须更加有序、规范、安全、⾼效。为此，必须加快推进农产品市场体系建设，完善基础设施，改善综合服务，增强流通能⼒，提⾼流通效率，创造更好的市场流通条件，有效实现农产品价值，拉动农业和农村经济持续发展。**⼀、“⼗五”农产品市场体系建设进展情况**“⼗五”时期我国农产品市场体系建设快速推进，体现在：**（⼀）市场体系发展。**截⾄“⼗五”期末，全国**农产品批发市场**数量⼤体稳定在4300家左右，市场年成交额不断提⾼，2005年达到3600亿元；**农贸市场**数量稳中略降，约为25000家，但改造步伐加快，露天的⻢路市场和简易市场逐渐被具有固定场所和设施的规范市场取代；**农产品在超市的地位**不断凸显，上海、北京、⻘岛等城市超市农产品销售量已占到当地农产品零售总量的三分之⼀以上；**期货市场**稳步发展，国家“⼗五”期间新批准棉花、⻝糖上市交易，使农产品期货交易品种达到9个，年成交额逾6万亿元。**（⼆）政策环境改善。**“⼗五”期间，国家加⼤了对农产品市场基础设施建设的⽀持⼒度，2002年农业部等6部委联合印发了《关于进⼀步加强农产品流通基础设施建设的若⼲意⻅》，2004年、2005年农业部印发了《农产品批发市场建设管理指南（试⾏）》和《关于加强农产品市场流通⼯作的意⻅》，对农产品市场流通基础设施建设的⽅向、内容、功能等提出了明确要求，为各地加强农产品市场建设提供了有⼒的指导。**（三）市场主体多元。**截⾄“⼗五”期末，农产品经纪⼈发展到500万左右，成为农产品运销的重要⼒量；农⺠专业合作组织发展到15万个左右，在组织农⺠统⼀进⼊市场、增强竞争⼒、增加收⼊⽅⾯发挥了重要作⽤；农业产业化⻰头企业发展到4300多家，带动作⽤不断增强；国合商业组织在粮⻝、棉花等⼤宗农产品收购与农产品进出⼝贸易等领域中仍占据重要地位。**（四）市场服务加强。**截⾄“⼗五”期末，全国有28个省（区）开通了辖区内的农产品运输“绿⾊通道”，全国建⽴了“五纵两横”的“绿⾊通道”⽹络，促进了农产品流通和统⼀⼤市场的发展；农业信息化建设有⼒推进，全国31个省、80%左右的地（市）和40%的县都建⽴了农业信息局域⽹，开通了农产品供求信息全国“⼀站通”系统，市场信息服务得到强化；市场质量检测服务不断拓展，农业部⽀持建⽴质量检测中⼼的定点批发市场达225家，⽐“九五”期末的18家增⻓了11.5倍，农药残留检测能⼒迅速提升。**⼆、“⼗⼀五”农产品市场体系发展⾯临的形势****（⼀）建设社会主义新农村的重⼤决策和部署，为农产品市场体系带来了新的发展机遇。**党的⼗六届五中全会提出了建设社会https://www.moa.gov.cn/gk/tzgg_1/tz/200612/t20061212_738312.htm?utm_source=chatgpt.comPage1of4农业部关于印发《“⼗⼀五”时期全国农产品市场体系建设规划》的通知2025/9/12,10:43主义新农村的重⼤历史任务，2006年中央1号⽂件《关于推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅》，进⼀步明确了新农村建设的具体⽬标与要求。“⼗⼀五”时期，随着新农村建设的推进，农业和农村经济发展的外部环境将更加优化，⼯业反哺农业、城市⽀持农村、城乡统筹和谐发展的⽅针将得到贯彻落实，农产品市场体系作为农业和农村经济发展的重要⽀撑体系之⼀，将得到国家更多的政策⽀持，迎来更⼤的发展机遇。**（⼆）农业综合⽣产能⼒的提⾼，为农产品市场发展提供了雄厚的物质基础。**按照《全国农业和农村经济发展第⼗⼀个五年规划（2006-2010年）》确定的⽬标，“⼗⼀五”期间，我国农业综合⽣产能⼒将有⼀个新的提⾼，粮⻝⽣产能⼒将达到5亿吨，棉花、油料和糖料产量分别达到680万吨、3200万吨和1.2亿吨，⾁、蛋、奶、⽔产品、蔬菜、⽔果等也将有⼤幅增⻓，⼤量商品农产品进⼊市场交易，为市场繁荣奠定了坚实的物质基础，也对市场发展提出了新的更⾼的要求。**（三）市场经济体制进⼀步完善，为农产品市场发挥价值规律作⽤促进产销发展创造了更好的制度环境。**“⼗⼀五”时期，国家将继续深化各项改⾰，进⼀步完善市场经济体制，促进全国统⼀、开放、竞争、有序的农产品市场体系不断向前发展，各种阻碍农产品⾃由流通的制度性障碍将逐步消除，全国农产品运销“绿⾊通道”制度将更加完善，价格形成更加透明、公正，市场信息的传播更迅速，这些都为农产品市场发挥价值规律作⽤、更有效地引导农产品产销发展提供了制度保障。**（四）农业对外开放程度的提⾼，为农产品市场发展提供了更加⼴阔的空间。**“⼗⼀五”时期，我国全⾯步⼊WTO后过渡期，农产品市场进⼀步对外开放，国际市场与国内市场的联系更加紧密。⼀⽅⾯将有更多的国外农产品进⼊国内市场，参与流通，向全国辐射；另⼀⽅⾯我国将有更多的优势农产品进⼊国际市场，寻找新的市场销路，这为农产品市场发展提供了更⼤的空间，提出了更⾼的要求。**（五）《农产品质量安全法》的实施，为农产品市场发展提出了更⾼的要求。**2006年11⽉1⽇，《农产品质量安全法》正式施⾏，标志着我国农产品质量安全⼯作迈⼊了依法⾏政的新阶段。这部法律对农产品市场流通环节加强质量监督检查作出了明确规定，市场必须履⾏相应的义务和责任。这对农产品市场加强相关组织机构建设、配备设备与⼈员、健全管理运⾏制度是⼀种有⼒的法律⽀持。**（七）当前市场建设与运⾏中的⽭盾与问题，为农产品市场发展提出了严峻的挑战。**我国农产品市场体系建设虽然取得了⻓⾜的进步，但与发达国家⽐较成熟和完善的农产品市场体系相⽐较，还存在着明显的差距和不⾜。主要问题是：农产品市场体系发展东强⻄弱，产地市场尤其落后，地区发展不平衡；农产品市场设施简陋、服务功能单⼀的问题仍然突出，制约着很多市场发挥更⼤的作⽤；农⺠进⼊市场的组织化程度低，市场主体呈⼩规模、⼤群体格局，流通效率不⾼，抗市场⻛险能⼒弱；农产品市场管理相关法律制度不健全，维护市场秩序⼯作难度⼤；农村商品流通的信息化建设处于起步阶段。这些都对农产品市场体系建设提出了严峻挑战，更增强了完善农产品市场体系的紧迫性。**三、“⼗⼀五”农产品市场体系发展的指导思想与⽬标****（⼀）指导思想**坚持以邓⼩平理论、“三个代表”重要思想和科学发展观为指导，紧紧围绕农业不断增效、农村加快发展和农⺠持续增收的中⼼任务，根据党的⼗六届五中全会关于健全农产品市场体系、推进现代农业和社会主义新农村建设的要求，适应城乡居⺠对农产品数量、品种、质量消费需求⽇益提⾼的需要，加快市场基础设施改造升级，完善市场服务功能，拓展市场经营领域，全⾯推动我国农产品市场体系的硬件设施和软件管理向现代化迈进，变市场约束为市场动⼒，提升我国农产品竞争⼒，促进农业和农村经济持续、快速发展。**（⼆）基本原则**“⼗⼀五”期间，农产品市场体系建设要坚持以下原则：**——政府引导，市场化运作。**农产品市场体系是具有⼀定公益性质的社会公共基础设施，各级政府要发挥引导作⽤，加强规划，合理布局，增加投⼊，引导市场健康发展。同时，市场建设⼜必须尊重经济规律，实⾏市场化运作、企业化管理，多渠道筹集资⾦，加强内部管理，建⽴现代企业制度，不断提⾼⾃我积累与⾃我发展能⼒。**——因地制宜，分类指导。**农产品市场体系包含多种不同类型的市场形态，同样类型的市场之间也会因所处的地区条件不同，⾯临不同的发展环境。对于不同的农产品市场，应当根据各⾃发展的规律与特点，进⾏分类指导。应根据不同的农业区域特⾊、消费市场特点、市场发育程度、地区整体经济发展⽔平等客观情况，因地制宜指导市场体系建设。**——⽴⾜现实，循序渐进。**我国农产品市场体系建设是⼀个⻓期、渐进的过程，不可能⼀蹴⽽就。农产品市场体系建设受到经济、社会、体制、⼈员素质等多种因素的影响。不能脱离现实的客观环境凭主观意愿进⾏市场体系建设，必须⽴⾜现实，充分考虑现有的经济技术条件与市场发展环境，循序渐进地向前推进。**——完善设施，创新管理。**农产品市场体系建设不仅要加强各类市场的硬件基础设施建设，改善市场的环境条件，还要注重创新管理⽅式，积极采⽤先进的流通⽅式与管理⽅式，健全各项科学管理制度，以便同步提升市场体系的软件与硬件⽔平，使市场的各种功能更有效地得到发挥。**（三）发展⽬标**https://www.moa.gov.cn/gk/tzgg_1/tz/200612/t20061212_738312.htm?utm_source=chatgpt.comPage2of4农业部关于印发《“⼗⼀五”时期全国农产品市场体系建设规划》的通知2025/9/12,10:43到2010年，在政府的宏观调控和扶持下，基本建⽴起以现代物流、连锁配送、电⼦商务、期货市场等现代市场流通⽅式为先导，以批发市场为中⼼，以集贸市场、零售经营⻔店和超市为基础，布局合理、结构优化、功能⻬备、制度完善、有较⾼现代化⽔平的统⼀、开放、竞争、有序的农产品市场体系，农产品市场整体运⾏状况接近同期发达国家的中等⽔平。具体要在以下四个⽅⾯取得明显进展：**——市场基本功能明显增强。**通过加强建设和改进管理，使农产品市场基础设施普遍得到改善，市场管理与服务⽔平有新的提⾼，市场集散商品、形成价格、传播信息等基本功能和辐射带动作⽤明显增强。**——市场主体经营能⼒显著提⾼。**通过扶持引导，使市场主体的经营规模和经营能⼒不断提⾼，抗⻛险能⼒显著增强；通过建⽴诚信机制，促进市场主体合法经营、平等竞争。**——市场监控农产品质量安全的能⼒初步形成。**通过普遍建⽴农产品质量安全检测室，完善⽇常检测与结果报告制度，推动在农产品市场开展经常性的质量安全检测，使市场切实担负起监督控制流通环节农产品质量安全的职责。**——现代流通⽅式得到有效推进。**通过推动农产品分级包装上市，促进订单交易、拍卖交易、⽹上交易的发展；通过发展连锁经营、物流配送、期货市场、电⼦商务，进⼀步拓宽农产品市场流通渠道，提⾼流通效率。**四、“⼗⼀五”农产品市场体系发展与建设重点****（⼀）加快农产品市场改造步伐****——在农产品批发市场组织实施升级拓展⼯程。**推进10个⽅⾯的基础设施建设，即市场地⾯硬化、⽔电道路系统改造、交易厅棚改扩建、储藏保鲜设施、加⼯分选及包装设施、客户⽣活服务设施、市场信息收集发布系统、市场管理信息化系统、质量安全检测系统、卫⽣保洁设施。拓展10个⽅⾯的业务功能，即实⾏场地挂钩、开展加⼯配送、监管质量安全、推进规范包装、强化信息服务、发展现代流通、壮⼤市场主体、开拓对外贸易、维护安全交易、完善公共服务。**——积极改造农贸市场。**实⾏退路进厅，取消⻢路市场，建设场所相对固定的⼤厅式交易市场，完善场地、道路、⽔电、垃圾处理等必要设施。继续在有条件的地⽅积极推⾏“农改超”，提升市场档次。⼤⼒发展社区便利店，建⽴新型农产品零售⽹络。**（⼆）发展农产品现代流通⽅式****——发展农产品连锁经营。**引导农业产业化⻰头企业、批发市场和⼤型农产品流通企业发展农产品连锁经营，建⽴新型、⾼效的农产品营销⽹络。⽀持建⽴⼀批跨区域的⼤型农产品物流配送中⼼，提⾼农产品集中采购、统⼀配送的能⼒。⿎励农⺠专业合作经济组织在城市建⽴农产品品牌直销连锁店。**——发展农产品电⼦商务。**培育⼤型农业⽹站，强化农产品市场信息收集发布。积极创造条件建⽴⽹上交易平台，探索开展农产品电⼦商务。完善农业⽹上展厅，扩⼤农产品⽹上宣传、推介⼒度。**——发展农产品期货市场。**稳步推动农产品期货市场发展，选择条件成熟的品种及时组织上市交易，增加农产品期货交易品种。加强期货市场资源的开发利⽤，扩⼤影响⾯，延伸服务范围，使更多农产品⽣产、加⼯、贸易企业和农⺠能够参与期货市场的活动，维护⾃身利益。**（三）培育壮⼤市场主体**积极培育、壮⼤农产品经纪⼈队伍，围绕农产品流通政策、运销贮藏加⼯技术、质量安全知识与法规、农业科技等内容开展农产品经纪⼈培训，向农产品经纪⼈提供市场信息服务，帮助他们提⾼素质，增强市场开拓能⼒。积极引导农⺠营销合作组织发展，⿎励运销⼤户、农产品加⼯和流通企业领办营销合作组织，提⾼农⺠参与农产品流通的组织化程度，增强市场竞争⼒。**（四）推进农产品分等分级和包装上市**加快制订全国统⼀的农产品分等分级标准，积极宣传农产品分等分级知识，⿎励农⺠和经销商按统⼀标准对农产品进⾏分等分级，实⾏规格化包装，提升农产品整体形象。积极引导在农产品集中产区和产地批发市场，建⽴农产品分选、包装设施，为农产品产后分等分级和包装提供条件。**（五）加强农产品营销促销服务**积极利⽤WTO规则，加⼤对农产品营销促销服务的⽀持⼒度，加快建⽴和完善农产品营销促销服务平台，为农产品⽣产经营者、加⼯贸易企业提供形式多样的营销促销服务。进⼀步充实、完善农产品⽹上展厅，利⽤互联⽹全⾯展示和推介我国优质、安全、特⾊农副产品，为沟通产销创造条件。加强农产品营销促销公益⼴告宣传，提⾼我国农产品的声誉，扩⼤市场影响。培育⼤型农产品展会，增强展会的品牌影响，推动农业交流，促进农产品贸易。⽀持国内农业企业实施“⾛出去”战略，积极参加国外⼤型农产品博览会，扩⼤我国农产品的国际影响，不断开拓国际农产品市场。**五、农产品市场体系建设的保障措施**农产品市场体系建设作为现代农业发展的⼀个重要⽀撑体系，要纳⼊政府公共财政⽀持范畴，加⼤投⼊，重点⽀持，要创造良好的政策环境，推动其快速发展。**（⼀）加强领导。**加强农产品市场体系建设是社会主义新农村建设和发展现代农业的⼀个重要抓⼿，是拓展农业部⻔产业管理职能的重要体现。各级农业部⻔必须⾼度重视，切实加强对体系建设的组织领导，为市场发展积极争取优惠政策，帮助协调解决市场发https://www.moa.gov.cn/gk/tzgg_1/tz/200612/t20061212_738312.htm?utm_source=chatgpt.comPage3of4农业部关于印发《“⼗⼀五”时期全国农产品市场体系建设规划》的通知2025/9/12,10:43展中遇到的实际问题。**（⼆）增加投⼊。**积极争取计划、财政等部⻔的投资，重点⽀持农产品市场的⽔电路系统、信息收集发布系统、农产品质量安全检测系统、电⼦统⼀结算系统、环保卫⽣等公益性基础设施。同时，要积极协调⾦融机构，为市场建设创造良好的融资环境，争取更多的信贷⽀持。各级农业部⻔要逐步调整现有农业资⾦的投⼊结构和⽀持重点，向农产品市场体系建设倾斜，扶持市场发展。通过政策引导，吸引企业、个⼈等各种社会⼒量投⼊农产品市场流通设施建设，并积极利⽤外资，形成多元化的投⼊机制，促进市场建设与发展。**（三）强化服务。**加强对农产品市场建设的规划，引导市场建设合理布局，积极指导市场实施升级改造⼯程；⽀持建⽴农产品市场流通⾏业协会，推动市场之间加强交流合作，促进共同发展；完善、落实全国农产品运输“绿⾊通道”政策，减轻农产品运销环节的税费负担；加强农产品市场信息服务，促进产销衔接，引导农产品有序流通。**（四）加强执法。**认真贯彻落实《农产品质量安全法》，在农产品市场流通环节建⽴健全质量安全检测机构，配备必要检测设备，充实检测技术⼈员，完善检测报告制度，推⾏农产品质量安全市场准⼊制度，严格把好质量安全关⼝。同时，积极推动建⽴健全农产品市场流通法规，包括《农产品批发市场法》，规范农产品市场⾏为，理顺管理体制，为农产品⾼效、有序、安全流通提供法律制度保障。**（五）组织培训。**对农产品市场管理⼈员进⾏现代市场建设与运营管理知识培训，不断提⾼业务⽔平和管理能⼒，保障市场升级改造的顺利进⾏和先进交易⽅式的推⼴应⽤。对市场信息和质量安全检测技术⼈员进⾏专业技术培训，提⾼从业技能，保证⼯作质量。对从事农产品运销的个⼈和团体进⾏营销技能和政策法律知识培训，提⾼营销能⼒，并积极引导其建⽴多种形式的联合与合作，提⾼组织化程度，逐步向法⼈化、企业化经营⽅向发展。**（六）搞好宣传。**利⽤多种形式⼤⼒宣传农产品市场体系建设的重要意义、重⼤进展、积极效果与典型经验，扩⼤社会影响，争取有关部⻔的理解与⽀持，吸引更多社会⼒量参与农产品市场体系建设，为推进体系建设营造良好的舆论氛围。扫⼀扫在⼿机打开当前⻚机关⼦站直属单位⽹站国务院各部⻔⽹站地⽅农业管理部⻔⽹站关于我们|⽹站声明|⽹站地图|联系我们|访问分析主办单位：中华⼈⺠共和国农业农村部承办单位：农业农村部信息中⼼⽹站识别码bm21000007京ICP备05039419号-2京公⽹安备11010502037559号⽹站保留所有权，未经允许不得复制镜像https://www.moa.gov.cn/gk/tzgg_1/tz/200612/t20061212_738312.htm?utm_source=chatgpt.comPage4of4

name_chn: 农业部关于贯彻落实《中共中央 国务院 关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义 新农村建设的若干意见》的意见
text: # Opinions of the Ministry of Agriculture on Implementing the “Opinions of the CPC Central Committee and the State Council on Vigorously Developing Modern Agriculture and Solidly Advancing the Construction of a New Socialist Countryside”To: Departments (Bureaus, Commissions, Offices) of Agriculture, Agricultural Machinery, Animal Husbandry, Veterinary Affairs, State Farms, Township Enterprises, and Fisheries of all provinces, autonomous regions, municipalities directly under the Central Government, and cities with independent development plans; Agricultural Bureau of the Xinjiang Production and Construction Corps:To fully implement the *Opinions of the CPC Central Committee and the State Council on Vigorously Developing Modern Agriculture and Solidly Advancing the Construction of a New Socialist Countryside* (Zhongfa [2007] No. 1, hereinafter the “No. 1 Central Document”), the following opinions are hereby put forward. Please act in light of local realities and see to thorough implementation.---## I. Fully Recognize the Great Significance of Vigorously Developing Modern Agriculture and Solidly Advancing the New Socialist Countryside, and Clarify the Guiding Principles for Work**(1) Accurately assess the current situation of agriculture and the rural economy.**  In recent years, agricultural authorities at all levels have earnestly implemented central directives and steadily promoted the building of a new socialist countryside, achieving remarkable results. Grain output increased for three consecutive years; farmers’ incomes rose rapidly for three straight years; rural sectors developed in a steady and coordinated manner; operational quality in agriculture and the rural economy improved steadily; new progress was made in preventing and controlling major animal diseases such as avian influenza and foot-and-mouth disease. This favorable situation has strongly supported stable and rapid national economic growth. At the same time, agriculture and the rural economy remain in a difficult climbing stage: the agricultural foundation is weak; facilities and equipment lag behind; maintaining steady grain growth and sustained income increases for farmers is growing more difficult; and the tasks facing agricultural and rural work are very demanding.**(2) Fully understand the great significance of vigorously developing modern agriculture.**  Agricultural development concerns the broader landscape of the national economy and social development: when agriculture prospers, the foundation is strong; when farmers are well-off, the country thrives; when the countryside is stable, society is at peace. Vigorously developing modern agriculture is the concrete application of the Scientific Outlook on Development to agricultural and rural work; it is the top priority for building a new socialist countryside; it is the fundamental path to stabilizing grain production and sustaining farmers’ income growth; and it is the necessary route to sustainable agricultural development. Agricultural authorities at all levels should, from a strategic and holistic perspective, fully appreciate its significance, analyze the new situation, accurately understand the scientific connotation of modern agriculture, clarify goals and tasks, grasp the characteristics and laws of China’s modernization of agriculture, and blaze a path to agricultural modernization with Chinese characteristics.**(3) Take building modern agriculture as the focus of agricultural and rural economic work.**  Developing modern agriculture is the overarching theme and an important responsibility of agricultural authorities. In 2007, work on agriculture and the rural economy should be guided by Deng Xiaoping Theory and the important thought of the “Three Represents”; fully implement the spirit of the Fifth and Sixth Plenary Sessions of the 16th CPC Central Committee, as well as the Central Economic Work Conference and the Central Rural Work Conference; uphold the Scientific Outlook on Development; focus on developing modern agriculture; continue to implement the three strategies of “transformation, expansion, and upgrading”; and strive to strengthen the four pillars of policy, science and technology, facilities and equipment, and talent. Efforts should be made to build six industrial systems: premium grain, efficient cash crops and horticulture, healthy animal husbandry and aquaculture, agricultural industrialization and agro-processing, biomass and ecological industries, and agricultural services. Consolidate and expand the favorable situation in agriculture and the rural economy, with the goal of keeping total grain output no lower than the previous year and increasing per capita net income of farmers by more than 5%. Agricultural authorities at all levels should clarify working ideas, focus on priorities, formulate concrete plans and supporting measures, and organize effective implementation.---## II. Conscientiously Implement Policies that Support Agriculture and Benefit Farmers, and Protect and Mobilize Farmers’ Initiative to Build Modern Agriculture**(4) Unswervingly uphold the basic rural management system.**  Stabilize and improve the rural land contracting system. Accelerate follow-up work after contract extensions and resolve prominent problems in land contracting, ensuring that land contract-management right certificates are issued to all households. Stabilize fishermen’s use rights to waters and tidal flats and strengthen the issuance of aquaculture certificates. Improve mechanisms for the transfer of land contract-management rights on a law-based, voluntary, and compensated basis; localities with the right conditions may develop appropriately scaled operations in various forms. Advance arbitration pilots for land contract disputes, promote legislation on arbitration, and establish sound mechanisms to properly address issues arising from land contracting. Proactively advance reform of the land expropriation system and explore effective ways to ensure both current and long-term interests of farmers.**(5) Intensify the implementation of policies that support and benefit agriculture.**  Actively secure fiscal and credit funds supporting agriculture, and increase inputs into building modern agriculture. Improve and effectively implement direct grain subsidies and comprehensive input subsidies for agricultural means of production; expand the implementation of superior seed subsidies and subsidies for purchasing agricultural machinery. Implement minimum purchase price policies for key regions and major grain varieties, and work to improve and institutionalize such policies. Strengthen the management and use of agricultural support funds, including public tendering, subsidy disclosure, and direct-to-household payments, to ensure that benefits reach farmers. Coordinate agricultural projects and funding arrangements, increase auditing and oversight, establish necessary penalties, and improve project efficiency.**(6) Continue to reduce farmers’ burdens.**  Establish, improve, and strictly enforce systems to lighten farmers’ burdens; expand comprehensive governance; address issues strongly reported by farmers; and explore long-term mechanisms to prevent burden rebound. Improve the “one matter, one discussion” system for village-level fund-raising and labor contributions; strengthen publicity, training, guidance, and supervision; implement award-and-subsidy policies for public-welfare facilities built under this system; and actively develop small-scale rural public-welfare infrastructure. Consolidate tax-and-fee reform achievements in state farms and effectively reduce burdens on agricultural employees.**(7) Actively participate in rural social security and agricultural insurance.**  Actively explore the establishment of a social security system covering both urban and rural residents, and promote the establishment of a rural minimum living standard scheme nationwide. In line with the principles of government guidance, policy support, market operation, and farmer voluntariness, promote an improved agricultural insurance system. Advance legislation on policy-based agricultural insurance and expand pilot programs. Encourage leading enterprises and intermediaries to organize farmers to participate in insurance. Push forward rural financial reform, promote rural credit guarantee funds or institutions, and ease financing difficulties for households and rural SMEs.---## III. Strengthen Agricultural Infrastructure and Raise the Level of Facilities and Equipment for Modern Agriculture**(8) Strengthen arable land quality.**  Protect arable land—especially basic farmland. In line with requirements for leveled fields, fertile soils, and supporting roads and canals, accelerate the construction of high-standard farmland that is drought- and flood-resilient and stable in output. Launch a new round of the “Fertile Land Program,” focusing on soil improvement, fertility enhancement facilities, and water–fertilizer coupling micro-projects. Expand the scope and scale of subsidies to improve soil organic matter, guiding farmers to increase inputs into organic matter. Encourage the development of green manure, straw incorporation, and application of farmyard manure to improve the quality of medium- and low-yield fields.**(9) Enhance the capacity for sustainable development.**  Vigorously develop circular and ecological agriculture; where conditions permit, accelerate organic agriculture and launch organic base construction. Speed up R&D and promotion of new pesticides, equipment, and technologies; adopt integrated pest management; advocate biological control; and advance green plant protection. Accelerate grazing-to-grassland restoration; strengthen grassland fire prevention and pest control; and explore ecological compensation for grasslands. Strengthen monitoring of agricultural non-point source pollution and accelerate comprehensive prevention and control in key river basins. Enhance protection of plant germplasm and wild plant resources; improve identification, development, and utilization of germplasm; and actively prevent invasive species. Strengthen biosafety management for agricultural GMOs and promote sound development of agricultural biotechnology. Fully implement the *Action Plan for the Conservation of Aquatic Biological Resources in China*; strengthen protection of aquatic resources and fisheries ecology; uphold seasonal marine fishing moratoria and the Yangtze River fishing ban; and increase stock enhancement and release.**(10) Vigorously advance agricultural mechanization.**  Improve the structure and level of agricultural equipment; expand development and application of advanced, applicable machinery and technologies. Prioritize full mechanization of wheat, rice, and corn production; actively promote mechanization for cash crops, forestry, animal husbandry, fisheries, and primary processing. Expand conservation tillage. Build mechanization pilot and demonstration bases and promote technologies such as rice trans-planting, deep loosening, deep placement of fertilizers, and straw crushing and incorporation. Strengthen product quality supervision for agricultural machinery and enhance safety supervision.**(11) Strengthen rural clean energy with a focus on biogas.**  Vigorously develop household biogas; improve service systems; and support construction of medium- and large-scale biogas facilities for farms and farming communities where feasible. Strengthen socialized services and property-style management for household biogas. Continue to promote ecological homestead construction. In suitable areas, develop solar and wind energy; in Tibetan regions, intensify implementation of solar heating projects. Implement the “Rural Cleanliness Program,” advance resource conversion of livestock and poultry manure, crop straw, household garbage, and sewage, and develop recycling of rural waste and agricultural by-products.**(12) Strengthen fisheries infrastructure.**  Increase investment in fishing ports, navigational aids, fisheries safety rescue communications, and vessel monitoring; strengthen support for fisheries safety supervision; provide appropriate subsidies for safety and lifesaving equipment on fishing vessels and for fishermen’s safety training; and strive to build a “safe fishery.” Strengthen infrastructure for aquatic broodstock and breeding systems and aquatic animal disease prevention and control. Improve the fishery product quality inspection and testing system, renew equipment, and enhance testing capacity.**(13) Accelerate agricultural informatization.**  Improve systems for collecting and releasing agricultural information; integrate agricultural information resources; and standardize data collection and processing. Accelerate construction of practical public agricultural databases with unified standards and strengthen application and public services. Deepen the “Golden Agriculture Project,” establishing four-tier (national–provincial–prefectural–county) interconnection centers. Implement the “three-in-one” comprehensive agricultural information service platform and launch rural informatization demonstration projects. Strengthen construction, operation, and management of agricultural remote sensing monitoring systems to provide accurate and timely data.---## IV. Accelerate Scientific and Technological Progress in Agriculture and Raise the Contribution of Science and Technology to Development**(14) Strengthen the agricultural S&T innovation system.**  Steadily advance reforms of the three ministry-affiliated agricultural academies and address new issues arising in the process; optimize operating mechanisms; and advance modern management systems for research institutes. Integrate centers and sub-centers for crop improvement, breeder seed bases, regional innovation centers under the High-Quality Grain Project, and national/ministry key laboratories, giving full play to integrated amplification effects. Promote the integration of research, education, and extension, and industry–academia–research collaboration; explore cross-provincial agricultural S&T cooperation zones; and facilitate personnel exchanges, resource sharing, and project collaboration. Implement industry research special programs by selecting several major agricultural products and key generic technologies, designing technical solutions one by one, integrating national strengths across fields and levels, and pursuing collaborative innovation to achieve breakthroughs. Launch the major special program for breeding new genetically modified varieties as soon as possible; continue the super rice research and extension program and the agricultural S&T leap-forward plan; strengthen management of basic research funds for public-interest institutes; reinforce basic, forward-looking, and strategic innovation; and speed up integrated innovation and pilot-scale maturation of research results. Guide agri-related enterprises to innovate through project steering and enterprise–research linkages.**(15) Bring agricultural S&T to villages and households.**  Explore effective mechanisms to bring personnel and research outcomes into villages and households, forming a dissemination network with experts as the source, technical instructors as the link, model households as the core, and agricultural media as carriers, connecting surrounding farmers. Raise the “arrival-to-household/field” rate of technologies; cultivate technology-leading households to drive others. Implement good-seed projects in farming and breeding, expand coverage of superior varieties, and accelerate the spread of advanced practical technologies.**(16) Vigorously promote resource-saving technologies.**  Develop and apply various saving technologies to improve the efficiency of resources and inputs. Popularize farmland water-saving technologies and launch dryland water-saving agriculture demonstrations. Expand the scope and subsidies for soil testing and formula fertilization to promote scientific application and improve fertilizer use efficiency. Reform farming systems and planting patterns; popularize precision and semi-precision seeding; and promote simplified cultivation such as no-till. Promote precision pesticide application machinery and technologies to improve control effectiveness and pesticide utilization. Advance intensive, efficient, and ecological livestock, poultry, and aquaculture, as well as energy-saving technologies for fishing vessels, reducing feed and energy consumption.**(17) Focus on cultivating new-type farmers.**  Scale up science and technology training for new-type farmers and implement practical talent training. Develop specialized large households in planting/breeding and agricultural machinery, as well as rural brokers and marketing specialists. Expand the “Sunshine Project,” raise subsidy standards, innovate training modes, improve management, strengthen oversight, and enhance quality. Mobilize social forces to participate widely in training for labor transfer. Strengthen vocational skills certification and cultivate a cohort of intermediate and senior technicians among migrant workers. Improve labor export mechanisms, strengthen base construction, build a rural labor development system, and cultivate distinctive labor brands to promote transfer employment through multiple channels. Steadily advance pilot programs for equal employment of rural labor and incorporate rural employment into overall local employment planning. Encourage migrant workers to return home with skills and capital to start businesses and lead modern agriculture. Advance transition programs for marine fishermen to shift industries and occupations, and carry out safety and foreign-related fisheries training. Promote rural education, healthcare, and culture; participate in “Three Services to the Countryside” (science, culture, and health); build farmers’ science and technology reading rooms; and improve overall quality.---## V. Deepen Agricultural Structural Adjustment and Build a Modern Agricultural Industrial System**(18) Accelerate development of the premium grain industry.**  Adhere to the principle of basic self-sufficiency in grain; promote the *Premium Grain Industry Project*; and build an industry with broad coverage of quality seeds, good field conditions, high-quality varieties, and a complete value chain. Stabilize grain area; further protect and mobilize farmers’ enthusiasm for grain cultivation; guide rational planting structures; raise multiple cropping indices; and plant sufficient, high-quality grain. Strive to stabilize grain sown area at no less than 1.58 billion mu this year. Increase yields by promoting superior varieties, disseminating key technologies, strengthening field management, preventing and mitigating disasters, and developing high-quality/high-yield creation programs to realize variety–technology matching, targeting over 1% yield growth this year. Optimize variety structures; vigorously develop high-quality/high-yield crops; and accelerate the potato industry. Continue major projects such as the seed and plant protection programs. Promote advantageous grain belts and encourage appropriate contiguous planting where conditions permit. Increase support for grain processing and conversion, and strengthen support to major grain-producing areas. Give full play to the leading role of large state farm areas in developing the premium grain industry.**(19) Accelerate development of efficient cash crops and horticulture.**  Further optimize regional layouts and accelerate advantageous agricultural belts. Strengthen belts for cotton, oilseeds, sugar crops, natural rubber, and tropical crops; and support horticultural products with export advantages such as vegetables, fruit, tea, and edible fungi. Through planning guidance, policy support, and demonstration, support “one village, one product.” Foster specialized villages and towns with distinctive features, diverse types, and strong competitiveness.**(20) Accelerate development of healthy animal husbandry and aquaculture.**  Transform concepts and models; develop healthy farming; and expand livestock, poultry, and aquaculture. Conscientiously implement the *Animal Husbandry Law*; institute record-keeping for farms; and strengthen supervision over breeding stock production and operations. Advance the breeding systems for superior livestock and poultry; continue the good-breed projects and subsidies for dairy cow breeding. Promote healthy farming methods; expand subsidies for standardized farming communities; and raise resource utilization of manure. Strengthen feed safety supervision at the source. In pastoral areas, practice bans, rest, and rotation grazing and grass–livestock balance; promote stall-feeding. In aquaculture, promote superior varieties; continue aquatic good-breed projects; expand healthy aquaculture demonstration zones; strengthen disease prevention and control; and improve healthy aquaculture levels. Actively develop distant-water fisheries, consolidate pelagic fisheries, and open up oceanic fisheries.**(21) Accelerate agricultural industrialization and agro-processing.**  Implement supportive policies for agricultural industrialization and strengthen guidance and services for leading enterprises. In line with advantageous belts and processing needs of leading firms, build clusters for processing advantageous agricultural products. Continue VAT reform pilots for deep processing; vigorously develop processing of grain and oil, fruit and vegetables, livestock products, and aquatic products. Promote technological innovation in processing and build agro-processing into a pillar for increasing agricultural efficiency.**(22) Accelerate development of biomass and ecological industries.**  Under the principles of scientific planning, rational layout, comprehensive utilization, ecological protection, and increasing farmers’ incomes, prudently develop ecological and biomass industries. Conduct national surveys and assessments of energy crop resources; formulate a national S&T support plan for energy crops; accelerate development of biomass fuels, fertilizers, and feeds using crop straw as the main raw material. Launch pilots for densified solid fuels and straw gasification; support straw utilization as feed. Strengthen R&D, demonstration, reserves, and promotion of biomass technologies. Under the principle of “not competing with people for food or with grain for land,” encourage the use of wastelands and similar resources to develop biomass feedstock crops; support breeding and promotion of energy crops such as sweet sorghum and cassava.**(23) Accelerate development of agricultural services.**  Advance reform of seed management to ensure the complete separation of seed enterprises from administrative departments within the agricultural system by July 1, 2007, and strengthen management and service capacity. Promote unified seed supply, unified fertilizer testing and distribution, and unified prevention and control of major pests and diseases. Upgrade wholesale markets; support circulation infrastructure and logistics enterprises; and develop new circulation methods such as chain distribution. Strengthen market information services and carry out marketing and promotion. Support leading enterprises and farmer cooperatives in delivering directly to urban supermarkets, community markets, and convenience stores. Implement green channel policies for transporting fresh and live agricultural products. Improve and standardize agricultural futures markets and give full play to their roles in guiding production, stabilizing markets, and hedging risks. Expand socialized services for agricultural machinery; organize cross-regional plowing, sowing, and harvesting during peak seasons. Encourage machinery cooperatives and service companies. Improve institutional safeguards for migrant employment and enhance public services in labor-exporting regions.---## VI. Strengthen Market Regulation and Animal Disease Prevention and Control, and Raise the Level of Agricultural Product Quality and Safety**(24) Strengthen quality and safety supervision for agricultural products.**  Conscientiously implement the *Agricultural Product Quality and Safety Law* and fulfill territorial responsibilities. Strengthen supervision at the production stage; advance standardized production; accelerate the building of standardized demonstration counties (farms); establish production records and archives; and implement origin exit controls. Strengthen testing of production environments and product quality; promote certifications for pollution-free, green, and organic products; and support the development of brand-name products. Reinforce market access management, implement packaging and labeling systems, strictly enforce labeling for GM foods and liquid milk, and strengthen traceability and supervision across all links of production and circulation to promote whole-process control. Intensify law enforcement, expand routine monitoring, and increase spot checks and inspections. Lawfully release monitoring information, standardize disclosure, and improve transparency. Strengthen systems and safeguards for quality and safety management; launch a plan for building testing systems; improve organizational structures, operational mechanisms, and safeguards for emergency management; and strengthen enforcement teams.**(25) Intensify rectification of the agricultural inputs market.**  Adhere to addressing both symptoms and root causes under territorial management; carry out special crackdowns on counterfeits; further regulate market order; strictly combat the production and sale of fake and substandard inputs; and safeguard farmers’ interests to provide upstream guarantees for modern agriculture and new countryside construction. Advance “assured-quality inputs to the countryside” initiatives; create designated agricultural input markets; develop modern business models such as chains and direct-supply distribution; establish assured-quality input stores; promote creditworthiness; and build long-term regulatory mechanisms. Strictly supervise pesticides, veterinary drugs, seeds, fertilizers, agricultural machinery, feed, and feed additives; fully ban five highly toxic organophosphorus pesticides including methamidophos; and crack down on illegal operations and the addition of harmful chemicals.**(26) Effectively strengthen prevention and control of major animal diseases.**  Conscientiously implement the *Regulations on Emergency Response to Major Animal Epidemics* and strengthen prevention and control. Improve systems and infrastructure; continue the construction plan for animal disease prevention; focus on spring and autumn immunization campaigns and nationwide cross-checks of antibody levels to ensure coverage and quality. Strengthen surveillance and early warning, improve emergency plans, and raise emergency response capacity. Strengthen animal health law enforcement, strictly enforce quarantine at origins and slaughterhouses, and regulate supervision of markets and transport. Accelerate animal identification and traceability systems to improve monitoring and emergency response. Strengthen supervision of animal epidemic prevention in market and transportation links. Advance the building of zones free from designated animal diseases. Strengthen quality supervision of veterinary drugs and monitoring of residues, and strictly enforce safe medication rules.---## VII. Deepen Rural Reform and Agricultural Opening-Up to Inject Vitality into Modern Agriculture**(27) Proactively advance comprehensive rural reform.**  Actively participate in and promote comprehensive rural reform focusing on township institutions, compulsory rural education, and county–township fiscal systems. Carry out disclosure of collective finances and democratic management; standardize village-level financial management; and improve systems for democratic financial management and audit supervision. Clean up and verify village-level and state farm debts, identify baselines, cap legacy debts, stop new debts, and explore measures to resolve them. Cooperate in addressing arrears related to the former agricultural tax.**(28) Accelerate reform of grassroots agricultural extension systems.**  Fully implement the *State Council Opinions on Deepening Reform and Strengthening Grassroots Agricultural Technology Extension Systems*; strengthen support and guidance; reinforce public-interest functions; improve safeguards; enhance conditions; raise personnel quality; innovate service models; and ensure the basic completion of reforms by year-end.**(29) Vigorously develop farmer professional cooperatives.**  Conscientiously implement the *Farmers’ Professional Cooperatives Law* and support accelerated development. Increase legal publicity and training; revise and issue model charters; and work with relevant departments to formulate supporting regulations and policies. Manage demonstration projects for building cooperatives; strengthen guidance, support, and services; and focus on supporting cooperatives in production, marketing, information services, technical training, processing and storage, and input procurement and operations.**(30) Fully advance reform of the veterinary management system.**  Implement the *State Council Opinions on Advancing Reform of the Veterinary Management System*; focus on building township (town) animal husbandry and veterinary stations and village-level epidemic prevention teams; establish a sound veterinary work system and public finance safeguards; and ensure that provincial, municipal, and county-level veterinary administration, law enforcement supervision, and technical support bodies are established by June this year.**(31) Accelerate reform and development of state farms.**  Continue to reform management systems, innovate business mechanisms, and separate social functions. Improve contracting relationships within state farm areas and develop modern family farms. Intensify confirmation of rights over state farm land and safeguard state land rights. Give full play to state farms’ demonstration role in modern agriculture; build demonstration zones to showcase advanced science and technology, standardized production, industrialized operations, and sustainable ecological models. Leverage technical service systems, teams, and facilities of state farms to benefit surrounding farmers. Strengthen cooperation between state farms and localities; provide services for agricultural production and operations; and guide farmers into the market.**(32) Vigorously advance reform and development of township enterprises.**  Guide township enterprises to accelerate industrial clustering and regional cooperation and to heighten agglomeration effects. Optimize industrial and product structures; support processing of agricultural products and rural services. Encourage institutional innovation and independent innovation; intensify technology extension; develop “blue certificate” training; and strengthen credit guarantees and information services. Expand employment capacity and carry out comprehensive governance to reduce burdens and rectify irregularities.**(33) Continue to strengthen international cooperation in agriculture.**  Guide and support distant-water fishery enterprises, state farm enterprise groups, and leading enterprises with stronger economic strength, R&D capacity, and management levels to expand overseas markets, utilize foreign resources, and establish overseas production and processing bases. Support agricultural export enterprises in registering brands abroad, conducting market research, marketing planning, and product promotion. Actively participate in multilateral and bilateral negotiations, and in the formulation of agricultural conventions, rules, and standards. Prudently and effectively utilize foreign capital and strengthen the introduction and management of advanced and applicable technologies and talent exchange.**(34) Proactively promote coordinated regional development in agriculture.**  Implement central directives and national strategies on coordinated regional development; strengthen guidance for agriculture and the rural economy in the western, northeastern, central, and eastern coastal regions; increase support for old revolutionary base areas, ethnic minority areas, border areas, poor areas, and reservoir resettlement areas; and establish long-term mechanisms for coordinated regional development. Formulate supportive policies tailored to regional characteristics. Promote assistance from developed to less developed regions in technology transfer, talent cultivation, and enterprise cooperation.---## VIII. Strengthen Implementation and Mechanisms to Ensure Tasks Are Completed**(35) Strengthen investigation and research on major agricultural and rural issues.**  Conduct in-depth studies on vigorously developing modern agriculture, solidly advancing new countryside construction, and building a harmonious rural society; propose concrete policy measures; and improve scientific and democratic decision-making. Improve legislative research mechanisms in agriculture and conduct in-depth research on industrial development, resource and environmental protection, operational mechanisms, state support and protection for agriculture, and protection of farmers’ rights and interests. Explore post-legislation assessment mechanisms to enhance scientific rigor and operability.**(36) Uphold and improve mechanisms for implementation.**  Improve feedback and correction mechanisms for major decisions and accountability systems; strengthen execution. Continue and improve joint meetings on key work, supervision systems, and leadership contact systems; intensify supervision of major matters and follow-through on general matters. Strengthen inspections and supervision to ensure implementation. Optimize internal institutions and staffing of agricultural departments in line with unity, efficiency, and aligned powers and responsibilities; and promote innovation in management concepts and mechanisms. Pilot performance evaluation in agricultural departments, exploring methods that combine internal assessment, public appraisal, and expert evaluation, and promote institutionalization and transparency.**(37) Strengthen management innovation and work style in the agricultural system.**  Deepen reform of administrative approvals; standardize licensing; and promote integrated approval services. Advance standardization of comprehensive agricultural law enforcement and solidly carry out enforcement in input regulation, agricultural product quality and safety, plant quarantine, GMO biosafety, wild plant and new variety protection, agricultural machinery supervision, grassland supervision, animal health supervision, and fisheries administration. Deepen Party conduct and clean government building; improve anti-corruption mechanisms; uphold democratic centralism; promote government transparency; strengthen checks and supervision on the exercise of power; intensify investigations and handling of violations; and prevent abuse of power for personal gain. Improve petition work in agriculture and address reasonable demands of the people.**(38) Solidly advance construction of model new countryside villages.**  Following the pattern of “jointly built by provinces and the ministry, with counties as the mainstay, actions at the village level, and benefits to households,” focus on modern agriculture and continue seven programs covering 28 practical undertakings for new countryside construction such as grain and income increases. Increase assistance to ensure 100 model and linked villages achieve phased goals, with notable results in production development and “one village, one product.” Launch a cooperation agreement with the China Development Bank to support new countryside construction. Intensify policy publicity; vigorously promote new concepts and practices; promptly share local innovations and experiences; and closely track new situations and problems. Explore mechanisms for experts from research, education, and extension institutions to be stationed in villages to provide assistance. Encourage and support leading enterprises to participate, and improve mechanisms that link their interests with those of farmers.All cadres and workers in the agricultural system should closely unite around the CPC Central Committee with Comrade Hu Jintao as General Secretary, hold high the great banners of Deng Xiaoping Theory and the important thought of the “Three Represents,” fully implement the Scientific Outlook on Development, seek truth from facts, pioneer and innovate, and work diligently to greet the successful convening of the 17th CPC National Congress with outstanding achievements.

农业部关于贯彻落实《中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅》的意⻅2025/9/12,10:44**中⽂**English⽆障碍2025年9⽉12⽇星期五农历本⽉23⽇秋分农业农村部邮箱**中国农业农村信息⽹**请输⼊关键字搜索**⾸页机构新闻****公开****政务服务专题互动数据业务管理**当前位置：⾸页>2007>第2期农业部关于贯彻落实《中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意见》的意见⽇期：2007-02-2010:48作者：来源：【字号：⼤中⼩】打印本页各省、⾃治区、直辖市及计划单列市农业、农机、畜牧、兽医、农垦、乡镇企业、渔业厅（局、委、办），新疆⽣产建设兵团农业局：为全⾯贯彻落实《中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意见》(中发〔2007〕1号，以下简称中央1号⽂件），现提出以下意见，请结合实际，认真抓好落实。**⼀、深刻认识积极发展现代农业、扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的重⼤意义，明确⼯作指导思想****（⼀）科学把握当前农业和农村经济形势。**近年来，各级农业部门认真落实中央部署，扎实推进社会主义新农村建设，农业和农村经济取得显著成绩。粮⾷⽣产实现连续三年增产，农民收⼊保持连续三年较快增长，农村各业平稳协调发展，农业和农村经济运⾏质量稳步提⾼，禽流感、⼜蹄疫等重⼤动物疫病防控取得新成效。农业和农村经济发展的好形势，为保持国民经济平稳较快发展发挥了重要的⽀撑作⽤。但必须看到，农业和农村经济仍处在艰难的爬坡阶段，农业基础不牢，设施装备落后，粮⾷稳定发展和农民持续增收难度加⼤，农业和农村经济⼯作任务⼗分艰巨。**（⼆）充分认识积极发展现代农业的重⼤意义。**农业发展关系国民经济和社会发展全局，农业丰则基础强，农民富则国家盛，农村稳则社会安。积极发展现代农业，是科学发展观在农业农村⼯作中的具体运⽤和落实，是社会主义新农村建设的⾸要任务，是促进粮⾷稳定发展、农民持续增收的根本途径，是实现农业可持续发展的必由之路。各级农业部门要从战略和全局的⾼度充分认识积极发展现代农业的重⼤意义，深⼊分析农业和农村经济发展的新形势，准确理解现代农业的科学内涵，明确建设现代农业的⽬标和任务，把握我国现代农业建设的特点和规律，⾛出⼀条具有中国特⾊的农业现代化道路。**（三）坚持以建设现代农业为重点做好农业和农村经济⼯作。**发展现代农业是农业和农村经济⼯作的重⼤主题，是农业部门的重要责任。做好2007年农业和农村经济各项⼯作，要以邓⼩平理论和“三个代表”重要思想为指导，全⾯落实党的⼗六届五中、六中全会精神和中央经济⼯作会议、中央农村⼯作会议各项部署，⽤科学发展观统领农业和农村经济⼯作，以发展现代农业为重点，继续实施“转变、拓展、提升”三⼤战略，着⼒强化政策、科技、设施装备、⼈才“四⼤⽀撑”，努⼒构筑优质粮⾷产业、⾼效经济作物和园艺产业、健康养殖业、农业产业化和农产品加⼯业、⽣物质和⽣态产业、农业服务业“六⼤产业”体系，巩固和发展农业农村经济的好形势，⼒争实现粮⾷总产量不低于上年⽔平和农民⼈均纯收⼊增长5%以上的⽬标。各级农业部门要切实理清⼯作思路，抓住⼯作重点，制定具体⼯作⽅案和配套措施，并认真组织实施。**⼆、认真落实中央⽀农惠农政策，保护和调动农民建设现代农业的积极性****（四）坚持农村基本经营制度不动摇。**稳定和完善农村⼟地承包关系，抓紧⼟地延包后续完善⼯作，切实解决⼟地承包中的突出问题，将农村⼟地承包经营权证全部发放到户。稳定渔民⽔域滩涂使⽤权，加强⽔域滩涂养殖证发放⼯作。健全在依法、⾃愿、有偿基础上的⼟地承包经营权流转机制，有条件的地⽅可发展多种形式的适度规模经营。抓好⼟地承包纠纷仲裁试点，促进农村⼟地承包纠纷仲裁⽴法加快进程，建⽴健全妥善化解农村⼟地承包问题的调处机制。积极推进征地制度改⾰，探索确保农民现实利益和长期稳定收益的有效办法。https://www.moa.gov.cn/nybgb/2007/deq/201806/t20180613_6151848.htmPage1of6农业部关于贯彻落实《中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅》的意⻅2025/9/12,10:44**（五）加⼤⽀农惠农政策落实⼒度。**积极争取财政和信贷⽀农资⾦，加⼤对现代农业建设的投⼊⼒度。积极推动完善粮⾷直接补贴、农业⽣产资料增⽀综合直补，加⼤良种补贴、农机购置补贴落实⼒度。落实重点地区、重点粮⾷品种最低收购价政策，推动完善最低收购价政策办法、健全制度。进⼀步管好⽤好⽀农资⾦，强化公开招标、补贴公⽰、直补到户等措施，确保把政策实惠落实到农户。统筹农业项⽬建设和资⾦安排，加⼤项⽬审计和监管⼒度，建⽴必要的处罚机制，切实提⾼项⽬建设效益。**（六）坚持不懈地做好减轻农民负担⼯作。**建⽴健全和严格执⾏减轻农民负担的各项制度，扩⼤农民负担综合治理范围，深⼊做好农民反映强烈问题的专项治理，探索建⽴减轻农民负担的长效机制，切实防⽌农民负担反弹。完善村民“⼀事⼀议”筹资筹劳管理办法，加⼤宣传培训、指导和监督管理⼯作⼒度，推动对“⼀事⼀议”建设公益性设施实⾏奖补制度，积极开展农村⼩型公益设施建设。巩固国有农场税费改⾰成果，切实减轻农业职⼯负担。**（七）积极参与农村社会保障和农业保险⼯作。**积极参与探索建⽴覆盖城乡居民的社会保障体系，推动在全国范围内建⽴农村最低⽣活保障制度。按照政府引导、政策⽀持、市场运作、农民⾃愿的原则，推动建⽴完善农业保险体系。推进农业政策性保险⽴法进程，扩⼤农业政策性保险试点范围。⿎励龙头企业和中介组织带动农户参加农业保险。积极推进农村⾦融改⾰，推动建⽴农村信贷担保基⾦或担保机构，缓解农户和农村中⼩企业贷款难问题。**三、加强农业基础设施建设，提⾼现代农业的设施装备⽔平****（⼋）加强耕地质量建设。**切实保护耕地特别是基本农⽥。按照⽥地平整、⼟壤肥沃、路渠配套的要求，加快建设旱涝保收、⾼产稳产的⾼标准农⽥。启动实施新⼀轮沃⼟⼯程，重点⽀持⼟壤改良与地⼒培肥设施和⽔肥耦合微⼯程建设。扩⼤⼟壤有机质提升补贴项⽬规模和范围，引导农民增加对⼟壤有机质的投⼊。⿎励农民发展绿肥、秸秆还⽥和施⽤农家肥，提⾼中低产⽥质量。**（九）提⾼农业可持续发展能⼒。**⼤⼒发展循环农业、⽣态农业，有条件的地⽅可以加快发展有机农业，启动有机农业基地建设。加快新农药、新药械、新技术的开发和推⼴，综合治理农业有害⽣物，倡导⽣物防治，推进绿⾊植保。加快实施退牧还草⼯程，加强草原防⽕和草原⿏⾍害防治⼯作，探索建⽴草原⽣态补偿机制。加强农业⾯源污染监测，加快重点流域的农业⾯源污染综合治理。加强农业植物种质资源及野⽣植物资源保护，加强种质资源的鉴定、开发与利⽤，积极防治外来⽣物⼊侵。加强农业转基因⽣物安全管理，促进农业⽣物技术健康发展。全⾯贯彻《中国⽔⽣⽣物资源养护⾏动纲要》，加强⽔⽣⽣物资源和渔业⽣态环境保护，坚持海洋伏季休渔和长江禁渔制度，加⼤渔业资源增殖放流⼒度。**（⼗）⼤⼒推进农业机械化。**改善农机装备结构，提升农机装备⽔平，加⼤先进适⽤农机化技术和机具的开发与应⽤。重点推进⼩麦、⽔稻、⽟⽶等主要农作物⽣产全程机械化，积极推进经济作物和林牧渔业、农产品初加⼯业机械化。努⼒扩⼤保护性耕作实施范围。建设农机化试验⽰范基地，⼤⼒推⼴⽔稻插秧、⼟地深松、化肥深施、秸秆粉碎还⽥等农机化技术。强化农机产品质量监督，进⼀步加强农机安全监理⼯作。**（⼗⼀）加强以沼⽓建设为重点的乡村清洁能源建设。**⼤⼒发展农村户⽤沼⽓，建⽴健全服务体系，⽀持有条件的地⽅开展养殖场和养殖⼩区⼤中型沼⽓建设。加强农村户⽤沼⽓的社会化服务和物业化管理体系建设。继续推进⽣态家园建设。在适宜地区积极发展太阳能、风能等清洁能源，在藏区进⼀步加⼤太阳能温暖⼯程实施⼒度。⼤⼒实施“乡村清洁⼯程”，推进⼈畜粪便、农作物秸秆、⽣活垃圾和污⽔的资源转化，发展农村废弃物和农业副产品资源循环利⽤。**（⼗⼆）⼤⼒加强渔业基础设施建设。**增加渔港、渔⽤航标、渔业安全救助通讯⽹、船位监测等设施建设的投⼊，加⼤对渔业安全监管⽀持⼒度，对渔业船舶安全救⽣设备和渔民职业安全培训给予适当补贴，努⼒构建平安渔业。加强⽔产原良种体系和⽔⽣动物防疫体系基础设施建设。加强⽔产品质检体系建设，更新质检中⼼检测设备，提⾼检测能⼒。**（⼗三）加快农业信息化建设。**健全农业信息收集和发布制度，整合涉农信息资源，推动农业信息数据收集整理规范化、标准化。加快建设⼀批标准统⼀、实⽤性强的公⽤农业数据库，加强数据库的应⽤和公共服务。深⼊实施“⾦农⼯程”，建⽴国家、省、市、县四级农业信息⽹络互联中⼼。实施好“三电合⼀”农业综合信息服务平台项⽬建设，启动农村信息化⽰范⼯程。加强农业遥感监测系统的建设和运⾏管理，提供准确、及时的遥感信息资料。https://www.moa.gov.cn/nybgb/2007/deq/201806/t20180613_6151848.htmPage2of6农业部关于贯彻落实《中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅》的意⻅2025/9/12,10:44**四、加快农业科技进步，提⾼科技对农业发展的贡献率****（⼗四）加强农业科技创新体系建设。**积极稳妥地推进部属“三院”农业科技体制改⾰，逐步解决改⾰过程中出现的新问题，优化运⾏机制，推进现代科研院所管理制度建设。整合农作物改良中⼼分中⼼、原原种基地、优粮⼯程区域创新中⼼、国家和部重点实验室等农业研究基地，发挥集成放⼤效应。⼤⼒推进农科教结合、产学研协作机制，探索跨省（区）的农业科技协作区建设，促进⼈员交流、资源共享和项⽬合作。实施好农业⾏业科研专项，选择若⼲主要农产品和重⼤共性关键技术，逐个设计技术解决⽅案，整合国内相关领域、不同层次的优势科技⼒量，开展协作创新，争取实现若⼲突破。尽快启动转基因⽣物新品种培育重⼤专项，继续实施超级稻研究与推⼴项⽬和农业科技跨越计划，加强中央级公益性科研院所基本科研业务费专项资⾦管理，强化基础性、前瞻性、战略性科技创新，加快农业科技成果的集成创新和中试熟化。通过项⽬引导、科企嫁接等⽅式，引导涉农企业开展技术创新。**（⼗五）推进农业科技进村⼊户。**积极探索农业科技⼈员和科技成果进村⼊户的有效机制和办法，形成以农业专家为源头、技术指导员为纽带、⽰范户为核⼼、农业新闻媒介为载体、连接周边农户的技术传播⽹络。提⾼农业科技⼊户⼯程的技术到户率和到⽥率，着⼒培育科技⼤户，发挥对农民的⽰范带动作⽤。实施种养业良种⼯程，努⼒扩⼤优良品种覆盖⾯，加快普及先进实⽤种养技术。**（⼗六）⼤⼒推⼴资源节约型农业技术。**积极开发运⽤各种节约型农业技术，提⾼农业资源和投⼊品使⽤效率。⼤⼒普及农⽥节⽔技术，启动旱作节⽔农业⽰范⼯程。扩⼤测⼟配⽅施肥的实施范围和补贴规模，促进科学施肥，提⾼肥料利⽤率。改⾰农业耕作制度和种植⽅式，加快普及农作物精量半精量播种技术，推⼴免耕栽培等轻简栽培技术。⼤⼒推⼴精准施药机械和技术，提⾼病⾍害防治效果和农药有效利⽤率。积极推⼴集约、⾼效、⽣态畜禽⽔产养殖和渔船节能技术，降低饲料和能源消耗。**（⼗七）着⼒培育新型农民。**扩⼤新型农民科技培训⼯程规模，实施好农村实⽤⼈才培训⼯程。积极发展种养专业⼤户、农机⼤户、农村经纪⼈、运销专业户等各类经营和市场流通主体。扩⼤“阳光⼯程”实施规模，提⾼补贴标准，创新培训⽅式，完善管理办法和实施⽅案，加强项⽬监管，提⾼培训质量。组织动员社会⼒量⼴泛参与农民转移就业培训。加强农民职业技能鉴定，从农民⼯中培育⼀批中⾼级技⼯。完善农村劳务输出机制，加强劳务输出基地建设，构建农村劳务开发体系，⼤⼒培育特⾊劳务品牌，多渠道促进农村劳动⼒转移就业。稳步推进农村劳动⼒平等就业试点，将农村劳动⼒就业纳⼊当地就业整体规划。制定实施各类⽀持政策，⿎励外出务⼯农民带技术、带资⾦回乡创业，成为建设现代农业的带头⼈。推进沿海捕捞渔民转产转业⼯程，积极开展渔民转产转业培训、渔业安全和涉外渔业培训。推进农村教育、医疗卫⽣和⽂化事业发展，积极参加科技、⽂化、卫⽣“三下乡”活动，办好农民科技书屋，提⾼农民综合素质。**五、深化农业结构调整，构建现代农业产业体系****（⼗⼋）加快发展优质粮⾷产业。**坚持⽴⾜国内保障粮⾷基本⾃给的⽅针，推进优质粮⾷产业⼯程建设，构建良种覆盖⼴、耕地质量好、品种质量优、产业链完整的优质粮⾷产业。努⼒稳定粮⾷⾯积，进⼀步保护和调动农民种粮积极性，引导农民合理安排种植结构，提⾼复种指数，种⾜种好粮⾷作物，今年⼒争粮⾷⾯积稳定在15.8亿亩以上。着⼒提⾼粮⾷单产，⼤⼒推⼴优良品种，普及重⼤技术，加强⽣产管理，搞好防灾减灾，⼤⼒开展粮⾷优质⾼产创建活动，实现良种良法配套，今年⼒争单产增长1%以上。优化粮⾷品种结构，⼤⼒发展优质⾼产作物，加快发展马铃薯产业。继续实施种⼦⼯程、植保⼯程等重⼤项⽬。推进优势粮⾷产业带建设，⿎励有条件的地⽅适度发展连⽚种植，加⼤对粮⾷加⼯转化的扶持⼒度。加⼤对粮⾷主产区的⽀持⼒度。进⼀步发挥⼤型垦区在发展优质粮⾷产业中的引领作⽤。**（⼗九）加快发展⾼效经济作物和园艺产业。**继续优化农业区域布局，加快建设优势农产品产业带。进⼀步加强棉花、油料、糖料、天然橡胶、热带作物等优势产业带建设，⽀持发展具有出⼜优势的蔬菜、⽔果、茶叶、⾷⽤菌等园艺产品。通过规划引导、政策⽀持、⽰范带动等办法，⽀持发展“⼀村⼀品”。加快培育⼀批特⾊明显、类型多样、竞争⼒强的专业村、专业乡镇。**（⼆⼗）加快发展健康养殖业。**转变养殖观念，调整养殖模式，发展健康养殖，做⼤做强畜牧⽔产业。认真贯彻《畜牧法》，实施畜禽养殖档案管理，加强种畜禽⽣产经营监管。进⼀步推进畜禽良种繁育体系建设，继续实施畜禽良种⼯程和奶⽜良种补贴项⽬。积极推⾏健康养殖⽅式，扩⼤标准化养殖⼩区补贴规模，提⾼畜禽粪便资源化利⽤⽔平。加强饲料安全监管，从源头上把好养殖产品质量安全关。牧区要积极推⾏禁牧休牧轮牧和草畜平衡制度，推⼴舍饲半舍饲圈养。⽔产养殖业要推⼴优良品种，继续实施⽔产良种⼯程，扩⼤⽔产健康养殖⽰范区建设规模，加强⽔产养殖品种病害防治，提⾼健康养殖⽔平。同时，积极发展远洋渔业，巩固提⾼过洋性渔业，加快开拓⼤洋性渔业。https://www.moa.gov.cn/nybgb/2007/deq/201806/t20180613_6151848.htmPage3of6农业部关于贯彻落实《中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅》的意⻅2025/9/12,10:44**（⼆⼗⼀）加快发展农业产业化和农产品加⼯业。**落实扶持农业产业化经营的各项政策，加强对龙头企业的指导和服务。结合优势农产品产业带建设和龙头企业加⼯需要，建设⼀批优势农产品加⼯产业群。继续开展农产品精深加⼯增值税改⾰试点，积极发展粮油、果蔬、畜产品、⽔产品等农产品加⼯业。⼤⼒推动农产品加⼯技术创新，把农产品加⼯业发展成为农业增效的⽀柱产业。**（⼆⼗⼆）加快发展⽣物质和⽣态等产业。**按照科学规划、合理布局、综合利⽤、保护⽣态、农民增收的原则，积极稳妥发展⽣态产业和⽣物质产业。开展全国能源作物资源调查与评价，制定全国能源作物科技⽀撑规划，加快开发以农作物秸秆为主要原料的⽣物质燃料、肥料、饲料等。启动农作物秸秆固体成型燃料和秸秆⽓化试点项⽬，⽀持秸秆饲料化利⽤。加强⽣物质产业技术研发、⽰范、储备和推⼴。按照“不与⼈争粮、不与粮争地”原则，⿎励有条件的地⽅利⽤荒⼭、荒地等资源，积极发展⽣物质原料作物，⽀持甜⾼粱、⽊薯等⽣物能源作物的良种繁育和推⼴种植。**（⼆⼗三）加快发展农业服务业。**加快推进种⼦管理体制改⾰，确保2007年7⽉1⽇前农业系统种⼦企业与⾏政管理部门完全脱钩，切实增强种⼦管理与服务能⼒。积极开展种⼦统供、肥料统测统配、重⼤病⾍害统防统治等⽣产服务。推进农产品批发市场升级改造，⽀持农产品市场流通基础设施建设和物流企业发展，发展连锁配送等新型流通⽅式。强化农产品市场信息服务，积极开展营销促销服务。⽀持龙头企业、农民专业合作组织等直接向城市超市、社区菜市场和便利店配送农产品。切实落实鲜活农产品运输绿⾊通道政策。推动规范健全农产品期货市场，充分发挥引导⽣产、稳定市场、规避风险的作⽤。拓展农机社会化服务领域，在重点农时季节组织开展跨区域的机耕、机播、机收作业服务。⿎励发展农机合作社、农机作业公司等各类新型农机经营服务组织。推动完善农民外出就业的制度保障，改善输出地对农民⼯就业的公共服务。**六、加强市场监管和动物疫病防控，提⾼农产品质量安全⽔平****（⼆⼗四）加强农产品质量安全监管。**认真贯彻《农产品质量安全法》，落实属地监管责任。强化⽣产环节监管，推进农产品标准化⽣产，加快标准化⽰范县（场）建设，建⽴⽣产记录和档案，推⾏产地准出制度。加强农产品⽣产环境和产品质量检验检测，推进⽆公害农产品、绿⾊⾷品、有机农产品认证，⽀持发展名牌农产品。强化农产品市场准⼊管理，落实包装标识制度，严格执⾏转基因⾷品、液态奶等农产品标识管理，加强农产品⽣产流通各环节的追溯管理和监督检查，推进全程监管。强化执法检查，扩⼤例⾏监测范围，加⼤抽查督查⼒度。依法履⾏监测信息发布职责，规范信息发布⾏为，提⾼农产品质量安全信息透明度。强化农产品质量安全管理制度与保障体系建设，启动农产品质量安全检验检测体系建设规划，健全应急管理的组织体系、运⾏机制和保障制度，加强执法队伍建设。**（⼆⼗五）加⼤农资市场整治⼒度。**坚持标本兼治、着⼒治本和属地管理原则，深⼊开展农资打假专项治理⾏动，进⼀步整顿和规范农资市场秩序，严厉打击假劣农资坑农害农⾏为，切实维护农民利益，为现代农业和新农村建设提供源头保障。进⼀步推进放⼼农资下乡进村活动，创建农业部定点农资市场，发展农资连锁、直供配送等现代农资经营模式，建⽴⼀批规范经营、质量可靠的放⼼农资店，推⾏农资诚信建设，建⽴农资监管长效机制。严格农药、兽药、种⼦、化肥、农机具、饲料和饲料添加剂等的监管，全⾯禁⽌使⽤甲胺磷等5种⾼毒有机磷农药，严厉打击⾮法经营和添加有害化学物质⾏为。**（⼆⼗六）切实加强重⼤动物疫病防控。**认真贯彻落实《重⼤动物疫情应急条例》，加强重⼤动物疫病防控。加强动物疫病防控体系和基础设施建设，继续实施动物防疫体系建设规划。集中⼒量开展春防、秋防免疫⾏动和全国免疫抗体交叉⼤检查，确保免疫密度和质量。加强疫情监测预警，健全应急预案，提⾼突发重⼤动物疫情应急处置能⼒。加强动物卫⽣监督执法，严格产地和屠宰检疫，规范市场、运输等环节监督检查。加快实施动物标识及其疫病溯源体系建设，提⾼我国动物疫病的监测⽔平和应急处置能⼒。加强和规范市场、运输等环节动物防疫监督检查。抓好⽆规定动物疫病区建设。加强兽药质量监管和兽药残留监控，严格执⾏安全⽤药规定。**七、深化农村改⾰和农业对外开放，增强现代农业建设的活⼒****（⼆⼗七）积极推动农村综合改⾰。**积极参与和推动以乡镇机构、农村义务教育和县乡财政管理体制改⾰为主要内容的农村综合改⾰。深⼊开展集体财务公开和民主管理，推进村级财务规范化建设，完善民主理财、审计监督等农村集体财务制度。全⾯清理核实村级债务和国有农场债务，摸清底数，锁定旧债，制⽌发⽣新债，积极探索化解债务的措施和办法。积极配合做好处理农业税尾⽋⼯作。**（⼆⼗⼋）加快推进基层农技推⼴体系改⾰。**全⾯贯彻落实《国务院关于深化改⾰加强基层农业技术推⼴体系建设的意见》，加强对基层https://www.moa.gov.cn/nybgb/2007/deq/201806/t20180613_6151848.htmPage4of6农业部关于贯彻落实《中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅》的意⻅2025/9/12,10:44农技推⼴体系改⾰的⽀持和指导，强化公益性职能，提升保障能⼒，改善推⼴条件，提⾼⼈员素质，创新服务模式，确保今年底基本完成改⾰任务。**（⼆⼗九）⼤⼒发展农民专业合作组织。**认真贯彻《农民专业合作社法》，⽀持农民专业合作组织加快发展。加⼤法律宣传培训⼯作⼒度，修订颁布⽰范章程。积极推动和配合有关部门抓紧制定相关配套法规和政策。抓好农民专业合作社建设⽰范项⽬，切实加强指导、扶持和服务，着⼒⽀持农民专业合作组织发展⽣产、开展市场营销、信息服务、技术培训、农产品加⼯储藏和农资采购经营。**（三⼗）全⾯推进兽医管理体制改⾰。**贯彻落实《国务院关于推进兽医管理体制改⾰的若⼲意见》，重点抓好乡（镇）畜牧兽医站和村级动物防疫员队伍建设，建⽴健全兽医⼯作体系和公共财政保障机制，确保省、市、县三级兽医⾏政管理、执法监督和技术⽀持机构于今年6⽉前顺利组建完成。**（三⼗⼀）加快推进农垦改⾰与发展。**继续改⾰农垦管理体制，创新经营机制，分离社会职能。进⼀步完善垦区⼟地承包关系，发展现代家庭农场。加⼤国有农场⼟地确权⼯作⼒度，维护国有⼟地合法权益。充分发挥农垦建设现代农业的⽰范带动作⽤，建设现代农业⽰范区，展⽰先进科学技术、标准化⽣产过程、产业化运作机制和可持续发展⽣态模式。积极利⽤农垦技术服务体系、队伍和设施，带动农场周边农民。加强垦地协作，积极为农村提供农业⽣产经营服务，带动农民进⼊市场。**（三⼗⼆）⼤⼒推进乡镇企业改⾰与发展。**引导乡镇企业加快产业聚集和区域合作，提⾼集聚效应。调整优化产业和产品结构，⽀持乡镇企业发展农产品加⼯和农村服务业。引导乡镇企业加快体制机制创新，⿎励乡镇企业⾃主创新，加⼤技术推⼴⼯作的⼒度。积极开展蓝⾊证书培训，加强信⽤担保、信息服务体系建设。扩⼤乡镇企业就业容量。开展乡镇企业治乱减负综合治理。**（三⼗三）继续加强农业国际合作。**引导和扶持经济实⼒较好、技术研发能⼒较强、管理⽔平较⾼的远洋渔业企业、农垦企业集团和龙头企业，拓展境外市场，利⽤境外资源，建⽴境外⽣产加⼯基地。⽀持农产品出⼜企业在国外市场注册品牌，开展海外市场研究、营销策划、产品推介活动。积极参与多边和双边农业磋商谈判，参与涉农国际公约、规则和标准制定。积极、稳妥、有效利⽤外资，加强农业先进适⽤技术的引进管理和技术⼈才交流。**（三⼗四）积极推进农业区域协调发展。**贯彻中央关于区域经济协调发展的精神和国家区域发展战略，进⼀步加强对西部、东北、中部和东部沿海地区农业和农村经济发展指导，加⼤对⾰命⽼区、民族地区、边疆地区、贫困地区、⽔库移民地区等特殊区域的⽀持⼒度，建⽴区域协调发展的长效机制。按照区域特点，制定该区域农业和农村经济发展的扶持政策。促进发达地区带动和帮助⽋发达地区农业和农村经济发展，扩⼤农业技术、⼈才培养等⽅⾯的对⼜援助和企业间经济合作。**⼋、强化⼯作落实和机制保障，确保完成各项⼯作任务****（三⼗五）加强对农业和农村经济重⼤问题调查研究。**围绕积极发展现代农业、扎实推进社会主义新农村建设和构建农村和谐社会等重⼤问题开展深⼊调研，提出具体政策措施，切实提⾼科学民主决策⽔平。健全农业⽴法调研制度，围绕农业产业发展、资源环境保护、农业经营机制、国家农业⽀持保护和农民权益保护等问题，深⼊开展农业⽴法调研。探索建⽴农业⽴法后评估制度，不断增强农业⽴法的科学性和可操作性。**（三⼗六）坚持和完善抓落实机制。**健全重⼤决策反馈纠偏机制和决策责任追究制度，强化⼯作执⾏⼒。继续坚持和完善重点⼯作联席会议制度、⼯作督导制度、领导联系点制度等制度，强化重⼤事项督查、⼀般事项督办等措施。加⼤监督检查⼒度，督促抓好落实。按照统⼀、效能和权责⼀致的原则，优化农业部门内设机构和⼈员配置，推进管理理念创新、机制创新。开展农业部门绩效评估试点⼯作，积极探索内部考核与群众评议、专家评价相结合的评估办法，推动绩效评估制度化、公开化。**（三⼗七）加强农业系统管理创新和作风建设。**继续深化农业⾏政审批制度改⾰，规范⾏政许可⾏为，推进⾏政审批综合办公。推进农业综合执法规范化，切实抓好农资监管、农产品质量安全、植物检疫、农业转基因⽣物安全、野⽣植物和新品种保护、农机监理、草原监理、动物卫⽣监督、渔政管理等执法。深⼊开展农业系统党风廉政建设，进⼀步健全反腐倡廉的体制机制。坚持民主集中制，深⼊推⾏政务公开，强化权⼒运⾏的制约和监督机制，加⼤对违法违纪案件查处⼒度，防⽌以权谋私。做好农业信访⼯作，认真解决农民群众合理诉求。**（三⼗⼋）扎实推进新农村⽰范村建设。**按照“省部共建、主抓靠县、⾏动在村、实惠到户”的⼯作格局，以建设现代农业为中⼼任务，继https://www.moa.gov.cn/nybgb/2007/deq/201806/t20180613_6151848.htmPage5of6农业部关于贯彻落实《中共中央国务院关于积极发展现代农业扎实推进社会主义新农村建设的若⼲意⻅》的意⻅2025/9/12,10:44续抓好新农村建设⽰范增粮增收等七项活动28件实事。进⼀步加⼤帮扶⼒度，促进100个⽰范村和联系村实现阶段性⽬标，特别要在⽣产发展、“⼀村⼀品”⽅⾯取得明显成效。启动与国家开发银⾏合作⽀持新农村建设部⾏合作协议。加⼤政策宣传⼒度，⼤⼒宣传现代农业和新农村建设中的新理念、新实践，及时传递各地的新创造、新经验，密切关注新情况、新问题。积极探索农业科研、教学、推⼴等单位专家驻村帮扶的机制。⿎励和⽀持龙头企业参与新农村建设，注重建⽴和完善龙头企业与农户合理的利益联结机制。农业系统⼴⼤⼲部职⼯要紧密团结在以胡锦涛同志为总书记的党中央周围，⾼举邓⼩平理论和“三个代表”重要思想伟⼤旗帜，全⾯贯彻落实科学发展观，求真务实，开拓创新，扎实⼯作，以优异的成绩迎接党的⼗七⼤胜利召开。扫⼀扫在⼿机打开当前页相关新闻

name_chn: 未来十年粮食价格将居高
